text: At about 4.5' tall, this lamp is the perfect height. It's not so tall that it gets in the way of things, but it's tall enough that it can light up much more than just the floor. The assembly process isn't nearly as bad as I was expecting, and during the assembly you get to feel the weight of each product which lets you know how high-quality of a product this is. Unfortunately this lamp isn't dimmable, which would have been nice, but you can change the angle of the lights which is great. I pointed them all at either the ground or the wall, which provides light without it shining directly in people's eyes. It's very nice to be able to play with the position of the lights to get exactly what you want, and the lamp still looks very good even with this functionality. The lamp is turned on with a button on the floor, I'm pretty sure it's supposed to be pressed with your foot. This can be very nice if your hands are full or something, but the floor button makes it difficult to tuck this light behind something in a corner because you need to be able to access the button on the floor. Overall it's a great lamp, and it's a very nice addition to my home. The price is exactly what I think this product is worth, so it's not INCREDIBLE for the price but it's not overpriced either.Note: I received this product for free in exchange for my evaluation, but that doesn't affect my review in any way.

I see many people complaining about the assembly for this lamp, and while it did take me about 45 minutes to assemble, the final product is worth it. You could easily pay $300+ for a lamp like this, and yeah, maybe that one will come assembled or at least have an easier assembly process. However, you aren't paying nearly that much for this lamp, and you are still getting the same quality in the finished product. The overall look of this lamp is great, it can improve the look of almost any room, no matter what the room design is. My only complaint is the red cord, it really doesn't go with the rest of the lamp at all and I'm not sure why Brightech decided to go with red for the cord. Other than the red cord however, I love this lamp. It looks great in my living room, and whenever I have people over at least one person comments on the lamp or asks where I got it. The best part is when I tell them the price, many people don't believe me. I've had several people go on their phones and order this lamp immediately after I tell them where to get it, people like it that much. The pictures on Amazon aren't THAT great however, I believe the lamp looks better in person.Note: I received this product for free in exchange for my evaluation but that doesn't affect my review in any way.

This lamp is great for reading, as it doesn't take up a ton of space and it is still pretty bright. You can easily adjust the brightness, which is very nice, and its full white design can look good in modern homes. The red cable seems a little out of place, however, and I think I would prefer either a black or white cable. I also don't think this lamp would look very good in an old library or something similar, like I said it seems to be designed for more modern homes.Pros:- Very easy assembly- Bright- Dimmable- Flexible- Very white light- Very sturdily built- Tactile on/off switch, it gives a nice clicky sound when you turn it on and offCons:- Red cord- A little wobbly due to the somewhat-light baseOverall it's a very nice lamp, one that is great for studying or reading light. This lamp blows away many similar lamps in terms of build quality, and I'm sure you would pay much more for a lower-quality lamp in an actual store. I was received this lamp for free to review, and after using it for a bit I was very surprised when I saw how much it costs. I was expecting $100+, and for that price it would have been a good lamp. The fact that it's so much cheaper than that seems pretty crazy, as this is an excellent lamp.

5:41 Mins This item is definitely very cheap feeling, upon pulling it out of the box it doesn't feel like a high quality item at all. This was further enforced when the little tab broke off - instantly getting rid of many of this device's features (No longer Waterproof/Dustproof). The solar panel didn't really do anything to charge the power bank no matter how long I left it in the sun, and as I said the port-covering tab broke off so it was no longer Waterproof/Dustproof shortly after I got it. That leaves us with the LED light on the back, the charging indicators, and the shockproof-ness as features "above a totally stripped down power bank". These three features work quite well, and LED on the back is actually a very nice addition. It's kind of disappointing that roughly half of this power bank's features don't work right out of the box, but the features that do work work pretty well. I go much more in depth in the video, if you want to watch that.

5:01 Mins This player does what it's supposed to do very well, but for the price or even cheaper, you can get a player/writer from a name brand, and it will have more features and it will be of higher build quality. This ZhiZhu player is pretty cheaply made, as I show in the video. It looks really good and like I said, it does what it's supposed to do. I just think that what it's "supposed to do" isn't enough for the price that it costs. The addition of DVD writing would help, but currently I do not believe that this product is a very good choice considering the numerous (and even less expensive?) alternatives.

9:55 Mins In the video I cover what I like and dislike about this speaker, and I show the pairing process and how the speaker works. My least favorite thing about this speaker is the fact that you can't control the alert sounds' volume, such as when you turn on the speaker or turn down the volume too far. These alerts are really loud, and so you can be playing music really quietly and the speaker will be low on battery or something and play a really loud alert sound. If you are mostly using this outside or in a loud environment it is fine, but trying to use this speaker to quietly play music in a quiet environment will most likely be a somewhat aggravating experience.

8:03 Mins This speaker supposedly has many features that are in addition to its "main" Bluetooth function, such as a built in radio, a micro SD card slot, and an aux input option. Out of these features, I could get only the Bluetooth to work. I own at least 30 other Bluetooth Speakers, so I would say it's the speaker not working rather than user error. However I did not see an instruction manual included, and a manual could have possibly solved a few of my problems. This leaves us with a Water/Dust Resistant Bluetooth speaker that feels pretty cheap for its cost. If all of the other features worked as advertised it would be worth the money, but factoring in the build quality and the features that don't work I wouldn't say it's worth the money. The Water/Dust resistance does work very well, and the Bluetooth portion works very well. However it's still a pretty cheap-feeling speaker, and while all of the features could have made up for this, because they don't work, you're just left with a pretty cheap Bluetooth speaker.Note: I received this item for free in exchange for an honest review

The pillow itself comes with a sleeping mask, a couple sets of ear plugs, and some e-books about sleeping and such if you're interested in that. I didn't use anything but the pillow, but my experience with the pillow as been very positive. This pillow is quite a bit smaller than my other memory foam pillows, but the shape of this pillow is very nice for people with neck and back problems. I used to sleep funny on my neck and that was the only reason for my neck pain, but with this pillow I no longer experience any neck pain throughout the day. I think it's a little funny how good they claim this pillow to be, but it definitely is comfortable to sleep on and my sleep has been improved. The actual pillow comes in a purple ribbon inside the box, which again is a little funny, (I mean, it's a pillow), but I suppose it's a nice touch and it shows that Smarter Rest is really proud of their product. Their support + my recommendation + all of the other positive reviews for this pillow definitely point towards this being a good purchase, and I believe it will improve your sleeping experience. I didn't even think I could get a pillow much better than the one I was sleeping on before this one, and so if you are sleeping on an "eh" pillow currently, the difference will be astounding.Note: I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest feedback. The fact that I received this product at a discounted rate does not affect my review in any way.

5:20 Mins This power bank is great; it's easy to use, very portable, and it actually charges your phone a decent amount. I personally love the fact that it has a built in laser pointer, if you were honestly looking for a really good cat toy this would do. It's a re-chargeable laser pointer, something you don't see all that often. Compared to the little ones you see at the pet store or something, this one is a tiny bit more expensive but you won't have to buy specific batteries for it a week later. Of course its min purpose is being a power bank, but I think the addition of a laser pointer is great.

I've reviewed several other "Selfie Sticks" in the past, and this one is definitely the most portable out of all of them. It only extends 31", which is less than some selfie sticks, but I have found that extending any more than this causes the pole to bow and become very unstable. The main pole telescopes out from the handle like every other selfie pole, so this isn't the reason it's so portable. What makes it portable is the way the "phone holder" part at the top of the monopod folds down onto the handle when not in use. This creates a very compact package, making this Selfie pole ideal for traveling. There is only one con that I have seen - you can't actually remove the phone holder from the monopod. Theoretically you could still put a small point and shoot or a GoPro into the phone holder, but almost every other selfie pole I have seen has a feature where you can remove the phone mount and it reveals a 1/4" threading for mounting the majority of cameras. This would be significantly more secure than putting your camera in the phone holder. So while you can still use this Selfie Pole with a standard camera, if you are going to be doing this frequently, I would definitely buy a different Selfie Stick. However if you are going to be using this strictly with your mobile phone, this is a great choice for these reasons -- The Selfie Stick is very well made, I can't imagine it breaking any time soon- The rubber on the handle provides very nice grip- It recharges quickly and then lasts a very long time- You can adjust the angle at which your phone sits at the top of the pole- There is a built-in camera button, no timers or using an external remote or anything- There is a wrist strap for added security, but you can easily remove this if you want toOverall this is a great selfie stick if you are wanting to take photos with your mobile phone and only your mobile phone, but due to the inability to remove the phone holder and mount a "real" camera directly using a tripod threading, I would look elsewhere if you are planning on using a camera or a GoPro rather than a mobile phone.

I'm not so sure about the supposedly added Pheromones and such inside of this cologne, I haven't noticed any females being more interested in me or anything like that. However, many people (especially people of the opposite gender) have commented on how great the cologne smells. I personally love the smell of it, and while more than 2 squirts is pretty overpowering, if you have the right amount on, you'll smell great all day. This isn't only me saying this, like I said, I get a lot of compliments while wearing this cologne.

What we get in the box are 6 individual boxes each containing a bubble-wrapped lightbulb. Unfortunately, one of the light bulbs still managed to break. I didn't take off a star because when I received this lightbulb kit it was in a very, very large box containing many other items. It was definitely moving around quite a bit inside of this box, and so I'm sure this is why one of the bulbs broke. If you were to order this item individually, I can almost guarantee you would be perfectly fine. I'm sure if I contacted Brightech they would replace the broken bulb or do even better than that without blinking an eye. I received these samples for free in exchange for my honest feedback so I'm not going to contact Brightech for a replacement, but most companies that offer an 18 month warranty have very good customer service.As for the actual lights -These would look very cool if you had the actual bulb showing, such as in a clear-glass lamp or something similar. The shape is different than your "traditional" light bulb, and the filaments inside the bulb are also very different. I unfortunately don't have any lights that would show the bulbs off, but I put them in the lights above my kitchen table. These lights are dimmable, so I was a little worried about how well the bulbs would work. I'm happy to say that the bulbs work on a dimmer switch, and they work even better than a lot of bulbs. Especially above a kitchen table, these light bulbs create very nice mood lighting. They give off a very orange light, and because they're only 40w, they create just enough light to see but not much more than that. Reading under these lights would be difficult, but if you're going for that fancy-restaurant type atmosphere, these bulbs are great.

This little device will take music playing from a phone, iPod, mp3 player, etc. and amplify the sound, as the title says. This is all without any wires, set up, or Bluetooth. What surprised me was that it actually worked; and it worked pretty well.This product requires 3 AA batteries, and once you've put them in and turned on the Signal Booster, you've done really all of the setup that you need to do. You then just start playing music through a device's speaker (The device must have a built in speaker, some iPods and MP3 players won't work) and set the device on the amplifier. Make sure to place the device's speaker towards the blue light/power button on the amplifier, and if you don't hear your music being amplified, slide your device around a little until you do. If you're still having trouble, make sure the amplifier is on and try turning up the music on your device a bit.The amplifier is about the size of a standard computer mouse, so if you were wanting to travel with it or something you definitely could. There are also little rubber feet to prevent the signal booster from sliding around, and the entire signal booster is coated in a rubbery-plastic material that feels good, and it will prevent your phone/iPod from sliding around.The only con with this product is the fact that the amplified signal can be very distorted. If you are using this at pretty low volumes you shouldn't have any problem, but once you reach a volume slightly louder than what the iPhone 6 can output, the signal starts becoming distorted. The louder you go, the more distortion there is. This device can easily make a good song not worth listening to, so you will be fairly limited with volume on this device.Overall, this device's simplicity and ease of use outweighs the lack of overall quality. I wouldn't say that this device is worth any more than $15, and it's currently priced at $20. However if you don't care much about sound quality or you aren't looking to play music all that loudly, this isn't a bad product to spend your money on.

I personally use these keys on a Das Keyboard 4 Ultimate. This keyboard doesn't have any key indicators, so the metal keys give me a good reference point while typing AND they look really cool. I was expecting the keys so get greasy/collect fingerprints really easily, but that is not the case. The keys have a very nice weight to them, so when you first pick them up you get the indication that you have purchased a high-quality product. Because of the weight I thought typing on these keys would feel different than the rest of the keys, but I'm happy to say that that's not the case. Overall I would recommend these to anyone that is either replacing keys or wants to personalize their keyboard a bit. Shipping is a bit costly for the speed at which is shipped, but I am very happy with this WASD key set and I would highly recommend it.

8:08 Mins The case looks nice, it feels pretty cheap, and it's very difficult to remove. In the video I go much more in depth, and I talk about protection, feel, and show you what the installed case looks like from all angles.

The title for this listing says "Pack of 3", and the picture has an "x3" on it. For this reason I thought I would be getting three of these cables, but I only got one. However, this one cable was only $1.93, and it works very well. I used it to connect a mouse to my HP Stream 7, and there were 0 problems. 11:21 Mins In the video I show how to set up and use the humidifier, and I talk about how well it works. This is definitely one of the best looking humidifiers that I've seen, and all of the features compliment that very nicely.

9:23 Mins I don't really enjoy the style of wallet cases, I mostly use rugged cases. However, this is a very, very nice wallet style case. It's not even necessarily just how good the case is that makes it a worthy purchase, it's all of the other factors that come with the case: The lifetime warranty, the excellent packaging, the glass screen protector. I would buy this case alone, but all of these other factors make it by far the best wallet case you could purchase for your iPhone 6

11:25 Mins I'm not too fond of battery cases, but this is a good case if you are fine with the extra bulk battery cases come with. My only complaint is that this case is pretty difficult to remove from your phone, so if you are wanting to switch cases frequently you may have a difficult time.

My carpet looks pretty clean to the naked eye, but simply turning this light on changed my mind. I can see stains that I thought I cleaned up, and while I can't normally see them, I can see them with this light. I shined this around my cats' litter box and I noticed that they didn't always make it. So many things were exposed with this light, I can't believe I walk around bare footed on this carpet. As for the actual light, it does its job very well; disgustingly well. The light is turned on by pushing a button on the back, so one handed operation is easy. The flashlight is made out of metal, so you will be able to gross yourself out for a long time due to this light's durability. The wrist strap seems unnecessary, but I guess if you see something super disgusting and you want to drop the light, the strap will make sure the gross thing doesn't go away by keeping the light on your wrist. The flashlight takes 3 AAA batteries, and I was very happy that they were included. To put the batteries in you just unscrew the back of the light, nothing super complicated. You can also unscrew the top of the light apparently, although it takes a bit longer (more threading). If you remove both the back/bottom and the top of the light and then take out the batteries, it becomes a hollow tube. This seems pretty useless but maybe it's for cleaning the inside of the light or something. It's also possible that TaoTronics just wanted you to be able to access the batteries from either side of the light, but I'm not sure. Overall I would recommend this light for anyone that wants to A) Clean up blood after a murder B) See how disgusting their carpet really is C) Identify counterfeit money D) Have a great little portable blacklight. It's good for many things, and it's not even that expensive.

The wallet looks and feels very nice - the only thing I noticed was that it attracts fingerprints very easily. The fingerprints are also pretty difficult to wipe off, just something to keep in mind. In a closed position the wallet is a little bit bigger than a credit card and roughly 10x as thick. The hinge and casing both feel like they're going to last a while, which is nice to see on something that you use as frequently as a wallet. You push a little button at the top to open the wallet, and it simply snaps closed. Inside of the wallet is a little plastic fan that is very well set in place. You can remove it if you wish, but it is attached in a way that is meant to be permanent. It's attached enough that it won't come out with use, but if you really wanted to remove it you could. With the fan in place I was able to fit 7 cards inside of the wallet. I put in the 8th card and then the wallet wouldn't stay closed. I've seen some people remove the fan and fit a few more cards in, but then all of your cards and such are super unorganized and I'm not sure why you would want to do that. It's personal preference, but I like the fan. I personally carry quite a few cards. I have gift cards that I carry around just in case, as well as all my credit/debit cards, membership cards, and my ID. This adds up to about 12 cards, which is simply too much for this wallet. 7 was the limit with the fan in place; even less if you actually want to carry any cash. As for the RFID blocking, I don't really have any way of testing it. I didn't get this wallet for that purpose, but I read one review that says it isn't totally RFID safe. If you are looking specifically for the RFID blocking feature, I'd suggest you look elsewhere. If you don't carry many cards and you are looking for a stylish, high-quality wallet, this is a great option.

There are many dual port USB car chargers, but this one adds two USB ports while still giving you access to three Cigarette Lighter ports. We have a 2.1A USB port that will charge cell phones and small devices optimally, and then we have a 1A port that will charge much older phones. Unfortunately there is no 2.4A port, so tablets and larger devices will experience slower charging times. When plugged in, this device looks very cool. The insides of the ports light up blue, along with little pieces on the top. Included with the device is an extra fuse and two adhesive pads for adhering this device to your car. The device is small; about the size of a pack of cards. This allows it to fit comfortably in your car without really having to make room for it. Overall this is a very useful device. If you find yourself needing to charge several devices while driving, this is definitely a great option. It will allow you to charge two USB devices and 3 devices powered via cigarette lighter. Some cars have 3 cigarette lighters, but this one puts them all in the same place and adds more regardless.

This charger is almost exactly the same size as the one included with Apple's iPads, but this one has two USB ports rather than one. Both of these ports are 2.4A, meaning that they can charge larger devices at optimal speeds even if you are charging two devices at once. The device is compact, as I said it's the same size as the iPad's USB-Wall adapter. Because of this it only takes up one outlet space and it doesn't cover any spaces. The charger has prongs that can fold up into the device, so it's very good for traveling. When you plug this device into the wall, the insides of the USB ports light up. They aren't obnoxiously bright, just bright enough that you can plug things into them in the dark. The overall design is a sleek black, with a simple MyOho logo and some information about the device. It can get a little greasy from picking it up with your hands, but no fingerprints stuck to it. Overall this is a great compact little device. It will allow you to free up wall space by compacting two USB-Wall adapters into one. What I think is impressive is that it's the same size as one of the iPad's chargers, but it's charging capabilities are equivalent to two of them.

This charger is very large; I have 6 port chargers that are smaller, or at least the same size. This makes this device take up two outlet spaces, so even though it only uses one it covers the other. It may be ideal to plug this into an extension cord or something similar because of this. The charger does exactly as it says, and it does it very well. This device allows you to be rid of multiple USB-Wall adapters, and instead you just have this one charger. The charger plugs into the wall, and you can charge up to 4 USB devices simultaneously. We have 2 2.4A ports or "PowerCharger" ports, and we have 2 2.1A ports or "Universal" ports. Older phones or smaller devices will only need 2.1A to change at the optimal speed, but if you were to plug an iPad into a 2.1A port it would charge very slowly. For this reason there are two "PowerCharger" ports. This will allow you to charge larger devices at the highest possible speed, rather than being stuck with only 2.1A ports. It would've been nice to see "Smart" ports that automatically adjust the amperage based on the type of device you are trying to charge, it's just a little less convenient to have to pay attention to what port you're plugging your device into. Overall this device charges things very quickly, and while it is very bulky, it's less bulky than 4 separate USB-Wall adapters.

In the box we find the Keyboard, the User Manual, and the Micro-USB charging cable. The keyboard contains a lithium battery so you don't have to worry about the battery's memory if you decide to charge the keyboard before it's totally dead. This is the first wireless backlit keyboard that I have ever seen, and it looks a lot nicer than your average bluetooth keyboard because of this. I've mostly been using this keyboard on Mac, so I will mostly be reviewing it based on my experience with that particular platform.Build Quality -The description for this keyboard says it's stainless steel but in reality the only stainless steel you see while using this keyboard is a little strip along the bottom. The entire back of the keyboard is stainless steel, but you don't see that while typing. The material used still strengthens the keyboard so that even though the keyboard's face is plastic, it feels like a high quality keyboard. The keys all feel very sturdy while typing; on some cheaper keyboards I have noticed the keys to be a bit sticky or wobbly. On this keyboard typing is really easy and all of the keys register perfectly. I have also noticed some delay on certain Bluetooth keyboards, but I didn't find any with this one. The only small thing that I've noticed is the Spacebar is really squeaky. Every other key sounds pretty normal, but the Spacebar squeaks whenever I press it with any reasonable amount of speed, and it can be really annoying while typing, I can't imagine that this is meant to be this way, so there's a good chance that you won't have this problem.Keys -This isn't necessarily the quality of the keys because I went over that up there ^^^, this is more of the specific keys and their functions. One thing I noticed is that if you are used to typing on a Mac keyboard, the bottom left key order is different. On Mac's it goes "Fn, Control, Option/Alt, Command" but on this keyboard it goes "Control, Function, Windows, Alt". The Windows key on this keyboard functions as the Command key on Mac, but its placement has me constantly hitting the Alt key instead of the Win/CMD key. I am used to having the Command Key closest to the Spacebar, and that's not the case with this keyboard. We also have a special button not found on normal keyboards, and this button controls the brightness/color of the backlight. This key is on the right side, and it replaces the second Win/CMD key that would be found on a standard keyboard. This means the only Command key is on the left hand side of the keyboard, which could make certain commands a little difficult. Pressing this key switches the backlight between [Off], [Dim], and [Bright]. To switch between our 7 color options we hold down this key and press the up/down arrows. This switches between the keyboard's colors, and then you can change the brightness as I said. Another thing that is a little annoying is the need to hold down the Fn key to press Escape. On Mac I haven't found that the upper left key does anything except when holding Fn to make it function as the escape key which is used pretty frequently. This means in certain key command you are having to hold down the Fn button as well, whereas normally you would just be able to press escape. I'm not sure if there is a way to change this, but this is how it is originally set up. The escape key functions as the Home key on iPad, and there is no need to press the Fn key if you are using it for that. Our "C" key functions as the Bluetooth connection key. It's normal function is the letter C of course, but when you hold down Fn and press C the keyboard will go into pairing mode. This is an alternate to a dedicated Bluetooth button, and unless the fairly large Bluetooth logo on the C key annoys you, I think giving the C key two functions was a good idea. This keyboard is also lacking an eject button, which can be a huge turn-off for people that rely on this key. Many modern Laptops don't even have an Optical drive but if yours does and you need to use it, you will have to find another way to eject disks. On a Macbook Pro, I found the only alternative was to press the built in eject button. This kind of defeats the purpose of a separate, wireless keyboard, but if you don't use the Eject function all that often it's not a big deal.Battery -While the battery on this keyboard isn't as good as other Bluetooth keyboards I have used, it still boasts a 64 hour battery life. This is about what I got out of it, and I never turned the Keyboard off. I relied on it going to sleep, and it didn't consume much battery power while it was in this mode. After a few seconds of inactivity the Backlight automatically turns off, which definitely helps with conserving battery power. The good news is that even if this keyboard dies, you can just recharge it. So many Bluetooth keyboards require either AA or AAA batteries, and rechargeable keyboards are much, much nicer in my opinion. This keyboard can supposedly go 100 days without dying while in standby mode, but I haven't had it long enough to test that.Weird connection issue -The only actual problem I have had with this keyboard is its ability to maintain connection. I am currently typing this review on this GMYLE keyboard connected to a Macbook Pro that is connected to an external display. The MacBook is charging, and it is 8 inches from this keyboard. This keyboard has become disconnected 6 times throughout the typing of this review. I get a little notification that says "connection lost" and then 5 seconds later, automatically without me doing anything, I get another notification that says "connected". I'm not sure why this is, I haven't had any problems with my other Bluetooth keyboards in this exact setup. I haven't seen other reviewers mentioning this, so maybe there's something interfering with my connection, but it has been really annoying.Overall this is a really nice looking keyboard. The backlight allows you to type in the dark, and it makes the keyboard look cool. Not only does it have a backlight, but you can customize the color and brightness. This makes for a really nice keyboard, and the stainless steel design enforces this. My only major complaints are it randomly disconnecting and the squeaky space bar. The other things  (the lack of an eject button, the order of the lower left buttons and having to hold down Fn to access Escape) are annoying, but they can be worked around and I wouldn't consider them to be major flaws. I didn't drop a star for it disconnecting just because most of the features of this keyboard are really nice, and I think it disconnecting is something I and only I am experiencing. I could be wrong about this, and if you also experience this feel free to comment on this review so the people know.

I like this cleaner, as it has no offensive smell and doesn't go up your nose while trying to clean. I have three dogs and although they don't make a mess in the house, one is a puker. This spray does the job of cleaning up the residue. I tried using it on older stains, but they did not come up.I am also using this where I keep my chinchillas. They can really reek of urine at times. This does an okay job of neutralizing the odor until I can get in there with the Lysol Power and wash the trays.

This is a nice ingredient for homemade hair oils and homemade shaving lotion. It has no scent, so you can add your own favorite essential oil to personalize it. It absorbs well, so it also makes a wonderful massage oil.

I was looking for fractionated coconut oil to use in my homemade skin products. This one didn't have the prettiest label, but it's nice and cheap. I use this as an ingredient in lotion bars and shaving lotion. It has no scent. I like that it is not overly thick like castor oil is, as oils that are too thick can mess up formulas.As far as cooking with this, I would be more comfortable sticking with the unrefined version. I would not feed this version of the oil to my dogs either, but I think it would be okay to use on their coats.

My dogs love these. They are raw fed and I really don't like giving them biscuits for treats. The package I received had whole hearts, not sliced or nuggets. The smaller ones were okay for my 30 lb mini Shar-Pei. If your dog is on the small side, these may be too large for them to enjoy unless you reconstitute them and cut them up.I can buy fresh chicken hearts at the Asian market, but turkey hearts are harder to find, so this makes a nice snack for my dogs.

This is a high dose Vitamin D which is great for those with a deficiency. Being outside is often not enough and milk, if you drink it, has a pitiful amount of D3. Those suffering from lack of this hormone may experience pains in the back and legs that are hard to explain. Mood swings can also occur. D3 is best taken with a multi-vitamin that is tailored to your needs (ie, women's, senior, etc).The Viva Labs gels are small and only need to be taken once a day or every other day depending on your needs. As someone who needs to take this daily, I really appreciateâ€‹ this product.

I love this bunny, it is so totally cute. Make sure you set the language you want right after pulling the tag out. If you mess it up or want to change the language later, just take the batteries out and put them back in. Choose your language (red ear for English) and hold bunny's hand to set it.This is an educational toy that lights up and play music. There is an upbat song that plays when two ears are squeesed at once. In night time mode, there is a gentler song that seems to go on for quite a while. The color changing belly is very nice, though. The body holds the plastic battery pack, so it is hard. The head, hands, and feet are soft. Sound quality is not bad for a toy like this.I think this is a great toy for a baby or even a toddler or older child who likes rabbits.

This tree is pretty cheesy, but I guess that's what you get for $13. It does not look anywhere as nice as in the picture. It arrived in a crushed box but was not damaged. It needs to be fluffed out and the lights may need to be restrung. This runs on 3 AA batteries, so you don't have to worry about having an outlet nearby. It shed a little but once it was decorated and cleaned up, it seemed okay. The stand works fine and will look cute when surrounded by smaller presents.The lights can be turned on or off but also have a horrible flashing feature most will want to avoid. This tree is fine for a kid's room or for someone who just wants to decorate a table top. I had some mini Xmas' balls that were perfect for this size tree.

I always seem to feel as though my skin is in better condition when taking fish oil. These pills are on the larger size but not hard to swallow. The lemon flavor will only be noticeable if you keep the gels in your mouth for a few seconds. It is very subtle, not an in your face lemon flavor. No fishy taste or fish burps were experienced while taking these. This is a nice supplementâ€‹.

This snowman lights up and changes colors. It is very pretty. I am not happy how the hanging part is crooked.  The ornament switches on from the bottom and is ready to go. Just make sure to keep it somewhere where it can't easily fall or get broken.

I've been taking these for a while. I get decent results taking two each evening. I also supplement with vitamin D which helps a lot. These are a lower dosage, which make them good for opening and sprinkling on my dog's breakfast.  I've never had any problems with these and they are easy to swallow. If you prefer smaller sized pills, give these a try.

This is a raw honey. Manuka is an acquired taste for some, but this is one of the better tasting brands, in my opinion. This honey is used on minor wounds to help speed healing.  This is a good all-purposeâ€‹ healer to have on hand.

I made some bath salts but realized that the metal twist cap on my mason jar could get rusted if stored in the shower. I had this item in my wish list in case I ever needed it. This makes pouring the salts out easy. The cap twists on perfectly, and the cap locks in place. This is a very sturdy item. It is also useful for pouring salad dressings. The pink cap looks nice on my purple pint sized jar.The wide mouth fits both my quart sized and my pint sized wide mouth jars. Very strong plastic and no stringy bits.

I've been trying to find a silk or leather corded necklace for some of my pendants. They all seemed to have terrible reviews, so I opted for this rubber one. I have several sterling silver chains, but some larger pendants just look nicer and stand out more on a black or red cord. The cord itself seems sturdy and can hold my huge sterling silver jade pendant with no issues. This product does need some reshaping as it arrives a bit bent and lumpy. This material should warm to your skin and lay correctly eventually. You can also stretch this a little, but be gentle. The clasp has a tiny stamp on it indicating sterling silver. Not sure what the other parts are made of.This style is fine for a man or woman. It is 4mm, so make sure that the bale on your pendant can fit on this. Some charms may need an enhancer. If you have a thicker neck, you may want to consider going up one size from what one with a skinny neck would wear. This is a decent cord for many different looks, whether you are a rock n roller, goth, into new age crystals, or just want something to show off a cute charm. With theâ€‹ right enhancer, this can also provide a new twist to elegant estate pieces and give them a fresh new look.So although this cord costs more than many other black cords on Amazon, it doesn't seem like a piece of junk that will break in a month. I do not wear my necklaces all the time, so I cannot speak as someone who does that or as someone who would wear this in the shower.  I took off one star for it being bent and warped. I was not happy at all about that, but it seems to be coming into the proper shape a little at a time.

This is a neat toy for food motivated dogs. There is a wide opening for larger sized kibble or treats. The ball is solid and well made. I have used other treat balls, but this one is a little fancier than the ones I had in the past. I find that these treat balls work well with special needs dogs who tend to be fearful or nervous. This helps take their mind off of things and makes for something nice for them to play within the safety of their crate.Unlike some other treat balls, this one is not see-thru at all. It does, however, make a neat noise. For the price, it is definitely one of the better treat ball toys out there. The only improvement' I see for this toy would be to make the opening adjustable.

Afterglow has really created a fantastic wireless headset. I have used some other wireless headsets and it seemed like there was always some static or popping/crackling in the background. With The Afterglow AG9 headset, it was perfect sound with any kind of noise interference. Sound quality was outstanding and perfect.I was able to play for a good 6 hours (documentation says 16 hours of worry free use) and the rechargeable battery showed no signs of giving out. I was able to get at the 40 feet distance and did not suffer sound quality.Easy to setup with my PS4. Plug in USB Wireless adapter follow directions for setting up with PS4 and done. Very easy.Mic: Works great. It has noise canceling so you're not hearing what is going on in the room while your playing. The voice commands worked well using the mic and as long as you werenâ€™t mumbling or had the mic to far away from you, it worked perfectly. I also liked the fact that you could remove it because not all games use the mic and while it isnâ€™t in the way or a bother it was nice to be able to remove it if not needed.Comfort. This is probably the only area of the Afterglow AG9 where I will have to be critical. Let me say if you are a small kid or someone who has a small head, these I imagine will be perfect for you. However, I am an adult and have a larger head and ears. If you are only going to use these for a short time, this will not be an issue. If you wear them for that 6 hours I mentioned before  then expect some discomfort. After 6 hours, I had to remove the headset because it was starting to hurt. Having a larger ear piece or maybe an oval shape vice round would be better for an adult or someone with a larger head. Because of the discomfort I got at the bottom and back of my ears I gave this four stars instead of the five I wanted to give it.If you are getting this for a child or someone with a small head then they are fantastic and worth the value! While I will continue to use these I just wonâ€™t be wearing them for as long as I might like to be able to.

First off, this type of crate is for dogs that are calm and crate trained. I use this as a travelling crate for my 30 lb mini Shar-Pei. There is plenty of room for her and this keeps her safe in case of an accident, as she just can't jump out if something spooks her. I was previously using a soft crate made by Nature's Miracle. They make an excellent crate, but the size I purchased was big enough for a 70lb dog. The height was blocking the view of my rear window. That is the only reason I replaced it with this one for travelling. I did not buy a smaller Nature's Miracle Crate because they are very expensive and I do not use the crate on a daily basis.This EliteField crate is pretty nice and comes with some bells and whistles that the Nature's Miracle one did not.  There is a storage area on the top and it also comes with a little "pocket book" on the back. These are great features for dog owners who need to haul medical paperwork around when the dog is sent to a specialist. It will probably be most useful to those who show their dogs in the ring. It is also handy for storing copies of paperwork pertaining to rabies shots, which groomers and other dog services require. This also comes with an okay crate liner. I had to use a separate Kong bed for my last crate. The liner for this one is a little on the thin side, so I cover it with a soft blanket.Now, to the not so good. The mesh on this crate is not as fine as some other soft crates. This should not be a major issue for those whose dogs know how to behave in a crate, but there is more of a risk of a nail getting caught in it than other brands. There is also no way to access the inside of the crate from the top. Only the front and side. I also feel that the zippers are not quite as smooth working as on my last crate.This stands up and collapses about as well as my Nature's Miracle crate. For the price, (about $60) this is a decent crate for transporting a calm dog or using it as a safe place for a smaller dog to hide & sleep. If you are not sure if your dog will behave in this type of crate, opt for a hard plastic crate instead for travelling. Always make sure never to leave collars on a dog the inside of any crate. If you need to hook your dog onto a leash quickly within the crate, use a harness instead.

I am a big fan of the Turbie Twist and own several of them. I was hesitant to accept this product at first because it reminded me of the early versions of head wraps from Asia that had the button on the top. Many people complained about their hair getting caught in the button. I didn't see any complaints about this in the reviews for this product and for good reason, too. These have the button on the bottom and does not catch any hair.While I really like the Turbie Twist, these DII ones are superior in a few ways. I usually do not use these for dry hair, but I wanted my hair to be out of the way while I took a bath. The Turbie Twist was not able to cover all of my long, thick hair and became loose. The DII ones covered almost all of my hair and it was not a hassle to secure. Out of the shower, both do well, but the DII is better for long hair. I use two of these after washing my hair like I do with the Turbie Twist. I wear one right after squeezing out the excess water, then after about 10-15 minutes put on another fresh, dry one to be worn for about an hour.If you haven't tried a drying head wrap for your hair, give this a try. You will wonder why you didn't start using these earlier. Both these are and the microfiber version of the Turbie Twist are much better for your hair than a terry towel. If your hair is halfway down your back or longer, opt for these as they are longer. They are also a bit softer than the Turbie Twist but just as thirsty.

Scotts Every Drop Shaker is very useful if you live in a  dry climate or just have weird weather where it will rain for 2 weeks straight then nothing for months at a time. This works pretty well for in between seasons where grass starts to turn brown, especially if you have Souza grass. If you are a gardener, you may want to give this a try as well to reduce water usageâ€‹.

We have weird weather here in MD. It will sometimes rains for days on end, then not a drop in sight for weeks. Scotts Every Drop helps conserve water during those weeks where I have to water what is left of my garden and the patches where I am trying to grow new grass. This works pretty well and can be applied with a spreader. The ground is hard where I live. This helps get more water to the roots. I will definitely be using more of this next year as I start my new gardenâ€‹.

I received one beef and one turkey jerky snack. They tasted okay. There is a strong smell of liquid smoke with these. The texture is soft. These mostly reminded me of Slim Jim. Decent mid afternoon or post workout snack.

I use this seed to fix up bald patches caused by last year's heavy rains. This seed is not at risk of being eaten by birds and If put down right before rain pretty much takes care of itself. Right now there is still some warmth, so this seed did okay for me. I am not the best at prepping the ground for seeding, so although it takes a little longer to grow, the results still turn out well. I am very happy with Scotts seeds.

This is a lovely looking watch that comes in beautiful packaging. The watch feels sturdy and a bit on the heavy side. This is not a dainty watch. It is on the large side. The watch band is  not adjustable except if you know how to remove links, which can be a real pain. For most women who buy this, a jeweler will be needed to remove the extra links.The packaging is very nice. Perfect for gifting. The protective plastic is a bit of a challenge to remove. The time was very easy to set and the watch itself looks great. If you are into the new trend of bold, large faced watches, you will like this one.This would be a good watch for a woman who wants something more substantial in a watch. It is feminine but sturdy.

This is a great little spray bottle which feel comfortable in the hand and sprays well. Right now I am just using apple cider vinegar in it, but the glass bottle is good for those who make natural sprays using essential oils. The 8oz size is perfect. Not too big. The blue color is very pretty too.  The plastic hose part may need to be trimmed, but after that, theâ€‹ bottle is good to go.

I bought this to protect my Shar-Pei's ears in the bath. She is a small dog, so I ordered the smallest size which fit her okay. The band loosens when she shakes her head so next time I may have to place a towel or cloth under it. I really don't want to give this a bad review as I am not using it as it was intended. I do think that $16.95 is a bit steep for these. It's worth about half of that. When using for kids, these need to be used with ear plugs. This will probably provide decent protection to my dog's ears in the summer when she goes swimming. It would be great if this company made a version specifically for dogs with small ears.

It was time for me to get a real jewelry box. I had an attractive one, but it was old and made from particle board. I have been acquiring more chains, pendants and earrings and wanted to have them stored properly instead of being in a box inside of a small drawer. I wanted a flat type box with lots of compartments for my earrings, but where I could also hang my chains. I was about to give up when I came across this one. It was the look I wanted, a nice dark color and was reasonably priced. When I received it, I was very happy to see how attractive this box is in person.The locks seem to work well. Both levels lock and not just the top, unlike many other "locking" boxes. This comes with two sets of keys. There are plenty of hooks to hang chains and compartments to lay down longer chains. The pouch under the hooks has sections, but they are not stitchedâ€‹ down. The acrylic section is removable, but I use it to place my tiny stud earrings. This is such a gorgeous and well made jewelry box. The lining is well done and the hinges are sturdy.This box is for someone with a good amount of pieces, but I don't think someone with a ton of jewelry will be able to fit it all in here. It is perfect for me and leave plenty of room for more. This box will match many different decor styles (classic, colonial, steampunk, goth.)  Mine came carefully packaged and they also sent me an extra travel bag which was nice.

This is a nice ceramic rest in a cool green color. I really don't like plastic rests and really prefer the ceramic. This one is shaped differently than what I was used to, but it is a good size and does the job just fine. I don't leave my rest out when I am not using it, and this stows away nicely. I like that it doesn't take up a lot of space. The manufacturers sticker comes off easily on this, but there is also a UPC sticker that is a pain to get off. That is my only complaint about this item.

This charm looks kind of different from the picture, but it is still very cute. It's a small little knot on a 1.5mm 18 inch Spring ring clasped Rolo chain. Before wearing it, I suggest unhooking it and letting it untwist. This way it will lay flat when worn. The preview picture shows the item with more etching and depth. The chain may be too thin for some, but the bail on the charm should be able to handle a thicker chain like 2mm or 2.5mm.For around $30, this is a nice sterling silver piece. I think this would make a great gift for an older child who is ready to be responsible with something other than toy or costume pieces.

I was only going to buy one pack of Twinkle razors, but this seller offered these at a much better price per pack. These razors are good for shaping the top of your eyebrows as well as being a beginners tool for dermaplaning. I prefer to use a scalpel tool for dermaplaning, but I do use a Twinkle to do finishing touches. These last about a dozen uses or so. I clean mine with rubbing alcohol after each use.Although the risk for getting cut with a Twinkle is low, it can happen if you are too rough or go over the same spot too many times. Just let the razor do its job and don't apply too much pressure. These can also be used to remove annoying hair from the belly or toes.For under $8, this pack was a good deal. The added nail file was a bonus. It doesn't have a real abrasive side, but it's good enough for filing away rough edges in a pinch.

This is a very beautiful and well made chain. Italian sterling silver chains are much better quality than the chains from China. I did have to send it back for a refund because I underestimated the length. I like the shorter chains, but 16" was a little too short for me. Because the quality of the chain was so wonderful, I went and splurged on a thicker and longer chain from this same seller. This 2.5mm size should fit any charm and does not snag the hair. The preview picture is not the best, but this chain does look lovely in person. Just make sure when you order, to double check where the chain will fall for your body type and height.

These are super funnels. These range from tiny to averaged sized and have so many uses. I used to use plastic dollar store ones, but those are now regulated to garage use. The larger sized funnel is great for helping me transfer my homemade powders to their container. The smaller ones are perfect for adding scented oils to those small amber bottles.These claim to be dishwasher safe, but I am more comfortable washing them by hand for now. They nest together fine and come with a ring for hanging. The strainer is a great addition, especially for things like salves where the plant materials need to be separated from theâ€‹ diffused oil.

This is real soap, not a detergent. It is labeled as Castile soap, but real Castile is made with 100% olive oil. This creates a slippery soap without much lather, so many soap makers add other oils to either cut costs or create more bubbles. This one has coconut oil, hemp oil, and some other oils. This is mostly unscented, although there is some kind of slight smell. I am wondering if this could be from the hemp oil which smells terrible on its own.I'm using this soap to make my own shaving lotion. Any of Dr Bonner's scents will work, but the unscented allows for more customization. The 32oz is a generous size and only costs a few dollars more than the 16oz. This is a great all purpose soap that can be used as an ingredient in household cleaners or beauty products. This is not a baby shampoo in the way that it is "tearless." Again, this is actual soap made from oils and lye. Of course, it can be used on its own in the shower. You can even add your own essential oils to it and fragrance it yourself.Overall, this is a great base soap for making your own shaving creams, shampoos, etc. You can buy plastic soap pump bottles cheap, but I prefer to spend a little more and buy glass ones. Your own DIY beauty items can also make great gifts.

Who would want powdered bleach? Probably someone who doesn't want to lug a heavy jug of bleach around or someone who has arthritis. Clorox bleach crystals a good idea if you have a large cleaning project coming up. These are definitely less clumsy than messing around with liquid bleach. For laundry, these can go right into the tub of your He machine. No more splashes, no more ruined laundry.This is a good product, but there are a few issues with it. The crystals do not dissolve easily without stirring, especially in cold water. You will need some bleach proof tool to stir this with. Some may not want t deal with the extra step of having to mix this product up. The crystals also make it hard to target stains as opposed to using gel bleach, which is my prevered product. I also find that the gel works faster and is more powerful.Overall, this is a handy product to have. The bottle fits perfectly in my washer storage drawer and the measuring cap on top is a smart idea. This would be a great product for anyone with issues carrying heavy liquid bottles and could really be an asset to big projects that require a substantial amount of bleach. For everyday use it would be good for mopping and giving the toilet a quick clean. While I like this product, I think I will go back to using Clorox bleach gel as I am more comfortable using it in my washing machine. The gel is also better for targeting random stains and applying to grout.

I was using some other  brand of washing machine cleaner, but when I bought my new he machine, it came with a great coupon for Tide Washing Machine cleaner. These come in individual packs, so it was a bit easier to use than the liquid one that I had to measure out. These do a decent job of cleaning the drum, but they smell way too strong. The smell permeated throughout the house lasted over a week inside of the drum. I will not buy these again after the other two packs get used.

Charcoal bags are a great way to absorb odors from gym lockers, garages, and even pet kennels. I am using this bag in a room with chinchillas who constantly smell of urine. I used to be able to wash one of the cages out every two weeks, but as they have gotten older, they no longer get along and I cannot put them together in the rabbit's cage where my late bunny would act as moderator. The cages get cleaned daily but are not hosed down with water & Lysol like they used to be. This leaves a faint lingering smell of pee, but even when they were washed out, the smell would come back a few days later anyway. I hung the bag in between the two cages and the smell is reduced. I was also using an oil diffuser but have not used it at all since hanging this bag up. This charcoal bag does help to reduce the offending odor.This bag needs to be recharged once a month by leaving it in the sun. I can see this being an issue with the upcoming lousy weather. but this is not the fault of the product.

I use these cups quite a bit, especially when I am working in the kitchen as I do not want to risk knocking a glass over. These have a great grip on them. I buy these quite often at the commissary, but they only have the red ones. These blue ones are very nice too. I drink a lot of water so the large size is appreciated. These, of course, have other uses.  They can become a makeshift bowl to mix foods or paints in. These ar ethe cups you will want these cups for cookouts as they are big and make for easy cleanup. I have no complaints about these. I like Solo cups too and I think those might be a bit thicker than Hefty, but for what I use these for, it isn't a big deal. Both brands are great.

Solid Gold usually makes decent kibble. This one is not bad, although it does contain white potato which can be inflammatory to some dogs. This is a lower protein food which is ideal for certain breeds. Some may be concerned about this food being produced in the Diamond Pet Food plants. I would contact the company with any questions about that. Most of the ingredients in this are good. Fresh eggs would be better than powdered ones, but if you are feeding kibble, this shouldn't be a huge issue anyway.The rescue dogs I work with do way better on this food than any of the more common brands. There is no corn or wheat to cause itching or bad gas.Overall, this is a good kibble to try if you are trying to feed your dog something better than supermarket kibble. This is a pricier brand, but it seems to be cheaper if you buy the 24lb bag ($2.70 a lb) vs the 4lb bag ($5.75 a lb).

I don't drink a lot of coffee, but I keep these on hand for when I want a coffee at night or iced coffee with dinner. This tastes really good. I was using Gorilla decaf before, but this is even better. I was really surprised how great this tastesâ€‹. I use these in my Keurig 2.0 machine on the 10 oz setting. These are cheaper at the commissary where I buy them.

Maca root (Lepidium Peruvianum) boasts many benefits including improving mood, energy enhancement and even a boost in sexual wellness. This product is powdered maca in raw form. It can be used in cooked recipes or added or added to smoothies. The taste is similar to kohlrabi in my opinion. It does not taste like ginseng at all in case you were wondering. I actually like the smell better than the taste, but I think a small amount of this can easily be hidden in a stew or baked dish. This powder does not dissolve in cool water very well, so I would try to find another way to consume it.This comes in a zip type bag inside of another heavy plastic bag. I put mine into a tinted pint-sized mason jar for easier access and to keep it fresh.There is some disagreement as to whether maca root should be eaten in its raw state. I personally have no problems consuming it this way, but if one prefers to, I don't see why they cannot heat this powder up mixed with some olive or coconut oil and prepare it the same way golden paste (a Tumeric based health remedy)  is made.I personally prefer using maca to a multi-vitamin. I won't claim this will perform any miracles, but it does give me a bit of an energy boost and helps combat my mid-day slump.  I would say give this a try. If you don't like it at first, try a few different ways. Some may like it in coffee, others may like a spoonful in a soup. Some may just hate it. I feel this way about ginseng. I have tried to like it, but it is just tastes disgusting to me.Maca should be avoided at bedtime, as well as by anyone with thyroid issues.

I use disposable gloves quite a bit for various jobs. These are sturdy enough to wear under my gardening gloves and they are also good for handling raw food for when I feed my dogs. These are a great size for my small hands and are also powder free. They don't make my hands clammy either. I know function is the most important thing, but these just look cooler than the blue nitrile gloves.  These are a good choice for those allergic to latex.

We always wind up with a puddle on the left side of out sink when doing dishes. Not anymore with this microfiber mat!  You can dry items right on it that won't fit in your drying rack. This even rolls up and has a little snap button. It can be washed in cold water too. This does a dual job for us, preventing the puddle and helping glasses dry faster. This is a wonderful item.

This is a huge canister of Paydays and Hershey's Milk chocolate and almond clusters. Although Hershey's chocolate is mediocre at best, these will still be a hit on Halloween and at work if you keep a candy jar on your desk. Each pack contains 5 bite-sized pieces, so you can share or not.These "bites" are still pretty fattening for those who care. They are great to take with lunches and all, but each one is over 300 calories each so I would use these for break rooms and parties more than using as a daily snack with lunch.

I was excited about receiving this product as I love mushrooms and the new information about their health benefits is very interesting. This is an "all natural" product with a citrus like taste due to the addition of stevia & citric acid. This container holds about a month supply of the supplement.This is a nice supplement and can be enjoyed in water, juice, or smoothie. I haven't had any bad reactions to this. I like it quite a bit. I often take a glass of psyllium husks at night, which are okay, but I feel that this product works much better for me. It also contains more beneficial ingredients and dissolves in cold water whereas I have to use warm water for the husks.I took off one star because I would have preferred that this tasted like mushrooms and could be added to food. Other than that, I feel great taking it.

I bought this set on eBay (for $13 less), but they are the same earrings from the same seller (GemStoneKing.) The picture is misleading, but when these arrived they looked like what I'd expected. They are small, but the colors are very pretty. The peridot is my favorite, but they all have nice color & sparkle. I prefer this small size for my second piercing. The earrings are on the dainty side, but they are not what I would call flimsy. I have a couple of pairs of sterling silver earrings that have bent posts and are not as nice as these, even though I paid more for them. The backs of these are very tiny, so if you have big fingers or long nails, you may have a hard time putting these on. You definitely don't want to mess around with these near a sink where they can fall in and get lost. I have not experienced any irritation wearing these. I am using one of them now for my helix (cartilageâ€‹) piercing. It barely fits, but it hasn't fallen off nor is it bothering me at all.These are clearly stated as 4mm, so those complaining about the size have nothing but their own ignorance to blame for that. These should be handled with care, but for what I paid, they were worth it. These are great for a second piercing, for a child, or just anyone who wants small, elegant earrings.

I love this comb. No more plastic combs for me. I have super thick hair, but this comb glides through it with ease. I wear my hair up in a bun almost daily, and this helps my hair to look smoothed out. I use oils in my hair and this has not affected the comb in any negative way. The comb is a bit on the small side, so those with larger hands may want one with a bigger handle. I wish I'd bought a comb like this sooner.

These are great disposable gloves for doing chores and other messy jobs. They are thankfully powder free and slip on nicely. My hands didn't wind up clammy after using them. These are great for protecting manicures and keeping dirt from getting under the nailsâ€‹. If you have a latex allergy, go with the nitrile gloves instead.

I usually use amber bottles, but I wanted a blue set too. Cobalt is not as effective at protecting against light as amber, but these bottles are placed in a dark closet, so this isn't an issue. The tube needs to be trimmed in these. I recommend cutting right in the middle of the curved part. The spray trigger is okay, but not the best. I use these for hair oils and air scents.These arrived packaged very carefully, so none broke. There was no smell or anything weird when I received them. The 2oz size is perfect for hand-held sprays. The color is very attractive.

READ THE DESCRIPTION these are for small bottles (dram, 1 oz, 2 oz). If you are a perfume maker, alchemist, or budding chemist, these are for you.These funnels are perfect for filling small bottles with scented oils or topping off your herbal remedies with grain alcohol.  If you are using them for oils, you may have to lift them up to empty once you get towards the top of the bottle. I was using plastic funnels from the dollar store before, but these are much better. The two smaller sizes are the ones I use the most for my 2 oz amber bottles.I took off one star because they are hand wash only. I saw a nicer set later on. They were more expensive, but I wonder if I should have gotten those. These are great so far and do the job in my apothecary.  They also have a ring if you want to hang them up.

Update: These were brought to work and were gone within a day. I personally think these are nothing specialâ€‹, but other people seemed to like them quite a bit.These arrived packaged very carefully. They were in a very large box with another well packed box on the inside. The tin is quite large and attractive. I will definitely use it for storing my scented oils. Now, if you were wondering about the candy inside, I can tell you that it is pretty much what you'd expect from a Hershey's product - mediocracy.The candies all come in caramel flavors: butterscotch,  vanilla, & plain.  The vanilla is the best out of the three, but unfortunately, there are very few of them in this tin compared to the overload of butterscotch flavored ones. I love caramel, but I have tasted much better ones than these. The ingredients are low quality, which I normally wouldn't be too picky about for a junk food product, but Hershey's has driven away many consumers who want a better tasting sweet. In response to this, instead of improving their product, they have worked to block the sale of the superior British versions of their sweets in the US.If you are looking for corn syrup laden, below average' tasting caramels made by a greedy US company who hates the free market, by all means, buy these.

I cannot find these anywhere for sale anymore, so I was more than happy to take them. These gloves are comfortable, fit great and are sturdy. If given a choice of only one style of disposable glove, this one is it. The only thing I would not recommend these for is for very heavy jobs like plumbing, fixing cars, etc. Get the HD style for that. Everything around the house, care of pets, raw feeding, etc. These indigo gloves do the job.

These look just like the regular blue medical gloves, but they feel much sturdier. These are definitely more appropriate for wearing longer. They are comfortable, easy to put on and do not contain any hideous powder. These make decent housework gloves for those who want to protect their nails. I would say these are good for messy jobs like painting, soap making, & cleaning up after animals.

I really like Simple's product line. No heavy perfumes or weird stuff. These cloths are not just good for removing makeup, but also for natural face treatments and for removing coconut oil after a facial wax. The pack is pretty good at keeping the towelettes wet. These did not irritateâ€‹ my skin in any way. I am quite happy with them.

These gloves are good for protecting your hands when slicing hot peppers. Washing your hands afterwards is not enough and burns can occur if you rub your eyes. These are also good for keeping your nails clean when you need to mix food with your hands. These are not heavy duty gloves, nor are they meant to be. They are for the temporary use of handling and serving food. These are great for people who feed their dogs raw as well.

I'm really happy with these bottles. I am using them for homemade hair oils. Even though I use 100% oil, these still spray smoothly. They all arrived intact and look really cool, like an alchemist set. the 2oz/60ml size is perfect for a hand-held EO mix whether you are using it for skin and hair, or just as an air freshener.Because the tube and sprayer are plastic, be careful to dilute your mixes so that the material doesn't degrade. I think the only thing that would make this set better is if they came with additional caps for when the spray part is not needed or wears out. These bottles were definitely worth the price. I'd buy another set in the future.

These tea towels are very nice. They are soft and absorbent. I like to have both terry cloth and tea towels on hand and I haven't had any of the latter for a while. These come wrapped in a rustic bow, so they would make a cute housewarming gift. What I don't understand is why there were plastic strings holding these together, when the cloth bow was sufficient. The plastic caused some damage to the towels which is really too bad. Besides that, I like these towels. They are a decent size and would look nice in a bowl or basket bringing bread to the table.

These undies are more like a brief than mid rise, although I guess it depends on the size of  the person wearing them. They are comfortable, great to wear with PJ's.  These will also work as "period panties" or "workout panties" for those days when you may not feel like wearing your usual bikini underwear. They don't ride up at all. Overall, not bad for the price.

This review is for the Juniper Woods. If I get offered another scent, I will update this review.Update: I also received Lavender Vanilla. This one is pretty good, a little on the sweet side. It worked almost as well as Juniper Woods.This works pretty well. It's a mixture of essential oils in an alcohol base. The bottle is plastic and the sprayer works smoothly. The scent of this is not very strong and not obnoxious like most bathroom sprays are. This type of products can be made at home using your own favorite essential oils, but if you don't feel confident in mixing your own, this product will do.  I also found that this spray works as a temporary refresher' for trash cans until they can be emptied and washed out.

I used these to test various pieces of Jade that I had acquired from around the world. This made it easy to validate my collection. These were a decent buy for $20. I only used water in these so I cannot vouch for how well they stand up to working with solvents or chemicals.

I originally bought these for brandied cherries but then started using them to store homemade powders. I find that new they are great for storing foods like miso, Amish butter, and raw nuts. They do a great job of keeping things fresh. I also use them for overnight oatmeal. These have a wide mouth and make great containers for homemade candies or granola given as gifts.These do not have a measuring guide on the side like the taller pint-sized Ball jars. These are be washed by hand, boiled, or cleaned in the dishwasher and reused several times. I would not recommend trying to stack these. I usually find these 4 jar packs for around $5. I have purchased Ball jars from Amazon before, but they were the vintage ones that are hard to find in my area. With these, I can just get them on the military base. I would imagine several chain stores will start carrying them as well, as the holiday season gets closer.

These are great temp gloves for wearing under gardening gloves or having to clean up messes. Wearing gloves will also protect your nails from peeling due to water and chemical cleaners. I especially like to use these for feeding my dogs their RMB. I can hand them their food and not worry about contaminating anything with icky raw meat hands. I do not have a latex allergy, but I HATE powdered gloves, so since these are powder free that makes me very happy. Please note that these gloves are meant for quick jobs and are not the sturdiest. I haven't had any issues using them, but they have ripped while I was trying to remove them. This is not a problem since I was done with them anyway, but if you need tougher gloves, check out the HD ones.

This amazing little surge protector allows for more outlet space without blocking the second outlet most of us have in our homes.  This item is a must for the home office. Unlike older, similar units, this one does not stick out too far from the wall. It has built in dust covers to help keep kids and nosey animals away from the outlets. I am really happy with this handy, protective space saver. We still get flickers and surges when it rains out here and this seems to be doing what it is supposedâ€‹ to.

Lynsey Addario's passion in life is photography and she has traveled the world, sharing with others the people she has met and their stories through her photographs.When 9/11 happened, Lynsey's career was just beginning.  Over the past decade and a half Lynsey has been kidnapped twice and reported on nearly every major war-  and allowed people to get a glimpse of the human side of the countries affected by war.Photography is what Addario does.  Photography is her passion, her calling, the thing she wakes each morning to pursue. Relationships have ended because of this, and time spent in New York with her family is precious, but happens only once each year.  As a mother, Addario struggles with the price her son is paying for her frequent absences.  And yet, Addario is called to photography, to help others' stories be told.  She has been blessed with a husband who supports her passion and pursuit of it.It's What I Do is a memoir which include beautiful, hearbreaking photographs of the people and stories Lynsey has told.  It is an inside look at the dangerous places Addario has seen and lived and gives a firsthand perspective of someone who knows her subjects personally.Addario lives a life of adventure, so different from my own. And yet in her memoir she revealed a woman I felt as though I knew and could be friends with.  Her photographs tell a story all their own, yet her writing is also impeccable.

Tate Ellerbee's teacher has assigned the class to write to penpals. While most children find a relative to correspond with, Tate begins to write to Hank Williams, a rising music star.Through these letters Tate reveals the struggles her family has had. And there are plenty.  Tate is being raised by her great aunt and uncle, having neither her mother nor her father able to care for her.  And as she deals with her heartache it is obvious how much the family she does have loves her.Told entirely in letters, this story reveals what life in Louisiana in 1948 was like.  Holt includes a few historical notes in back explaining where she received the inspiration for her story and a bit more about the time period.I love Holt's work, and this is no exception. Perfect for 4th-6th grade readers, who will no doubt fall in love with Tate.

This is a fantastic book!  My teen and tween daughters have been fighting over it, and can spend hours looking up information about a variety of careers.  DK is known for its quality publication and this is no exception. Over 400 careers are highlighted in this book, giving job description, related career information, a guide of skills and qualifications needed, and career path for this job.  Readers may learn more about careers they had never heard of before and begin thinking about their own future.  As an adult, I am still intrigued by this book and the wealth of information it provides.  Another winner from DK!

Cole Cohen has spent her life struggling through school. She has been unable to learn how to drive, and anything involving science or math are a lost cause.  Her parents have subjected her to numerous tests, which have revealed that she has a learning disability of some type.Although the testing reveals little, Cole and her parents keep pushing and asking questions. Finally she is given an MRI which reveals a lemon sized hole in her brain.At first Cole believes that since the problem is finally diagnosed, it can be fixed.  Yet, there is no fix for her problem. Instead, Cole must learn to live with and compensate for her disability.Cole is highly intelligent and has been compensating for her disability for years, yet there are certain things she cannot overcome - such as her inability to accurately see and react to objects in motion (which makes driving impossible and crossing the street perilous as well).  As she attempts to find organizations that could give her assistance, she finds many obstacles as her disability is so unique and unusual.Head Case was interesting and well written, allowing readers to see Cohen for the intelligent woman she is, despite the one area of her brain that makes some day to day encounters impossible for her.Cohen's honesty about her struggles and her triumph over them make this a fantastic memoir.

It's been a long time since I opened up a book the day it arrived in the mail and was able to sit down and read it in one sitting.  (In fact, the last time I remember doing this was with Roger Rosenblatt's Making Toast which was published in 2011).  But, over spring break I had the pleasure of opening a package containing Ellen McCarthy's The Real Thing: Lessons on Love and Life From a Wedding Reporter's Notebook. And I was able to sit down and read and read, until I turned the last page of this book.  McCarthy's book is full of little bits of wisdom about relationships and marriage as well as stories about a variety of the people she came to know because of her job.McCarthy spent several years as a wedding reporter for the Washington Post.
