It felt like it was meant to clean things up and wrap it all up in a neat bow, when the package itself was wrapped haphazardly with bits and bobs sticking out all over the place.The Bottom LineThereâ€™s enough potential with the â€˜verse Ms. Eames created that I enjoyed parts of this, even if I didnâ€™t connect with the romance between Lennox and Garrett.**ARC provided by publisher via netgalley for review**

I have tried a number of different Gloveworks gloves and found them to be very strong. I could not pull hard enough to rip them. I would like to address the size selection of the Gloveworks gloves. I generally wear extra large golf, hunting, and work gloves. I found that if I am doing fine work such as cleaning and putting back together something like a carburetor, the medium sized gloves were big enough to stretch very tightly so that I could have them on and hardly notice they are there. I can pick up and handle very small items just as I would with bare fingers. Generally the Gloveworks large size would be plenty big enough for me and work for most things.My wife has fairly large hands and always wears disposable gloves for gardening and weeding. She would usually wear a men's large, but the medium in the Gloveworks fit perfectly.I have found the Gloveworks gloves excellent for many types of work and resistant to most cleaners and solvents that I use. There is a list available of all of the chemicals in which the various gloves resist. This is a good product..

The Ammex GPNB Black Nitrile Gloves are very strong. I could not pull them hard enough to rip them. For those with a Latex allergy, these would be a good glove to try. They have a very large list of chemicals which the gloves will resist. If you work on machinery in which you come in contact with  petroleum liquids and solvents, these gloves have are resistant to them. They include liquids such as antifreeze, paint thinners, carburetor cleaner,gas, lacquers, hydraulic oil, adhesive remover, and many others. The Ammex Nitrile gloves are a good way of keeping these dangerous fluids from being absorbed into your skin and bloodstream.

The Complete Wild Game Cookbook is in fact really complete. It covers recipes for almost anything you might hunt in North America, from Plover to Muskox. The book includes hunting with respect for the animal, nutrition of the various game, how meat is cooked and tenderized. It also includes great photos of all of the game animals for which there are recipes, by chapter.There are individual recipes for each animal and very nice pictures of many of the prepared dishes. I will surely never eat a Lark, but I'm sure the the recipe could be adapted to another more common game bird. Even without having cooked a thing, I found the book very interesting and informative. There are many recipes which I would consider gourmet meals.We have many favorite meals especially for geese, pheasants and deer and I look forward through the coming months of trying some new recipes. The hunting season just began in Wisconsin a few days ago so I'm a bit short of the main ingredient yet. If I find a recipe that I particularly like I will try to get back and include it in this review.

The Manitoba Harvest Hemp Heart Protein Bars have an unusual flavor for me. I didn't like the flavor. They look good, have a great texture and look appealing. My wife's first comment was they taste like they are really good for you. She does like the flavor and will likely be the one to finish the box.The ingredients are organic and seem to be good quality.They would especially make a good trail snack, blast of protein.

The Ammex ILHD Gloveworks Heavy Duty Latex Gloves are very tough. I filled one with air like a balloon and then pulled on a finger as hard as I could to see if it would ripe. It did not . I have fairly large hands with long fingers and the extra large fit perfectly with a bit of room to spare. They went on easily.I ordered them to use with such things as eviscerating a deer, painting, gluing, and work in the pottery and wood shop. These are good strong disposable gloves.

The Woods 6-Outlet Front Entry Surge Protector works very well. It fits and stays in the outlet, and the plugs stay securely in the protector. This is a way of plugging in 6 pieces of A/V equipment into a two plug outlet without having a large corded unit. There is a dim light which lets you know it is working. There is a large dollar amount of equipment protection guarantee with the unit. The unit also has a protection against interference which is good. Only time will tell if the protector works. I hope I never have to use the equipment guarantee.

IZZE Flavored Sparkling Water is what we used to refer to as Tonic Water. That was what I've mixed for a Gin and Tonic. This would likely make a good mix for alcoholic beverages.The IZZE has a bit of sugar and some real fruit flavoring added. The ingredients are organic, which I appreciate, but there is likely not much to it except tonic water. There is two grams of sugar and 2 grams of carbs, no corn syrup.  I have never cared for tonic water though my wife liked the taste very much. She felt it was refreshing. The three stars are a combination of her finding it good and me not so good.

The Epson WorkForce Pro WF-R4640 EcoTank Wireless Printer is an excellent product. When I ordered this unit, I had not paid attention to its size since this was a product sent to me for review. This is not your every day "sit on the desk" printer. It is meant for much more. It is large, heavy, very fast and has many options. The working screen is a very sensitive touch screen and the wireless connection is reliable and fast. The prints are great.I have set up other wireless printers and most have been difficult at best, this was a breeze. The only problem was that the disk, that was provided for set-up, did not work with Windows 10. I went to the Epson website, picked the WF-R4640 model from a list and downloaded the program. Little more than a simple click and it set itself up, and worked perfectly. This unit can be set up with a wired or wireless system and even the wireless can be set up using a temporary wire connection.This printer will scan, fax, and print. It has built in wireless and Wi-Fi direct and it will print from your iPad or iPhone and also from your Android.I like the way the buttons work and the sensible way a user gets from one function to another. This is a user friendly printer.I would primarily recommend this printer/faz/ scanner to small businesses such as real estate offices, school libraries, insurance offices, small town city halls and courts, and any business or individual who needs fast and quality prints for a low price. Or...needs to print from remote locations.

I really enjoyed Saturn Run by John Sandford and Ctein. I used to read a lot of SciFi, but I lost interest after about a half dozen or so very dark or very poorly written books. It was nice to read one that has characters without a whole bunch of silly names containing multiple connected vowels or weird consonant combinations.Saturn Run has believable, solid characters that I have found interesting. The story flows and though it takes place about 50 or so years in the future it seems connected with today in a way that the reader can relate to easily. After all the ship is named the Richard M. Nixon.The story line is about an alien ship that was sighted by accident coming into and leaving the Saturn/moons system. It became a race between the U. S. and China to get to Saturn to check it out and hopefully be the first to get the advanced technology which the aliens obviously possessed. The story began in the head of a handyman who was working on a U.S. space station. I liked that a lot.I recommend this book for those who like some technology explanations, thoughtful plot and setting planning, some mystery, solid and interesting characters, and a competition.

I have seldom used anything but Norelco shavers and I really like them. I have used, for about 8 months, the Norelco S7370, which is very similar to the one that I am now reviewing, the S8950. I really cannot tell any difference other than the new one has sharper blades. They both give me the closest shave that I get without using a blade.The two shavers are about the same price and sized units. The replacement heads are about $15. cheaper for the new one (S8950). The older model, the S7370 has a trimming head that can be used for trimming sideburns,  but little else. The new one has a beard trimming head which can be use for giving yourself that 2-3 days growth beard look, that seems very popular now. Both must have the shaving head popped off and then replaced with the trimming head. They just pull off, not twist.The whole unit works very well, but a caution, you must have enough space to leave these units on the counter and they are not tiny. If you move them and tilt the unit, the cleaning liquid will spill out of the base. Even with those things in mind, this is still my favorite shaver.

Very nice kitchen towels. We prefer 100% cotton, as these are, since it is very absorbent. The DII has a good thick pattern and the size is right for the kitchen. We always check the edging for quality and durability and these seem to be very good.

The Jackson Safety 37188 WH40 Welding helmet is great to use. I have never done a great deal of welding, but from time to time I need to assemble or fix something, so I go to the arc welder. I have a couple of older helmets. As anyone knows who has welded without an auto-darkening shield,  it is always difficult to place the rod where it needs to be on the metal being welded since it cannot be seen with the old helmets in place.The Jackson takes care of this problem. Since I had never used one of these helmets before, I adjusted the settings for auto-darkening sensitivity and level of light protection. There is a scale to be found in the direction booklet. I fit the helmet adjustments for my comfort and read about cleaning and protection of the helmet while not in use. I then went to a bright incandescent light bulb with the helmet on and flashed on the light bulb several times. The shield darkened immediately. I experimented with changing the light sensitivity of the helmet to see how this would affect the darkening and ability to see the bulb. In this way I learned how the helmet functioned without committing myself to the arc light. I became satisfied that the helmet did just what it should do and did it well. Then I went to the welder and experimented with using the helmet the way it was designed. I did some welding.It was a pleasure to see the metal pieces to be welded before arcing began. The change from normal sight to arc light protection and back happened fast without any unwanted flash of light ( I was skeptical ). My old helmets will likely end up in the garbage. The Jackson is comfortable, easy to adjust and affords good protection.I like everything about the helmet, and its 5 year warranty.

When I ordered the Contigo Autosprout Ashland Water Bottle, I didn't realize that I have had an older model of this bottle for about 2 years. My wife needed one so hence the order.I really like the way this bottle works and its durability. The new one is just slightly different mechanically than the old one and that one has worked great. I especially like to use this bottle while driving because I use the straw inside the unit and I only need one hand to get a drink. I don't have to lean my head back to drink. It's not necessary to remove the top or open it. Just push the button.  If I want to use the container without the straw it just unscrews. Also... it fits into the container holes on the golf cart.If the bottle tips over, all of the water doesn't come out, even if the spout is open. It will only slowly leak. I can lay the Contigo on the car seat on its side if the spout is closed with no leaking.I bought the original because it had BPA free materials as does this new one. This is a really good bottle and I highly recommend it.

The price of the TCP LED bulbs was excellent. They work just as they should and light immediately unlike my older florescent bulbs. I have started replacing all of the older bulb since the savings is very great. As far as the longevity, according to the package it should be many years before we find out if this is true.

I have played horseshoes many times during my life. I've even had horseshoe pits in the yard from time to time, but always removed them. It seems they go for quite awhile without playing and then are in the way.The Viva Sol set in a box looked like a good idea to me.The steel posts are very nice and are pounded into the ground about 9-10 inches. Easy in and easy out. The whole set fits securely into the box and can then be put away when finished. Having the set available and easy to set up is the answer for me. I like playing them in a family or friend gathering and then remove them.The horseshoes are just as they should be and have a good paint coating on them for longevity. They throw well and the posts are secure.The set comes with directions to set up a permanent pit, but I find the portability of the set a very nice feature. As with other Viva Sol games, the box is great looking, strong and well designed. Everything fits securely without rattling around. This is a very nice set to either use as a permanent pit or to just use as you wish, at home, on the beach or elsewhere.

I applaud Campbell's for trying their hand at Organic soup. I wish that I would have received more than one small box to review so that I could have given it a better test. My wife and I split a box which is really enough for one person. I must mention that the box opens in a simple, but ingenious way. No spill, no scissors.My wife found the soup a little bland, likely... since it doesn't have as much salt as many soups. She does love salty food. I found the Chicken Noodle to have a more sophisticated flavor than the soups I had as a kid, though I did add a little salt as well. I will order it again for those times when I want a quick meal. I liked it. We eat mostly organic, local and home grown food and I am always on the lookout for organic foods.The main reason that I am glad to see this soup is that it does not contain MSG. When I was a kid, we had a lot of Campbell's Chicken Noodle, Tomato and Mushroom soup (in casseroles). Unfortunately, I had headaches few times a week throughout much of my childhood and teens. It wasn't until I was well into adulthood that I learned it was from MSG in the soups. Also, we had Accent on the table in a shaker which I sometimes used.For those who are interested... MSG is a natural byproduct of the sugar refining process, it acts as a flavor enhancer, not a spice. I read it described in this way, if a chicken soup required 5 chickens in the soup to give it a certain intensity of flavor, if you add MSG it only requires one chicken for the same flavor. MSG is cheaper than chicken. I also found that as much as ten percent of the population has bad reactions to MSG. Asian and Mexican restaurants used to be the big users of MSG. Many have stopped. Also, having been a teacher, I had access to the school cafeteria kitchen. It is still used to a great extent in schools especially in gravy and sauces. In one gravy in which I checked ingredients, MSG came up in three different parts of the gravy mix. ( I missed 3 days of work with a headache among other nasty reactions) I then came back and checked the ingredients.The bottom line is that I thought the Campbell's Chicken Noodle Soup was very good and I am grateful for organic ingredients and no MSG.

The Primos 12MP Proof Cam 48 HD Trail Camera takes videos at a much higher quality than my old VHS shoulder mounted camera of yesteryear. Since I don't have the time to get the camera into the woods until later this month (Aug.) I did some tests on it at home.I have used game cameras for about 5 years now and have three of them. One was cheap (died after one season) and two were moderately priced.The Primos is the smallest of them. It is the easiest to use: open the camera door, put in 8 AA batteries. Turn to set up and set the time with button arrows. Set the photo quality with a slide button. Set it to photo, video or both with another slide button. Set the time interval between shots with another slide button. Attach it to the tree, turn it on, close it up, done.My other cameras use mini-bungee cords to attach to the tree, the Primos uses a dull-green strap with an infinite adjusting latch. This is very nice.The problem with the black mini-bungees and me...I keep dropping them. The strap will fit from about a 3 inch diameter tree up to 20 inch diameter. This more versatile than the bungees.This camera does not come with batteries or a SDHC memory card so make sure you get them. The memory card fits into the side of the camera so it's easy to get to while attached to the tree. The batteries are in the cover and easy to access also. The weather proofing of this unit seems good, but only a few months in the woods will really tell. Also it has a camera tri-pod mount if you wish to use it that way.I set up the camera in the kitchen at 3 second interval photos at low definition. I have about 50 shots of my "dear". The quality is good and she never realized what was happening. I then put it into the backyard near a wooded area for about 24 hours. I got a few pictures of me walking around during the day (super quality) and some very good quality shots of three different cats and a possum at night. The day shots were always perfect, the night shots very good when still, and average quality when moving. The light in the night shots was more than adequate.Next I tried the video, using myself as the subject which is very disturbing at my age. The video was really of good quality.Of the cameras that I have used, this is by far the best. It is definitely the easiest to use. It seems that, as with most electronics, the game cameras are getting better at a lower price.

The FoodSaver bags look very good, thick and if the advertising is solid, they will really keep out the air. Oxygen is the problem with freezing food. Unfortunately, when I ordered the FoodSaver bags I did not realize that they were meant for a vacuum sealer. I ordered them for my old Seal-a-Meal unit. I did try them on the old sealer that I have and they do work just fine, but the air must be pushed out manually with mine. Sorry, FoodSaver, I didn't realize that I needed your sealer machine for a comprehensive review.

I really like this new GolfBuddy WT5 Golf GPS Watch. I have tried the hand held Garmin, a cheaper variety GPS watch which died after a year, and the GolfBuddy VT3. Perhaps the biggest difference between the various units that I have had is the battery life.The Garmin hand held would last at most 2 rounds and then the double A batteries would need replacing. The cheap watch model would last one round on a charge. The GolfBuddy VT3 would last one round on a charge though sometimes it would quit on the 18th hole. The GolfBuddy WT5 lasted 27 holes during this weeks playing and according to the battery symbol still had about 40% battery life left yet.The GolfBuddy VT3 could be worn as a watch, clipped to the hat or kept in a pocket, the WT5 is a watch only. The VT3 had a sound option for distance which I finally found just irritating rather than helpful. The WT5 has no sound option. The VT3 had a touch screen which did not seem to be sensitive enough, so worked very poorly. The WT5 has buttons to change functions, which I prefer. The yardage numbers on the WT5 are large and very easy to see even without my reading glasses. The VT3 took hours, usually overnight to re-charge. The WT5 took about 1 1/2 hours.Getting to the added functions such as of getting hazard distances on the WT5 is easy. Also the time of day is almost always displayed and is set by the unit each time it connects to the satellite.The band on the WT5 is soft plastic (like rubber) and is reasonably comfortable with a lot of holes so that it can fit any wrist. The WT5 is a little smaller and much lighter than the VT3 that I have been using.Overall I find the GolfBuddy WT5 the best GPS that I have used for the needs that I have. It gives me front, back and middle of green distances, hazards, time, scoring options and a few added options that I seldom would use such as dynamic green view. I like this unit a lot.

The Suave Men's Body Wash, 2 in 1 is a new product for me. I have always used bar soap, but decided to try this product which is a shampoo and body wash.It seems to work very well for both my hair and as a body soap. I find that as a shampoo, it works as well as any that I have used.Since a body wash is new to me, I can only compare it to the bar soap I have used. I find that it leaves the feeling of having used soft water on my skin. My bar soap feels "squeaky", unlike the slick feeling of soft water washing. The Suave feels good, just different. We don't have soft water but using the Suave makes it feel a bit that way. The scent is pleasant, not too strong, but I would prefer unscented. I can't really pin down what the scent is like to describe it. I haven't decided whether I will abandon my bar soap yet. The wash is easier to use. In any case I will use the Suave as a shampoo.

The Rapid K1 retro Classic Stapling Pliers has a 5 year warranty and is a Swedish product. The stapler loads easily and has a very comfortable handle. I found that I could staple a number of times very quickly with not much effort. I tried stapling through a folded over magazine, it would staple up to about 90 pages with no problem and with little pressure. The staples were curled perfectly. The stapler holds a full section of staples and I must emphasize that it is easy to push the staples through the paper. It seems like a substantially made product that will last.

I am seldom as impressed with anything like the way I was blown away by the A5PRO DJ headphones. The sound is expansive and complete. The whole room is in your head. The distortion is less than 0.1% THD. This, like most things is relative and does not always mean much since all really good headphones will be in that range. More importantly is how they sound to you the listener.I am no youngster so I sampled some of the music that I have listened to for years. It included Emmy Lou Harris, Gordon Lightfoot, Jimmi Hendrix, Neal young, Clannad. The Beatles, and Crosby, Stills and Nash.  I have a headset for my computer, one for my Android and several for my sound system. What I heard with the A5PRO really amazed me. I could discern separate instruments that I never heard before. I noticed a tambourine in a Mamas and Papas song, that I had never knew was there. Some of the qualities in Hendrix's voice amazed me since I always thought that he had no real depth in his voice. I could hear, and feel, the drums in songs as a separate sound rather than just a beat. I found even at fairly high volume that I could not notice any distortion.The headphones have a large L and R on the side of the phones for right and left, quick glance, got it. The foam pads are comfortable and can be changed. The pads really keep out room noise very well. I like the fact that the cable can be plugged into either side and the jack screws on so that it does not just fall off with movement. The phones have the option of three different ear pads. I have the large round pad, I would prefer the large oval that would cover my whole ear, since at times I wear hearing aids which are behind the top of my ear. I seldom where them with headphones on, but it would be better at times.As you can tell, I really an impressed with the A5PRO.

The Black & Decker Allure Iron is a very smooth moving iron. It glides very well. It takes a bit longer than my old iron to heat up and the water fill is not as handy to use as it could be.It has excellent directions which are very easy to follow. The steam and spray buttons are easy to use and are placed in a handy position. It is simple to set the temperature and it looks good. This seems to be a good product.

The Extreme Max BoatTector 24" will be replacing some round boat to dock protectors that I managed to loose in Canada. Like any of these devises, They are light and can be blown out of the boat or if not tied down securely, during a windy night.  The boat where I am using the protectors is a 16 foot fishing boat (Lowe). The BoatTextors fit well over the side of the boat and onto the gunwales. This will likely give added protection in windy conditions. I was concerned that the flat design might not give as much protection as the round type, but on examination, I don't feel this is the case. The foam inside the protectors is firm, slightly spongy and appears to have a tough covering. The ropes are substantial and  easy to use. I have two compartment in the boat that have doors that lift up and close tightly. They are in the position where I put the BoatTectors so I put the ropes into the compartments with the protectors in the right position and then close the compartment doors on the ropes. This is very secure on my boat, and quick. The Extreme Max fold at the crease and will easily fit into my boats compartments when not in use.Like all boat to dock/boat protectors, in very heavy waves, there is always the chance that the top edge of the boat gunwale will hit the dock at the top of the protector. I believe this could happen to the Extreme Max as well. I'm not aware of any good options in heavy waves other than getting the boat out of the water. Overall, the Extreme Max has so far worked very well.

The Minky retractable Reel Outdoor Dryer (clothesline) appears to be very good. I've just started using it. The product seems very substantial and hopefully will last for years. The lines come out easily and clip onto the cross beam/pole that I placed in the yard. The unit comes with ? shaped hooks to screw into the cross beam and inserts for the screws which attach the base unit into a wall. The screws provided are used directly into the wooden wall without the inserts.There is a lot of line on each of the spools; likely to be used as the other line would age, weather and perhaps break. I used only 1/6th of the spool line since I placed the post only 15 feet from the wall.Attaching the line to the spool unit when it is pulled out for use, is simple, but will take a bit of practice to get the line tight. The farther the line is out the more it would have a tendency to sag. The Reel looks good, I like not always having the line out all the time and I only have one small post in the yard now. This is really a nice unit and was simple to put up. Also...the reel unit can be removed from the wall quickly if you desire.

Pride Professional Tee System is not for me. They are certainly good, and expensive tees, and probably are great for some golfers. I found that the color area was hidden in the grass and I really could not clearly see how far into the ground it was placed. I just ended up looking at the distance from the grass to the top of the tee as I always have. I did not find the color area useful.

The Avery Pearlized Address Labels; I was never able to print a label except on to a sheet of regular paper. I spent 50 minutes on live chat with a very patient Avery Rep. and finally was told to download something to bypass adobe. I did this. I ended up in an endless loop of saving the design to pdf, saving it to my Avery account, trying to print and being asked everything again. I've spent about 1 and 1/2 hours at this point and give up. I reviewed another Avery product and had no trouble and it was great. I am not a computer techie so do not seem to be able to use Avery for this label. Initially I was told that there is no template for this product, but clearly there is. I just cannot find a way to use it. I get through to the last step, press print and then start over again.

The reason I ordered the BeeKeeping veil and jacket was because the mosquitoes are so bad this year. We need it to pick raspberries, blueberries, and work in the yard. It works very well for that purpose.  My wife came in with a bucket of blueberries and only a bite on her hand. No size is indicted on the site, but it fits my wife just fine. I am almost 6'2" and not too heavy and I can just get it on. It is probably about a men's size large, but just barely. It would be better with longer sleeves as well since I generally wear large long. The price was very good.

The Viva Sol Premium Washer Toss Game is nicely put together in an attractive wooden case. The game reminds me of bean bag, Jarts, ring toss, or a kids horse shoes game. If you like to play these types of games, this is a good one for you. The "washers" are large and covered with rubber for indoor play.The game seems sturdy and should last a long time. I really like the clips that are used to hold the two parts of the game (carrying case) together. They are quick and easy to release and attach when opening or closing.The directions indicate that the distance of the toss should be 20 feet. We played it indoors at a much shorter distance which works just fine. I feel it would be rather hard to score at 20 feet. The case I received did have a couple of chips out of it, but not enough that I would have even sent it back. Overall the quality is very good.

The Alkazone seems to do the trick. I have used it and other brands through the years; and found that when it is used daily for a few days, the test paper does show a substantial change in pH. It's difficult to determine which action that I am taking to keep healthy is really working. I must rely on the information that I read about being too acidic, which then allows disease to flourish in the body. This is an inexpensive and easy thing to do.

The Black & Decker Performance FusionBlade Blender is a 4 to 5 star product. I have had many blenders for review and also had and used, many others at friends homes since I have made smoothies every day for about 7-8 years. I will compare them and list the functions of the Performance Blender.The Performance has 5 pre-programmed settings:  number 1 - soup -  blends gradually slow to fast with fairly short blending time  number 2 - nut butters -  starts with a slow pulse, then pulses faster until finished  number 3 - personal jar/half recipes -  slow to fast pulse, then very fast until stopped  number 4 - dry goods -  short time at slow, medium for awhile then very fast  number 5 - smoothies - slow to medium with long pulse action, then fast until the endThe personal blender jar would be good for individual smoothies. It has an extra lid which seals with a drinking spout. This could be taken with you like any water container. The lid with the blade comes off and the drinking lid is then attached.The Performance Blender can also be used at various speeds and a manual pulse feature. It comes with a short cookbook. Hot food may be used with the the large jar only.I made a few smoothies, crushed ice for snow cones and tried all of the various settings. The smoothies were very smooth, about the same as my $200 blender but not nearly as smooth as my Jamba blender which cost about 4-5 times the price as the Performance. All were much smoother than the Ninja I tried and the cheap blenders that I have used. When I made the snow cone ice, the lid of the Performance nearly flew off, I then realized that the lid snaps down around the jar lid which I had not done.  It was secure after that.The noise level is about average for a better blender, not the horrible whine of the "cheapies". My most expensive blender when on high is the loudest, but it goes much faster.I have noticed that the better blenders do not have the sharp blades of the old blenders, for whatever reason they work better that way. Also, the odd shaped jars seem to work better than the smooth round jars. This blender has a large base and is taller than most. Almost all of the blenders have a plastic jar, though glass ones can be found. The Performance is plastic which I prefer, because of the light weight. The drive gears between the jar and the machine base are a semi-hard plastic as with most blenders. The very expensive blenders have metal gears. It is impossible to address the longevity of any of the blenders. I had an inexpensive old Marvelizer which ran for about 20 years and a friend had a $600. blender that didn't make it a year. Only time will tell. This Black & Decker Blender is a very good blender for the price.

The Dove Men+Care Bar seemed to have a very strong fragrance when I opened the package. I thought, this will be a bit too much for me. But... when I use it in the shower it is not too strong at all. It has the fragrance of a light old style men's cologne that I can't place. One problem that I have always had with Dove is that it got so soft and mushy after use. Though this bar is softer than my usual hard bar soap, it is not at all as soft as the regular Dove.I am always very skeptical of products made just for men/women, so I tried the Dove with that attitude. I'm still not sold that a product such as this is truly designed with some ingredients that work better for one sex or the other. I did find the soap pleasant enough and it surprisingly did make a difference in the texture of my skin. It does feel less dry, though it being  mid-summer, it is not the true test. Only our dry winters will tell.My wife thought it was nice, oops wrong gender.

I am in my mid sixties and was told by my doctor to to take B-12. This was especially important since I had been taking some prescriptions which depleted B-12 in my system. I have been taking B-12 for several years now and will continue. I have used Jarrow products before and do feel that they are good. The dosage of about 2000-2500 mg daily is what is recommended by my doctor.I have never taken the time to research the information on B-12 and so I just take the advise of my doctor and Jarrow that it is beneficial. There is no way to really tell if it is working since brain function is so subjective anyway. With that in mind I recommend Jarrow B-12 as a very good option to keep my brain working properly.

I am new to label printing and have not used shipping labels previously. I ordered the Avery White Shipping Labels for my wife's business to be used with a list of patrons. Since I had not done this before, I went to the Avery web site and put in the product number (the large number on the label box). This brought up a very big list of possible templates to use. The templates covered various business types and many other possibilities, such as Christmas labels. I will later explore using my wife's own logo on a blank or designed template.I picked a template and proceeded to try my first printing. The directions, and use of available options, were simple to follow. Very important to me... any mistakes could be easily corrected. After I put in the information on the sample label, a preview appeared of how the labels would look on the label page. I checked my spelling again and pressed print.As I pressed print, I was advised to make a change in my printer's settings. This was changed with an Avery prompt and was easy to do. I appreciated this prompt as opposed to just allowing me to print it incorrectly. At this point I'm about 7-8 minutes into my first label printing. As far as I'm concerned, no time at all. I pressed print again and the shipping labels printed out perfectly. The quality is excellent. One option on the Avery site was to go to their videos on YouTube by clicking an icon on the Avery printing page. The videos allowed me to see and understand the other options and many possibilities for the labels. These videos were very easy to understand. They are excellent.Overall... I found the whole procedure to print labels easy and enjoyable.

The main ingredient in Sundown Naturals Heart Balance is Terminalia Arjuna Bark. It has been used for thousands of years as part of the Ayurvedic health system in India. I have tried this supplement with no noticeable side effects. As far as helping the heart, this is rather hard to determine without scientific studies. One is taking the word of the company producing it and a study of Ayurved.I have taken various Ayurved supplements off and on for about 35 years and have gathered some information on them. Most traditional Ayurvedic "doctors" in this practice will indicate that the picking or harvesting of the ingredients is very important. The time of the year, time of day and even the picker has an affect on the product. The way it is processed and handled is also very important to its effectiveness and safety. It is hard to determine whether the correct procedures have been followed with any products.There is some evidence that Arjuna can cause a decrease in blood sugar and so diabetics should be aware of this. As with many supplements pregnant or nursing women should be careful.Only more time will tell whether this particular supplement works.

I am very impressed with the Philips F1/27 Fidelio Headset. The sound is the best that I have heard through a headset. I have a Logitech noise cancelling set and a few others. This headset is light and easy to forget you are wearing it. The foam molds around my ears and blocks off much of the sound occurring around me. Though this set would probably not stay on well for jogging, it does stay on well for working around the house .I have been using the Fidelio with my MotoX phone listening to  Amazon Prime Music.The button on the headset cord will pause, not just mute, the sound and return to playing with another push. The sound volume is controlled on the phone.When a call is received on the phone, the music pauses and the call comes through the headset. My response is then picked up by mike in the headset and comes through clearly to the person calling. I am somewhat hard of hearing and wear hearing aids except when I'm on the phone. Listening through the Fidelio gives me the best sound quality that I have had in quite some some on the phone. It is always easiest for me to hear music and TV through a headset than speakers in any case, but the Fidelio has really made it great to listen to music and to hear voices on the phone.

This is a good quality product for that crazy special touch to your Halloween table. The lace looks well made with a lot of detail. The price is very low.  It is long enough for the average table and could likely be hand washed with no problem. It's ready to use from the package.

A Banquet of Consequences: A Lynley Novel.... is unlike my usual murder mystery read. It is long and it took about 180 pages of character introduction and development before a murder was even committed. Though this book is extremely well written and the characters are as real as can be, it developed a bit slow for me.When all of the introduction was completed, I must say that it became hard to put down. When I ordered it, I thought it would be another quick and easy detective type novel, but it is much more than that. This is a really good book and the only reason for any negative comments in this review, is that it was not a perfect fit for me. If you like a lot of setting description, strong character development, and a "pay attention" novel, A Banquet of Consequences is for you. All being said and done, I did enjoy the novel very much.

My wife wanted wanted something colorful for her new black Moto X smart phone so she could find it easily. This case has just enough color for this purpose. I was concerned that it had all of the right holes, in the right places, to allow the phone to function as it should. All openings fit perfectly. The case fit was perfectly over the phone. It isn't as protected as the really large cases, but it is quite adequate. If you throw your phone around, I would get a thicker, heavier case. This case fits the Moto X second generation phone. The phone says 2014 on it, though it was purchased new in June 2015.

I have ordered the Melitta filters many times and find them to be excellent. I like to Natural Brown. I have hopes that they will have no bleaches as the white likely has in them. The price is great and I don't have to worry about running out.

The first bag arrived busted open with loose chick peas flung all over the box. I requested a replacement and it arrived fine. The label says they're distributed by Dishaka Gourmet in Texas; a regular white label added to the bag said "Produce of Canada" and "Best Before 11/25/2016." Having bought the chick peas in June 2015 I was pleased to find them fresh, both in the date on the bag and in the taste after cooking. I cook and eat a lot of chick peas and can recognize freshness. I've knocked off a star for the number of "mystery" darker chick peas I've encountered. (Typically, if I buy Goya or other brand name chick peas, I might only find one or two mystery-dark-chick-peas in a bag.) I can definitely recommend these and would buy again if the price as right.

I know it's risky to order canned goods online but I have ordered a variety of canned foods from Amazon and while a lot have indeed arrived dented, I can count on Amazon to make good. That being said, 16 of the 24 cans in this package had some kind of dent, from minor to substantial.16! Not only that, but the worst dented cans were the innermost ones, tucked out of sight, as if somebody along the way deliberately hid them. This is just a nuisance. Disappointing. I wouldn't knowingly buy dented cans at the grocery store; I don't want them from Amazon, and especially not when I am paying for them - this ain't no food pantry.I liked that these carrots had no salt. Prior to ordering I did a little internet research into what the deal is with the (salt) substitute calcium chloride listed. I felt okay with what I learned. Yes, I'd be happier with no additions, but at least the calcium chloride didn't get a bad rap from what I read. The carrots themselves are okay for canned carrots and should be fine for adding to soups, etcetera.

I always used to buy the cheapest foundation or something on sale. I didn't know what I was missing. I am so pale and this super-light color is ideal. I love how smoothly it goes on. I do habitually apply a light powder as well to set it because on its own, I think it would not stay put and/or get that unattractive creased look. I am a repeat buyer. It's a pleasure to use decent foundation!

I'm kicking myself for NOT verifying the oven temperature before the 30-day return window slammed shut. (Suspicious, I only thought too late to put an oven thermometer inside.) Worse, I recycled the box and packaging it came in so I no longer have a way of shipping it back to Black & Decker even if I wanted to go to the trouble, which I don't. Did I miss the reviews that said this oven doesn't get hot enough? Maybe, because for whatever reason, I just assumed it was actually reaching the temperature IT IS SET TO. Naive me. The oven won't reach 350 degrees when set at the highest indicator of 450 degrees. I did not want a giant toaster; I wanted a working oven.There's nothing else worth saying about it given its fatal flaw.EDIT Jul 21: This is weird. If I set the oven for 350 degrees, it won't reach it, even if I subsequently turn up the temperature dial past 350. However, it seems recently that if I initially set the dial at its highest temp of 450 degrees, the oven *will* get hotter. What a pain. All the more annoying because I got this in part because the full-size oven where I live has an inaccurate temperature.

It was love from the first taste. I figured with those ingredients, how could it miss? It's just the right mix of sweet and hot. Not overly hot at all. I am using it exclusively to put on food, not as a marinade, and frankly I think using it as a marinade would make it disappear far too quickly. Only discipline is keeping me from going through the whole bottle too quickly!  There's no tiny plastic cap with a center hole so it just pours out.Couple small issues. "Habanero powder" is listed as an ingredient rather than habaneros - never heard of it and tend to think it's a corner-cutter. I'd also happier if xanthan gum was eliminated, but at least it's the last ingredient listed (so there's not a lot of it in the sauce). The bottle has no expiration date nor does it say whether to refrigerate after opening (my email to Customer Service through Melindas, the manufacturer, wasn't answered). I paid a couple dollars for this bottle and if the price was the same in the future, I'd absolutely purchase again.

I bought it based on the glowing reviews. I am a very moderate coffee drinker and wanted to brighten up my teeth (remove stains) as this product claims. I can tell absolutely no difference after several uses. I grant it 2 stars just for its mildly abrasive cleaning properties which are not unlike baking soda. But I didn't need a cleaner, I wanted a stain remover. Would not buy again.

I'm a woman and these fit my hands - which are not "man hands" - just fine. I bought them because of all the good reviews. Reviews which utterly perplex me now because the gloves were of such mediocre quality. I have purchased quite a few different brands of jersey gloves over the years and these were close to the worst. I wear jersey gloves for gardening and this brand became full of holes the very first time used. Most other brands I've tried could be counted on for several wears. I'm gardening not working in the mines or doing construction!

I buy these from Dollar Tree of all places and have only good things to say. I am consistently pleased with the quality and taste of this US product. By contrast, looking at the Bumble Bee 10oz whole baby clams also sold on Amazon, I see they're a product of China. (My intention is not to China-bash, but there are many indications food products from China just don't have the kind of quality control I'd want.) Not unexpectedly, the Cape May clams include, in addition to clam juice, salt & sugar, Sodium Tripolyphosphate (retain juices) and Calcium Sodium EDTA (preserve color).The label includes a Satisfaction Guarantee, with specific instructions and a specific address - none of the typical try-and-find-us-if-you-can business - but I've never had any reason to contact the company.After rinsing well, I use these clams in pasta and on homemade pizzas. So good!

The player was dead in under two months. IF it had lasted, I WOULD have told you it had decent sound so long as you're not "all about that bass." There's no way to adjust treble/bass and Miss Kitty favors the treble end of things. I used the cassette and CD player regularly in its short life. Then one day it was working and the next it was not. I tried a different outlet and also swapped out the cord for another I had. Nothing. Not a buzz, not a whimper.The manual says there is a 90-day warranty (a lot of confidence the maker has in its product, huh?) but of course the customer must pay shipping. No way. I bought this from Amazon Warehouse and I'm not going to throw (more) good money after JUNK. I hesitated a lot before this purchase, wondering if my choice would be cost-effective; that is whether it would be better to put the money this cost toward a better quality, more expensive player. I picked the wrong door evidently. I cannot recommend this player at all. Fat waste of money.

Oh.my.gracious.me. This is olive lovers crack. The trouble will not be what to DO with so many olives; it will be not shoveling them all down TOO FAST. I am working on pacing myself. Yes, they are salty; I float mine around in a small cup of water prior to eating, as none of us needs extra salt. Or oil.After opening, I put the plastic jar in the fridge. However I saw  a clever idea online for freezing olives via muffin tins! I experimented with freezing a small portion in water in a muffin tin cup and the next day, thawed it by running hot water over it. It worked! The texture seemed the slightest bit altered but nothing that will keep me from freezing a bunch this way. (I will be most unhappy if I leave them in the refrigerator and they eventually go bad.)The idea is you freeze them in muffin tins and once frozen, pop outp the little olive blocks and keep them in a freezer bag for future use. If you want to do this, I'd suggest that you do as I did and initially try freezing just one little portion to ensure you are satisfied with how they taste once defrosted.Go olives! Go olives!

The colors are pretty and apply very easily. They also MOVE AROUND very easily after application. What use is "very pigmented" eyeshadow if the pigment soon moves to places you didn't apply it, thus making it look scanty where you did?? I love how it goes on the eyelid. But within two hours it moves into the crease and above. I hate that look of traveling eyeshadow. And this is when applied OVER foundation and powder. I do not have oily skin; I never did and now that I'm middle-aged, it's definitely not the case, so the problem is the eyeshadowI was so excited to try this especially since NYX gets such solid reviews. I did buy a cheap tube of E.L.F. primer to see if that will help, but I shouldn't have to do that, and what's more, the foundation/powder base I use is sufficient for other brand eyeshadows I use. Disappointed.EDIT Jul 21: I have been regularly using these shadows which are so pretty and flattering to my blue eyes. I've realized that the problem I describe is much more noticeable with the *darker* shades in the pallet.

I like big, manual clocks. Maybe it's a leftover from childhood and the humongous clocks kids usually learned to tell time by; I don't know. So far, after a few weeks, all seems fine. It's an unusual color - not really orange and not really red. It's a little loud but I expect that from a clock like this. Not much else to tell you. It doesn't do any tricks, no little cuckoo birds pop out or anything. Will report back on its lifespan if need be. (I had another Sterling & Noble clock that lasted decades, but I don't expect such things any more....)UPDATE Jun 13: This is odd; I've had to replace the battery twice already. Maybe it's a fluke (how much juice could this clock use??). I can tell you this: the clock starts to fade as soon as a battery gets "low" - I have a terrific little battery tester purchased from Amazon so that's how I know the battery is low. The used battery might still be okay for something else but no longer in the clock. Again, maybe this is particular to my clock.

(Note: I bought Light; pay no mind to the auto-generated incorrect number.) The way the colors are listed in the product photo, the lighter shades are lower numbers (Light is 10) and the darker shades get progressively higher numbers. I am very fair so I chose Light, the lowest number available, but it is too dark for me, too muddy in hue. Beyond that, I'm not all that wild about how it applies. I far prefer CoverGirl Invisible Concealer Fair, but you know how the story goes, I was trying to save some money and bought this. I'm hoping the shade will work a little better on me in summer when I get a little suntan, but I would not buy again.

I did not buy this corn from Amazon but as I just opened a can this week, I can tell you I thought the kernels were puny and a dull shade of yellow. Most significantly, they didn't "pop" with fresh corn flavor. In fact, I think my local grocery store's no-name corn (Shur Fine) is better than this brand name corn. This corn isn't terrible but it isn't "oh yum" delicious either.

I read the reviews and info and went with a large, although I wear a US small. It fit - more or less - at first. The fabric is of decent weight and quality and I like how the back dips lower. If you have a little booty - as do most of us - the shirt will bunch or roll a little there as opposed to flowing over your backside, but it still looks okay. Initially, I liked it enough to consider buying a second one but I'm glad I didn't. The sleeves, even on this large, are just too snug and moreover, the neckline is too loose (and increasingly so with wear). I washed the shirt about 3 times and the neckline became too stretched out and loose. I'd consider buying other Doublju shirts but only with a more fitted neckline so they wouldn't have a chance to stretch out as this one has. The too-tight sleeves and too loose neckline made for a weird fit. I donated it. Not a good buy.

I'm a size 8.5 and these were an accurate fit (I see that it says above that I bought size 6 but I actually bought 8.5). The color is more vibrant than it appears on my computer screen, which is a *good* thing. I wouldn't call them orange so much as a cross between orange and pink. I love it. I'm dinging a star because the quality isn't stellar and they don't look like they'll have an especially long life; they are definitely more "fashion" than athletic.The stitching around the tongue in particular is sort of cheap looking. Other than that, they look good. I swapped out the black laces for neon green and that makes them positively pop. When I was a kid, we didn't have shoes like these and I am delighted, at my age, to now have such a fabulous pair! I've been admiring bright shoes on kids for years; it's a little late, but not too late for me to be a cool kid.EDIT/NOTE Apr 6: I wore them for the first time yesterday, taking an under 2 miles walk, leisurely walk. After, I looked at the shoe bottoms - already showing wear at the heel!! Are you kidding me?? If you know of any clever way to protect the sole, I'd strongly suggest doing so before wearing these shoes. Too bad - they are so cute, and for casual walking, comfortable. If the wear progresses, as it surely WILL, I may try to "build up" the heel with Shoe Goo (also sold on Amazon).

UPDATE March 2015: I initially said good things about these slippers but once I washed them midwinter it all went downhill. They became way too loose so they don't stay on which is potentially hazardous, particularly on stairs. I am trying to "grab* them on with my toes as I walk - which is both a nuisance and from what I've read, unhealthy for the foot (podiatrists don't like grab-on style shoes, like flip-flops and certain sandals). Insult to injury, all the cushy-ness in the bottom disappeared - whether from wear or washing, they are now flat, flat, flat, with no support. I think Isotoner is riding along on the weight of its name, which used to represent quality. I've also had junky gloves and umbrellas from them in recent years. These slippers didn't last one winter. Buh-bye Isotoner: you charge too much for your diminished quality.EARLIER REVIEW: I generally wear size 8.5 and these fit just fine. Initially, I had to take my forefinger to "hook" my foot into the back but over a short time, they loosened enough so that I could just step into them. They are VERY comfortable, but as others have noted, low on style with a fairly utilitarian look. I really like having a substantial sole, which makes the slippers more shoe-like. There are winter days I spend hours in these so I want that support. I knew before purchase that I wouldn't like that white cuff because it was sure to get dingy looking - and I was right about that.You should know that while they are machine-washable, the instructions say not to put the slippers in a dryer. That wasn't going to be an issue for me since there is no dryer available where I live. HOWEVER...when I washed them for the first time this winter, they took 3 days to completely dry! That is not entirely practical and I don't imagine I'll be rushing to wash them too frequently.

Unlike most of the other reviewers so far, I was unimpressed with these leggings. The color is nice, but other than that, they are cheaply made. The weave is thin and open. They were not long enough on me (I'm 5'8") and they fit oddly, snug enough in legs, strangely baggy below the fitted waist. The fabric was not comfortable; it felt scratchy-cheap. This is the first Nautica item I've purchased and based on these leggings, I would not buy Nautica again. Disappointing.

I was looking for exactly these nails, and at the time of purchase they were about a dollar and a quarter. Because I took the time to count the nails - yes, that's the kind of person I am - this made them cost about one and a half cents apiece. The nails look fine except for one which arrived bent.

I bought this for the color - lime green - and that is its best feature. It is small but I expect it'll be useful to me this summer for toting around lightweight items. On the plus side, the inside seams are covered, lending reinforcement. On the not-so-plus side, the zippers do not move easily; in fact that edge of fabric that can be seen going over the larger of the two zippers sort of gets in the way of easily zipping and unzipping. I have a feeling the fact they don't zip easily may be irritating. Unlike other backpacks I've owned, this one has no padding on the back to protect its wearer from being stabbed by whatever is in the pack. (That *may* be advantageous in summer because thick paddings in backpacks make my back sweat on steamy summer days and I suppose, add to the weight, if only a little). It's an okay pack if you don't have especially high expectations.

I chose a medium based on the sizing suggestion to go up one size. Despite Asian sizing, I figured that since the top is both described as loose and appears to flow over the model's hips, that would allow for some fit leeway (I'm 5'8", 125, and would typically opt for a US small).What none of the photos show though, is that on both sides, at about hip level, there are effectively DARTS sewn in (2 on either side) -- darts, usually found at the chest. I was so confused at this styling that I checked to make sure both sides had them and it wasn't just a defect! The upper part of the blouse is loose on me and the sleeves are nice & long (I have long arms), but the bottom is close to my hips AND bunches oddly because of those darts. If you like the look of Oompa Loompa hips, this is the shirt for you.The fabric, described as flannel, is soft but thin. It wouldn't keep you warm in winter. The color is not quite as vibrant. The workmanship is poor - not only were there big loose threads under the sleeve, but it had been incorrectly stitched so that about an inch of unfinished seam sticks out and shows on the OUTSIDE (i.e., "right" side of the garment).

I'm a woman, 5`8", 125 lbs. I got a small and it's definitely baggy and loose on me, but not so much so that it looks like I'm wearing somebody else's clothes. The sweatshirt is very comfortable and cozy, not to mention I picked it up for an excellent price. However, now that I've worn & washed it a couple times, I see the dreaded *pilling* on the front of the pocket. This irritates me. So far, the pilling seems concentrated in that area, so I can only wonder if it's caused by wearing my winter coat over the sweatshirt (i.e., the two fabrics rubbing?) The color isn't as vibrant now either, which is not unexpected with red, but I had hoped that the 50/50 poly/cotton blend would help keep the color longer (all cotton usually means you can say goodbye to bright colors in short order).I really do like this sweatshirt and don't regret the purchase but would likely be disinclined to buy again. If I think to, I'll weigh back in on how it continues to wear - and pill - over more time.

This is the third "lamp in a box" I purchased. As you might guess, I really like these lamps. They combine two things I love: light and art. This particular one is a bit darker in the light cast due to its darker shade (the other two I have feature predominantly white colored shades and that does allow them to shine brighter). The design makes me think of Aztec art.The lamp, from Amazon Warehouse, did not actually work on arrival, but I was able to reattach the wire which I discovered had come loose (I realize not everybody would know how, or want to do that). This lamp, as do the other two, gives me pleasure every day.

I have used Umbra Tub Dish Drying Rack, Red for the last 2 years and having used this Basin drain for less than a week, I can already tell you it's a better design. This one drains water more effectively, will be easier to clean, and keeps dishes, especially bowls, glasses, and cups, raised so that they aren't sitting in water and/or muck that may accumulate below (all issues with the Umbra Tub model).I took note of the problems people have had with this model not clearing the lip of their sink. My sink has a relatively low edge and I placed the front legs of the drain onto it. To remedy the problem of that end then being counter-productively higher than the opposite end, I placed a small board under the now-lower end's legs. It is worth it to me, given how much I like these Umbra Drains, as compared to standard 2-piece models, to do a few compensatory things to make it work for me.I delight in seeing water actually drip out of the end of the funnel, the way it should! The fact that the funnel/spout can be removed to clean isn't of great benefit - how cruddy can it get? And besides, dishes will never touch it.In order to get the most counter space, I've got the drain pushed all the way to the back of the counter. This means the spout does not line up exactly with the sink but instead with the back stainless steel. Nonetheless, water hits that surface and THEN empties it the sink, so it's working. (Umbra should consider that most sinks will sit further out than does their small dish drain.)As I said, I can already see I like this one better and know it will both *stay* cleaner and be easier to clean than the other Umbra model I owned. And it looks terrific too. Sleek and modern.

This is only the second chipotle powder I've tried but I'm liking it fine. It IS hot so a little goes a distance. I know I must like it, because although it's new to my spice rack, I remember it's there and to use it. I bought this because the price was reasonable at time of purchase and because it is100% ground chipotle peppers with nothing added, unlike some brands with added sodium. Recommended.

The color is whiter than depicted but it is a pretty shade. However, the consistency is weird, very chalky, crumbly, and dry. Does that mean it's old? I don't know. It takes some doing to build up color on the eyelid, but once on, I have to say with added dark liner, it is a nice effect. I got this cheap and would not buy again - picture smashing up a stick of chalk to powder dust and applying that.

I bought these for a kitchen window but had a back-up plan for them if they didn't work well there. They didn't; they were see-thru especially at night. That wasn't going to work. However, they work perfectly to cover up some shelves which hold dishes, so I'm okay with keeping them. They arrived folded and wrinkled, so I used a steamer on them. The color is closer to off-white than "beige."

I took a chance on these because they were a tad cheaper per pound than the Bob's Red Mill Brown Sesame Seeds (i.e., with "shell") that I usually buy. From online research, I found that black seeds have comparable nutrients which is what I want (the traditional white are stripped of some beneficial nutrients).The first thing that I didn't like was the absence of any production or expiration date on the bottle. I went to Colorado Spices website and there, under FAQS, was the claim that all their bottled spices show an expiration date on the front label. Mine did not.  I tried the seeds and found them on the bitter end of the spectrum and dry. They left a bad taste (literally). Admittedly, I have not purchased black seeds before but I have eaten them on bread products and I have the Bob's brown for comparison. I did not want to eat any more of these - I even started to try a second partial spoonful - just to be fair - and no way. I don't want these plain and I don't want to mix them into anything either. Back to Bob's Red Mill I go!EDIT Jan 2: I emailed Colorado Spice about the absence of an expiration date and they told me the number I supplied from the bottle, 13059, is the "Julian date" of March 2013, and that date is "too old for a new sell" and I should seek replacement or reimbursement. Oh yick! No wonder it tasted lousy - sesame seeds go bad. Lord knows where this bottle has been sitting for the last 2 years. A nice, hot warehouse? Yick, yick. I bought this fulfilled by Amazon on 12/22/14.

This isn't the first time I've bought girl's underwear for myself, an adult woman, but it is my first time trying Hanes. I saw a few other reviews where women said they're bought the hipsters for themselves so I decided to see. I bought size 16 and they do fit my 36.5" hips. I think they might work up to 37" hips but no more. I was initially discouraged after trying a pair because there was some cheek-showage in the back that I really don't like; however I tried on the other 8 and they had fuller coverage so I was happy. The best thing I can tell you about these Hanes hipsters is that I was unaware of them being on me the first day I wore them - that is they weren't sliding down, cutting into me or doing any of the other annoying things underwear can do. They were COMFORTABLE and that's excellent news.They are not high end of course, with inexpensive, thin cotton, and slight variations in cut from one to the next (like one pair sits lower on my hips than the others), and I don't yet know how washing will affect them (shrinkage, etc.), but for the price, it's expected. I had give up some years ago on Fruit of the Loom's shoddily-made, fall-apart, cotton underwear, and needed a substitute.The color assortment I received isn't necessarily the first I'd have selected given a choice but they aren't bad either. In my collection are: one white with blue flowers, 3 white with blue trim (rather see-thru), pink with blue trim, dark blue, pink with loud blue design,light blue, and blue-striped.May 2015: Back to say they are washing and wearing well. One laundry trick I have is to put all my undies in a small laundry bag (bought on Amazon) before they go into the machine; I think this helps them last (short of hand-washing). I am happy enough to buy another pack while they're priced low.

How good is this?! Addictive AND healthy. How often does that happen?! I've eaten it in plain, no fat yogurt and that's fine, but mostly I eat it straight out of the bag. Well, not exactly the bag; I poured it into an old glass peanut jar. I really don't need more "cereals" per se, so much as munchy snack foods that won't put me in an early grave. With only *good* stuff, not even sugar like granola has, this muesli is just right.Sadly, after placing two orders, I see the item has been changed to "exclusively" Prime. No amount of arm-twisting is going to get me to part with that annual fee at this point in my life, so it looks like I'll be making my own once my stash evaporates. Buh-bye, lovely Bob's Red Mill muesli, it's been nice!

I'm disappointed. The towel is small for my long hair, but more significantly, it just doesn't dry all that well. For that reason and because the fabric is rough, not soft, I am not convinced it's microfiber. The towel has no label either, to state fabric content or care instructions. It's cheap in every way and I wouldn't buy it again.

Oh my lord - the scent! It smells like a lemon icing for a fabulous cake. My stomach actually rumbled the first time I opened a bottle (although without the reward of a wonderful lemon treat, the Pavlovian response has pretty much since dissipated). Suffice to say, if you're a lemon fan, this is the lotion for you. So far as other qualities, like those having to do with lotion-y (not eating) attributes, I'd say it's good, not great. It feels a bit sticky to me and doesn't have the kind of lasting effects as the St Ive's line (which I see now says it's "exclusively for Prime Members" - probably served in the exclusively for Prime Members Country Club - pah!). I got the 3- pack at a terrific bargain of $3-something and I'm glad I did.

I just couldn't get past the men's aftershave scent. Musky and manly are not the scents I'm going for in a soap. It's strong and put me off immediately. I tried it as an alternative to the pricey Dr. Bronner's line. Guess I'll need to keep waiting for a sale on that.

Pleasantly surprised with this spinach, which is better than the Popeye brand I'd been usually getting (from Amazon or my beloved Dollar Tree). The color is a bright, intense green and the flavor is good. I rinse all canned vegetables before using to lessen the salt (or anything else that's been added), and do so with this spinach too. Definitely one of the best canned spinach brands I've tried.

I'm glad I purchased the carrot variety and merely had the squash one thrown in as a free sample, because I just wasn't as wild about it. It lacked the flavor I'm used to getting when I steam and puree my own squash. A lesser point, but the color is unappetizing too. I'd only buy this if the price was quite low ( which it hasn't been).

I have been looking for awhile for warm, attractive women's pajamas that are reasonably priced. This is a daunting task, amid all the pajamas decorated with monkeys, hearts, peace signs, owls, kittens, cartoon characters, etc., that shout girlish and silly, and cost a bundle. At the other end, there are the "sexy" pajamas that have little to do with staying warm, let alone sleeping (all well and good but not what I'm looking for to lounge in at home alone when it's 20 degrees outside.So I was pleased to find these ("brown animal"), priced under $15 on purchase. The sizing, however, as mentioned by another reviewer, is indeed odd. I'm 5` 8 inches, a solid 125 pounds, with long arms & legs. I started with a medium, and while the sleeves and legs were long enough, the rest was baggy and loose (not fitted and cute like pictured). So I returned that and went for the small. Much better. They feel cozy. The shoulders are a bit snug but that's my build. Oh, also as mentioned by the other reviewer, the quality isn't top-o-the-line, what with one leg being longer than the other! I decided for the price, the grown-up cuteness factor, and the interesting zipper-front styling, that I could live with that. I think I'll be very happy to have these this winter.

I saw this in my local grocery store at a buck a can, so as a corn and pepper lover, decided to try it. Glad I did. The corn is crispy and sweet, tasty enough to simply drain and eat. I take issue only with the peppers, which weren't as impressive-looking as the ones on the can, being both punier and more misshapen, which I'd likely not have really even noticed, but for the photo. Nice corn.

I saw this in my local grocery store at a buck a can, so as a corn and pepper lover, decided to try it. Glad I did. The corn is crispy and sweet, tasty enough to simply drain and eat. I take issue only with the peppers, which weren't as impressive-looking as the ones on the can, being both punier and more misshapen, which I'd likely not have really even noticed, but for the photo. Nice corn.

I'm perfectly satisfied with this honey (which I pounced on when it was priced around $2.50/bottle, unusual lately for any honey). I do have to agree with the reviewer who said they weren't really detecting any particular Raspberry flavor, but the honey itself is fresh, thick and flavorful. Good stuff!

I actually picked a few of these up for free when someone discarded them several years ago. They've been great in terms of their overall usefulness and the sturdiness of the plastic. I find lots of uses for them; they're the sort of product for which possibilities keep appearing. They seem like they'll last indefinitely. However, several of the lids have become detached from the boxes. They're still usable that way but I disliked the separated lids and recycled them. I use the lid-less boxes for open storage inside cabinets.

Oh my gracious. I am SO glad these were not the first brand of peppercorns I ever tried or I might have thought peppercorns themselves were nasty. They were bitter and left a bad aftertaste. (Haddon House was the brand I initially tried and trying to save some money - a sometime risky enterprise - led me to purchase Roland's.) Maybe I got a bad batch, but regardless, they went in the trash. My days of forcing myself to eat something yicky just because it's paid for are over!

It's an okay curtain for my purposes, which is in place of a closet door. I bought it not knowing - despite a grueling search - what "polystraight" means. And guess what? Now that I have the thing, I still don't know! As per my headline, it's a richer color than depicted, deeper, more an army or olive green. That said, it's got stray fabric threads sticking out around the edges and I question how long the curtain will look relatively nice. It's thin but not sheer.

I started with the 32-count to sample this product, as I was unfamiliar with it. I have to say, although each packet holds a miniscule amount of powder, the flavor it packs is notable. Quite good! I'm dinging a star because as per the product website, while the manufacturer has been removing soy from its products, the orange is one of the flavors which still has it (the others being Orange Mango and Orange Ginger spice). Glad I found this and looking forward to trying other flavors.

I bought these for a gift and feel good about giving them to a pepper lover. I think they actually look better than the product photo, and the product photo isn't too shabby. If I hadn't already purchased a different color to keep, I'd want these for myself!

It was disappointing to get these and find them too small, as noted by other reviewers. There are a few manufacturing glitches in them as well; nothing someone else would notice on the wearer though.  You can't tell in the product photos but in addition to the zipper, the side buckles have Velcro attachments that open.I bought the blue in 8.5; I don't know why my review lists black in 9, but that's auto-generated. I have photos I took before returning the boots, but for some reason there's no option for uploading customer photos. At any rate, I did measure the sole of the 8.5 and it was about 9.5" in length, if that's helpful to anyone. Also, while my feet aren't wide, I don't think these would work on someone who needs a wide shoe.

I have this in purple. I probably got not quite 2 years' use out of it before the coating started  visibly wearing off.  I'll be honest; I'm not certain what length of life to expect from this kind and at any rate, the warranty requires the customer to cover the cost of shipping, if in fact, KitchenAid decided to replace it. I'd rather put that money toward a new spatula, but I think I'll try another brand next. Was a very good spatula while it lasted.

My fault for not trying these on as soon as I got them so now, having missed the return window, I can't return them. Maybe the August heat dulled my typically vigilant senses. Sadly, I assumed from looking at them that they'd be okay. They're not. The gloves are small and stiff. I don't know who these are for. I'm a woman and my hand, from base to end of longest finger, is 7". These gloves, advertised as being 10 and 1/8" long, are actually 9.5" at their longest. The fingers are way too short, so that I can't move my fingers. It feels like wearing catcher's mitts or unfunny hand puppets. They tag says they're for "Demolition Roofing Fencing." Maybe so, if tiny women or children will be wearing these to do demolition, roofing, and fencing. I personally had hoped to wear these whilst clipping stabby shrubbery or for raking Fall leaves, but there's no way I can hold and manipulate tools in these. Mainly, I can stand there and clap my hands together imitating a seal but that's pretty much it.

I bought these for myself when the price dropped. I'm a fan of Jessica Seinfeld's books because even as an adult, I need incentive to eat more vegetables. Jessica's recipes have been a big help to me (although I modify them to my low-sugar, low-fat, mostly vegetarian diet). My efforts at pureeing veggies have been mixed and moreover I'm working in a small space, which makes the process a bit of a pain. I am delighted with the carrot flavor and have been eating it straight out of the pouch. It's that good. Sure, I understand fiber is being lost as is the benefit to teeth (a soft diet isn't great for dental health), BUT the carrots I've been buying in grocery stores for years - with one huge exception, Premier brand, when I can find it - taste terrible! I buy them with good intentions, even organic ones, and they languish in the refrigerator. If they tasted good, I'd be eating them. These pureed carrots taste delicious and they will NOT be languishing![P.S. The product is not organic but they don't use GMO seed, both of which I found on the veggieblendins website.]

I actually picked a few of these up for free when someone discarded them several years ago. They've been great in terms of their overall usefulness and the sturdiness of the plastic. I find lots of uses for them; they're the sort of product for which possibilities keep appearing. They seem like they'll last indefinitely. However, several of the lids have become detached from the boxes. They're still usable that way but I disliked the separated lids and recycled them. I use the lid-less boxes for open storage inside cabinets.

These are just as good as the ones I find in my local grocery store or dollar store. I use them exclusively for weeding and I go through a lot. Picked these up because they were priced very low, at under a buck a pair. I would not personally pay more than a buck- for this or any similar glove - because of their short lifespan, which I expected. One oddity is that while I'm used to my weeding gloves soon tearing at the ends of the fingers, these also get odd tears on the *sides* of the fingers here and there. If the price was the same, i.e., cheap, I'd buy them again.

The winter of 2013/14 was particularly long and cold. It seemed to go on and on. I tried to look forward to Spring thoughts and began looking at flower seeds in January. That's when I found this amazing deal: 34 cents TOTAL to receive these flower seeds from China. Wow! No matter how things turned out, how could I miss? I will tell you how. I germinated them indoors at the appropriate time to get a head start (as slugs, etc., tend to eat seedlings  of mine started outside). When all was said and done, only ONE vine survived. I watered it and kept an eye on it for months. Vines, leaves and no flowers resulted. Finally, on Aug 20, I was rewarded for my patience. With a lousy flower that looks NOTHING like the product photo. The flower is flat and one-dimensional, as opposed to the thick, multi-petaled bloom in the photo. (I have submitted "image feedback" to Amazon but, from prior experience, that may or may not result in any change.) My seller was Smile Seed in China. Had this vine appeared on its own, it would have been a happy surprise. But, lordy, all this build-up - remember, my story dates back 8 months - to find I got some plain ol' vine, is quite a bust.

I have been very pleased with the ice mat but so far have used it exclusively as an ice pack for muscle aches and injuries. It's the perfect size and because it bends once it's out of the freezer, it conforms to whatever shape needed. I don't think it's really accomplishing anything medicinally, but it feels fabulous.
