I had been wanting a back up battery for my iphone and jumped at the chance to review this power bank in return for a fair and unbiased review.  It is small and compact and I was thrilled at first.  Then I realized that I couldn't use it with my iphone 5 unless I purchased an adapter.  Haven't done that yet.  One more step that I wasn't planning on doing.  I wish that had been made clear when the offer was made.The price seems OK and the item is certainly compact.  Will update when I buy the connector.

My grandson is into trucks, construction vehicles, loaders and of course FIRETRUCKS!  So his mom purchased these darling boots as part of his rainy day outfit, but he also loves to dress up in them (Halloween is a definite possibility).  She got them a little bigger than his shoe size and right now he is wearing them with heavier socks.  He is absolutely darling in this whole get up and along with his Fire Megaphone, he'll be in seventh heaven fighting fires (or trying to get to them).

When a grandson is an aspiring Firefighter he has to have all of the right equipment and this Fire Megaphone is an absolute necessity.  I had received this megaphone free in return for a fair review  but hadn't had a chance to give it to our grandson, but saw that he now has the official boots and jacket so of course he had to have the megaphone. What a hoot!It is actually well made and very easy to use - just plunk in 4 AA batteries and we're off to fight fires, hopefully in the back yard.  You can talk into the megaphone and it also has a siren.  There is a volume control, thank goodness.  A fold down handle and a shoulder strap.Recommend for lots of fun!

Love this Cinnamon.  It smells wonderful and tastes even better.  I used to buy Penzey's Vietnamese Cinnamon (which wasn't cheap) and started using this Kirkland brand in everything I bake and my family can't tell the difference.  I introduced our grand kids to Cinnamon Sugar on Toast fingers this summer and they thought that was great.*** Toast fingers is simply cutting the toast into five long pieces after you have toasted, buttered and sugared the bread.Seems like a lot of cinnamon, but I take it back home at the end of the summer and use it up during holiday baking so I can start a new jar in January.

Just started using these tongs and absolutely love them.  The pull out/push in pin is so much better than the sliding metal rectangle on my other tongs that hold the tongs together in my utensil drawer.  I use them to serve vegetables, steaks and hamburgers, hot baked potatoes - anything that is too hot to handle with must my bare hands.  I haven't had any trouble with them slipping or sliding while delivering food to plates.In addition to th round pin that keeps the tongs open or closed I really like the red silicone covering on the ends of the tongs.  I am able to find them so quickly in my drawer. Seems like a small thing, but when I am in a hurry the red catches my eye.I received these tongs free in return for a review and can easily recommend them.

This is an excellent product for making your own cards whether you are using a printer (with your computer), stamping designs with ink, or embossing.  I have been using this 80# Cougar brand for years and can recommend it.  When you fold the 80# cardstock you will need to use a hard slick surface (bone stick for example) to crease the fold so it has a professional look.  I also buy the Cougar envelopes that matches the white color perfectly.

I have 8 of these salt and pepper sets and put one set at each place setting when we are having a nice dinner.  They are small and unobtrusive on the dinner table.  Because they are porcelain they go nicely with casual dishes and still look good with my porcelain dinnerware.  The plastic caps in the bottom aren't difficult to take out as I remove the salt and pepper at the end of summer when we close up the cottage.  They always seem to "finish off" my table.Easy to wipe off.  Highly recommend.

Great dish - we use it every time we have guests over for drinks, appetizers or a full dinner.  It is attractive, easy to pick up the olives from and cleans quickly.  Using this olive tray makes for a lovely presentation.  We have had our tray for almost 10 years and it looks as good as new.

I have three implants that require attention after every meal.  Something is always caught under the corner of one implant and wedges against the post.  My dentist says he can't do anything about it - just the way the post went into the jaw.  I have to keep this area very clean because food packs in there quickly.  I purchased two types of interdental brushes.  One is a tapered type (like a Christmas tree) and the Gun Proxabrush is straight up and down (not tapered).  The tapered type works best for me.  I need the smaller point to start into the area and then can work the brush back and forth.  This straight up and down brush sometimes hurt my gum when I was beginning to clean an area.  These brushes are OK and have a cap on them them which is great for carrying in your purse - but I still prefer the tapered Dentek style.FYI - "Moderate" refers to the size of the brush.

These DenTek brush cleaners really do a great job.  I have used a much simpler form of these interdental cleaners, but this particular product has made some significant improvements:1. The brush is slightly tapered.  If you have food that is wedged in between teeth or under a dental implant (next to the post) it is helpful to be able to insert the tapered end of the brush and then gently go back and forth to get the food particles. out.2.  The handle has a flexible grip which makes it easier to get the the molars.3.  Each  brush has its own plastic cap.  This is ideal when I want to carry some in my purse.  I can use it unobtrusively after a lunch and pop it back in my purse.I have three implants and have to clean between my teeth after every meal so I am recommending these without hesitation.

I remember when our oldest daughter read this book for her Sociology class in college.  She was blown away by some comparisons that she realized with people she knew and what the author was writing about in this book.  She was so impressed that I think it is safe to say it changed her basic handling of money for her future and re-emphasized her values.I recently read the book myself and appreciate what the author is presenting.  This is an older book (by present day publishing standards) but many of the ideas are still applicable today.Recommend for young adults.
Easy to purchase! and something that new young parents can easily use.

This book was recommended to me by a friend that reads a LOT!.  She loved it and I suggested it for our summer book club.  What a Hoot!  I had no idea about the plot or storyline because I hadn't read any reviews.  The beginning was a little slow to me because I wasn't into someone with as many scheduling hangups as Don Tillman, but then it took off and I could hardly put it down.If we're honest, everyone has a family with flaws of some type or proportion, and this story had its portion of those, but written with honesty and understanding.  It's interesting that this was first written as a play and then became a novel and written very quickly.Hats off to the author and we'll be looking for more.

This is another excellent Rothschild product. This company has been winning awards at the Gourmet Foods Show for years.  Our family picked raspberries at the original farm in Urbana,Ohio farm - so there really was a Rothschild farm.  I use this product to make a red raspberry dressing (along with their red raspberry vinegar) that is fabulous and the recipe originally came from the farm.  It's also great spread on sandwiches.

I have used Melatonin for over ten years.  I found out about it in a discussion with a friend who was going to Australia and she had done a lot of research on the internet.  I started at 3 mg and gradually increased my dosage to 10mg. and was feeling a little flaky, so I decreased my mg. over a long period of time back to 3 mg.  I have found that I just don't need more than that amount/strength for a good night's sleep.  As we age it seems we need help and some sleep aids, I just don't want to become dependent on anything more heavy duty than this product/strength.  I have never had any kind of a "hangover" or other morning effects with the 3mg. variety.My husband and I recently discussed sleep habits with two stewardesses who were flying internationally on a regular basis.  They both swore by Melatonin and said that almost all of their friends in the business did the same thing.

I have been using this Kirkland Aller-tec (10mg.) for over 5 years and take one every night.  Between sinus, Spring and Fall allergies I need help.  I always have an extra bottle on hand.  Wonderful that we can get this through Amazon.

Planning for the use of a 33 oz. jar is key for the two of us before we open it - Not a Problem with these artichoke hearts!  I chopped some of the hearts, mixed them with either sour cream/mayo combo or cream cheese and used as an appetizer this summer.  Tasty and light - porch perfect!  Then I found a recipe for coating chicken breasts and sprinkling with Parmesan Cheese before baking - wonderful.Highly recommend - and finished the jar in no time.

I loved this quote book and will use it for the inside of my hand made cards and at social meetings.  It is not only a collection of wonderful and timeless quotes, but each quote has a paragraph about the writer.  I was fascinated learning new facets about famous people."I always wondered why somebody didn't do something about that, then I realized I am somebody" - Lily Tomlin"You can't change the music of your soul" - Katherine Hepburn"There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind" - C.S.Lewis"We have not journeyed all this way across the centuries, across the oceans, across the mountains, across the prairies, because we are made of sugar Candy" - Winston ChurchillHighly Recommend!

We serve this a lot in the summertime here in Michigan.  Smoked fish of all varieties are available and I mix this jar with 4 oz. of cream cheese for a wonderful spread and dip.  It is great on toast triangles or crackers with a piece of smoked fish on top.  Add some fresh parsley for a bit of green and your guests will inhale the appetizers.My husband likes to use it as a spread on a sandwich.  He likes the zing straight from the jar.

This is a lot of Olive Muffalata (24oz.) for two people.  So once we open a jar we find all the recipes we can to use up the jar.  After opening, it is advisable to cover the relish with oil before refrigerating it.  The good news is it is wonderful mixed with cream cheese for a dip or to put on crispy bread for an appetizer.  It is also great on Chicken or Fish, in Pasta, Pizza, or Sandwiches.  It is a very strong olive taste so I prefer it mixed with something (Sour cream or cream cheese).  My husband likes it straight out of the jar.  It's tasty and different!

I'm a die-hard Coben fan.  I think his law enforcement characters have heart and sensitivity as well as being good at their jobs.  His plots are usually somewhat plausible and different from book to book.  While the plot in "Stay Close" wasn't as plausible as I think it could have/should have been, it was fun to listen to.This audio book was an abridged version and while I don't usually like those, I did appreciate the condensed almost 6 hour version while doing housework.  Probably not his best, but still enjoyable and one that I would recommend.

Great device!  I just finished a 3 hour conference call and was able to hear so much better than using regular earphones.  Wow, this device is remarkable.  Easy to set up and directions were good (although the printing was super small).  Really liked the "Over the ear Piece" - that made all the difference.  I've tried a number of other ear phones and haven't been able to keep them in my ears, but this set-up is easy and comfortable.  It left my hands free to make notes and I wasn't fumbling around with ear plugs or a speaker phone.* Sent to me free for an honest review.  Highly recommend.

Interesting premise for a novel about a small town that isn't what it appears to be on the surface.  I came away from the book with the feeling that Rowling does better with knowing the younger set than the adults.  Probably why her Potter novels are such a hit.Recommend if you want to see the "other" side of Rowling (not the Harry Potter Side).  I have to respect her for writing under her own name and for a different type of reader.  She doesn't have to write financially, so it's interesting that she still wants to create.  The story line is somewhat depressing and there are a large number of characters who have a variety of relationships with everyone else.  All of the details/relationships are neatly tied up at the end with some ending in death - not an uplifting conclusion to a novel.

Great book for a beginning reader.  I read this book with my almost 7 year old grand daughter.  She would read one page and I would read another.  Alternating the pages like this makes reading fun rather than a chore.Two plus comments:  the illustrations are wonderful with a lot of items that we can look for and find (looking at the "trash" in the park").  Then when they learn how to make the wand work (with love and a rhyme) its great to look for items in the actual construction.  The second plus that I really like about the book is the idea that we can create our own words such as Greeneriffic and Emeraldalicious.  There is a lot of creativity in this darling book and it is all very appealing to a 7 year old girlie girl.

"When you look this good, who cares if you're plastic!"  BarbieI love this book.  My grand daughter brought this book home from the library and I enjoyed it as much as she did.  It has an excellent introduction about an observant mother who noticed her daughter playing with paper dolls that were dressed up like adults and that got her to thinking about the creation of a plastic doll that would wear high heels, had breasts and legs that went into infinity.  The mother was Ruth Handler, one of the founders of the fledgling toy and novelty company, Mattel.  Handler had an uphill battle to bring Barbie into fruition, but she persevered and the rest is history.The photographs are fantastic and the quotes are even better.  Coco Chanel, Andy Warhol, Marilyn Monroe, Diane Von Furstenberg have some classics and even some by Barbie herself.  Of course Ken is included as an "Accessory".  This book is a hoot.  I'm 75 and I still have the Barbie dolls that belonged to my four daughters.  Great coffee table book!

I purchased a large amount of this exact plate for a ladies luncheon recently.  They weren't cheap and they really looked good in the packaging.  I also purchased the 7.5" plates that matched this 9" size for some dessert.  The larger dinner plates had some lettuce and chicken salad on one side and a pecan roll on the other.  Quite a few had already cracked from the center out ( about 25%) and other cracked when they were served.  Granted the chicken salad was heavier on one side of the plate, but it wasn't a large serving and I thought the plate it would hold up better.  I do a number of large affairs over the summer and will have to try a different brand.

I recently used a large amount of this size of the Designerware plastic plate for a ladies luncheon.  We served cookies and a lightweight bowl of sherbet on the same plate.  They were packaged 18 to a plastic pkg. and we opened about 5 packages and had 4 cracked plates.  They seem to crack from the center out.  They are very nice plates and make a pleasant presentation, just be aware there might be some loss so if you purchase these I would order extra.

Fantastic brush for wet and/or newly washed hair.  My grand daughters are combing their own hair with ease - these brushes are wonderful.  When I think of what I went through as a mom with my own daughters' hair, Whew! what a difference. Highly recommend!

This hairspray is fantastic.  I have fine hair and spend summers on a lake with a lot of humidity.  I also drive a convertible.  My hair doesn't move or sag after using this spray.  It is sometimes difficult to find because we are not in a large city, so I purchase 2-3 cans at a time when I am back in civilization.  It's worth it!Highly recommend!

After listening to an abridged audio version of another Harlan Coben book, I thought this audio book was a little wordy.  The plot and story line was good with some twists and turns along the way and the ending had a surprising twist all its own and part of the plot wasn't fully resolved for the reader/listener.  Not as thrilling as some of Coben's writings and probably time for me to move on to another mystery writer.But, it was a great book to listen to during a sewing project so my mind could drift during some of the slower parts.

We recently used some of this Black Diamond Mesh with the same product but in gold.  The black and gold decor was stunning.  It is easy to cut and I sewed some of it by hand and even on the machine (the presser foot rides above the mesh and sews in between the studs).  This mesh in the various colors adds just the right amount of "punch" to tabletops, around candles etc.  Fun to work with and execute creative ideas.

I always enjoy listening to Harlan Coben's books and "Six Years" didn't disappoint. The only exception to my usual listening routine was that this was an Abridged version and it didn't bother me.  I usually don't listen to abridged versions because they can jump around a lot and you can't figure out how someone got to C or D when they were last at A.The plot twisted and turned and the ending really surprised me.  It's a good book for housework and driving - recommend.

This is the first book I have read by Lucinda Riley.  I was assuming it would be a typical Chick Lit, but it was a lot more than that.  The story spins out of the complications of having to deal with present day estate taxes in England and the historical challenges of the far flung English empire.  I enjoyed the book, but at times the story line was convoluted and implausible, BUT that it all made for a great summer (beach) read.  I will certainly read another of Riley's novels, in between my other books.Recommend.

Gentle Digest is the only probiotic I have found that works for my senior dog.  She loves the taste as well.  I originally was giving her the capsules and saw these, so am trying them.  They work just as well and she loves the taste.  She thinks it is a treat.  I will continue buying these.  I can't find these in my local pet store, so finding them on Amazon.com, plus at a reasonable cost, is a win-win for all.  Highly recommend for those who have a dog with very loose stools.  They work quickly.  I use them as a daily maintenance to keep her "regular".

Stedman's books are the best out there.  I use this book occasionally but am glad to have it on my shelves.  Being a medical transcriptionist, I use these books faithfully along with the internet.  Highly recommend.

I will ONLY buy Stedman's books as they are very user-friendly and affordable.  I use this book constantly, alongside using the internet for assistance.  I am a medical transcriptionist and these books are a must in your library.

Have noticed a drastic difference in my senior dogs.  Their stiffness has definitely minimized.  Out of ALL of the Cosequin/Nutramax I have tried, this strength is the only one that has worked and my dogs love them!  They think they are getting snacks.  Highly recommend.  Can't find in my local pet store, so had to order online, and price was very reasonable.ADDENDUM: Upon trying to reorder more of these, I noticed on the packages I received, they are "...Plus MSM & BOSWELLIA". I notice the package pictured does not list the Boswellia (Boswellia Serrata Extract, 30 mg), so am wondering if the new packages without are deemed better. I read allergic side-effects of the Boswellia could be chest pain, breathing problems, hives/swelling, and/or dermatitis. Although my dogs have not been scratching, one of them had previously had skin issues due to another health issue, but I notice the dryness and bumps are back. I am not listing this as to be alarmed, but just wanted you to be aware of some additives. I will again order these and since the Boswellia is NOT listed or shown on the package, I will be just as pleased to get the package without it. I know the MSM works wonders. I had shown this brand to my vet and she stated it is a highly recommended OTC brand for dogs.
Ample sized for average size men's shoes.  Nice quality.  Am pleased.

I bought these to take the place of the tongs that came with my fireplace set.  Unlike the original set, these are easy to maneuver and are lightweight.  I hang them on my fireplace tool stand fully extended and they are the same length as the stock tools.  They do fold up, however, if you are limited for space.  For the price, I figured it was worth trying them out.  Living in Florida, our "cold snap" is now gone so haven't been able to use them more than once.  Hoping they last.

My husband approves which says a lot about clothing items...he is somewhat picky.  The quality is nicely made and the green is a nice shade.  He wears these usually for office casual as it can be dressed up or down.  Overall am pleased.

Wanted to get this due to the positive reviews of other customers.  It appears to be well made.  The big selling point for me was the straps completely wrapped around the tote so it can handle the weight of the wood.  Very generously sized and can easily carry at least 6 pieces of firewood...any more than that would make it too heavy to carry, but I bet it could handle it!  I got tired of getting splinters on my hands/arms and only being able to carry 2 to 3 pieces of wood to my indoor storage bin beside the fireplace.  This tote has cut my work down by at least half.  I love it!

This is for my husband.  He likes the nice quality of the fabric.  The color is a nice Navy and the minimal white trim doesn't distract from the looks of the windbreaker.  It fits true to size and would look presentable for office casual as well.  Overall, my husband is pleased.

Great quality flag pole.  Other poles I have had in the past have either rusted out or didn't have the spinning mechanism ball bearings, thus my flag would wrap itself around the pole.  All of the other poles I have had were only 5 feet long where the full-sized flags would be close to the ground.  This pole offers an extra foot so the flag not only clears the house better but also doesn't get caught in the gutters, lying on the roof, etc.  It seems to be well made and being non-painted aluminum, it won't rust and I don't have to worry about any paint flaking off.  If you use grommet flags, it comes with plastic rings for holding the flag.  However, since my flags are sleeved and I use the swivel hook at the tip, I can't comment on how well the grommet rings hold.  Overall, I am quite pleased with the flag pole.  Delivery was prompt and packaging was secure.  A buyer cannot go wrong with Amazon.com, and being a "Prime" member, I received my order within a few days, despite the bad weather affecting shipment from the North.  Thanks Amazon!

This game is both challenging and different.  You look at a finished picture and have to arrange the cards in a certain order to result in the exact picture.  Be careful though, as there is only one order to place the cards.  I bought this so my mom could play something that would hopefully keep her mind "exercised".  There is only so much one can get out of playing electronic solitaire before boredom sets in.  My daughter tried the game and was doing quite well.  Adding a timer could be even more challenging.

Looks to be somewhat flimsy but appears to be really made well.  The base is all one piece and the top slips over the rounded lipped area on the base which make a pretty nice seal when not in use.  I found this at my local Toys R Us store and was able to save $20, plus the store sells "safe" play sand in 50# bags, so I was able to get everything in one purchase (recommended 200# for this sand box).  The interior play area of the sand box is really much larger than most other sand boxes on the market.  This was bought for my 2 grandsons and there is plenty of room for some of their friends to play in as well.  According to some of the other reviews, this sand box should provide years of fun.  I am not sure about an adult sitting on the side seats, but for kids, it's perfect.

I just finished reading this ebook and was finding it difficult to put the book down.  The story contained humor as well as a great storyline.  It was a very thought-provoking story.  I loved how this writer portrayed Jesus both with wit and humor.  I highly recommend this book.  Yes, the title is a dead giveaway that it has a religious background, but it really is about society and one family, and all of the people one person can touch through their Faith (or lack of).  Highly recommend for everyone.

This is great because you have the option of both battery and electric.  Also, you can use either the preprogrammed self-tiimer or have it play continuously until you physically turn it off.  You also have several different sounds and a volume knob.  Light and small enough to tote with you in the diaper bag should you travel away from home.  Great for overnight stays away from home.  It also has white noise so it isn't just for the little ones.  Highly recommend.

The fingerprint coding is great.  I would NOT have bought this had it not had another means to open in the event the batteries were dead (there is a key to override).  The safe is very well made and heavy.  Has means for mounting and has enough space to hold at least 2 semi-automatic guns plus extra ammo and/or magazines.  We have a Glock 19 and a Beretta Nano that fits nicely, both semi-automatic 9MM guns.  The BARSKA brand safe was highly recommended by LEOs and the price through Amazon.com just couldn't be beat.  Highly recommend.  Would make a great gift for the LEO in your family to safeguard their work equipment.  Especially if there are little ones living in the house as well.  You can NEVER be too safe around handguns.

My grandson absolutely loves this train set and was so excited to have more track to set up in his home.  The figure eight is different since it has the "cross-track" to add to the usual oval.  The quality/price for these tracks can't be beat.  Since Power City Trains don't have generic tracks available, these are very reasonably priced so I was able to get a couple of sets to expand the track layout even more.  Very pleased, both myself and my grandson.  Thanks for making his Christmas a special one.

I love the double sided flags.  It seems to be top quality and I know I will get much wear out of it.  I like flags that are neutral and have the option of leaving our year-round, and this one fits the bill.  Plus, as it begins to fade, as I know it will (living in Florida) and since I leave it out year-round, I can flip it around and display the other side for more use.  Good deal!

This is awesome.  There is no need to worry about losing any daubers, markers, disks, or any other small pieces.  This game pack has everything set to a minimum. You only have cards to deal with, and it comes in a sturdy box that is easily used for storage.  Although I am from "old school" and am used to playing Bingo the old fashioned way, I am looking forward to being able to include our younger family members to play as well without the worry or concern of losing small pieces.  This is also great for taking along to parties as it is easily convertible to tote around.  The price was right as other packages I found were immensely expensive, especially for a game you may only play a couple times a year.

I am very pleased with this "white noise" sound machine.  I usually like having a small fan at my bedside but for those cooler Winter nights, this fits the bill.  I love the option of being able to lower the volume several different ways.  It is not a big bulky item so can fit in many places in a room and also being discreet.  The seller was great as well.  I would definitely deal with them again and also highly recommend this machine to those who find the need of having some sound at night to get a decent sleep.

I have never been disappointed with any Ravensburger "Large Format" puzzles.  The quality is wonderful, the pieces are very easy to handle, the colors are vivid, and the overall puzzle is fun to put together.  I try to stick to 300 to 500 piece puzzles as they fit perfectly on any table.  Great therapy for Seniors, and our family enjoys leaving the puzzle out and just adding a piece now and then when the time allows.  Highly recommend.  You won't be disappointed.

This tent was perfect for our first camping experience - my husband and I camped plenty as kids but this was the first time taking our 7 year old.  The tent was cozy and perfect for the 3 of us, I think it would be very cramped and crowded trying to fit 3 adults in the tent.  The tent is light-weight and packs small, it doesn't take up much space at all.  It was very easy to assemble and we had it up in almost no time. Using all of the pegs and ropes included it seemed very sturdy and we had no issues at all with a light rain one of the days we were out, I'm not sure how well it would hold up with heavy wind and rain though. Our favorite feature was the stargazing fly - it made our first family camping experience lots of fun.  Overall we're very happy with the tent although I think as our daughter gets older we'll likely want to upgrade to a larger one.

This Seagate Cloud storage device gets the job done (technically), but is incredibly slow and doesn't seem to work remotely from any of our devices (tablets or phones).  Setup/installation were pretty straight-forward and easy, and it does store plenty of data but it took forevverrrr to move a bunch of pictures and videos to it.  We've tried to access from two android tablets and an iphone 5 with no success which is pretty disappointing considering that is half the appeal of the 'cloud storage.'We have other Seagate products that for the most part have worked well and had few issues, but this one is rather disappointing and needs some major improvements.

This essential oil diffuser is perfect for use in any room in your home, and small and light enough to travel easily. Easy to follow directions indicate how to use the diffuser -plug the cord into the bottom of the unit then using the pre-measured small cup you add water to the center of the diffuser to the 'MAX' line that is marked in bold black print so it's easy to see.  You add 3-5 drops of your favorite essential oil, place the spout on top, and then the green plastic cover on top of that.  A simple push of the button gives you a soft, gentle and quiet mist. A second push of the button gives you a color-changing night light that goes while the diffuser is misting.  A final third push of the button turns everything off.The diffuser cleans easily, and holds enough water to last at least 10 hours. I was pleasantly surprised that a small bottle of lavender essential oil was included in the box with the diffuser, that was a nice little bonus. I really like the looks of it - it has an elegant yet fun design. The bottom is sturdy and wide and does not tip easily which has been a problem with my other diffuser.
These fit perfect and were true to size, almost no shrinkage after being washed and dried a few times - super comfortable.

If you're looking for convenience when it comes to using mayonnaise you can't do better than this new squeeze bottle from Hellmann's. The container is easy to manipulate for either a lot or a little mayo, whatever your preference is, and the tip where it comes out remains nice and clean and doesn't leave a big glob of mayo around the lid like you can get with some squeeze bottles.  The wide base on the bottom is nice because it doesn't easily tip over.While the convenience is nice and what my husband prefers, I'm a penny-pincher and this is not the cheapest or most efficient way to enjoy Hellman's.  I prefer to use a knife and an old-fashioned jar so I can scrape out every last bit of mayo before recycling the container. The squeeze container isn't the cheapest option so isn't my first choice, but it still offers that fantastic great Hellman's taste in an easy, no-mess container.

The best part for us was assembling this mini crossbow together, the directions are fairly straight-forward and easy to follow, although some of the pictures can be a little hard to follow but it's easy enough to figure out.  I was a little disappointed that it only comes with 5 foam darts, but once we started using it I realized that it doesn't matter because the more you use it the more it falls apart.  Every time you use it another piece comes loose or falls off, so before you've even gotten to the 5th foam dart you have to stop and reassemble some of the pieces to the crossbow.It is compatible with other k-force mini building sets so if you (or your kids) have a good imagination you can combine sets and come up with something even more fun (and hopefully more sturdy). Or if you have other K'Nex pieces you could go crazy and build something totally new and fun. I think the manufacturer's recommended age range of 8-11 years old is pretty accurate.  My 7 year old was able to do some of it on her own, but I had to help with some of it too.  Overall it's a fun toy, but be prepared for some frustration when it falls apart after being used a few times.

This air conditioning unit works great for cooling smaller spaces, as far as a bare-bones cheaper air conditioner goes.  There are no fancy bells and whistles here but it gets the job done.  It's hefty for a small unit but was fairly easy to install in our kitchen window - a coordinated strong person could manage it on their own, but I opted to balance the air conditioner while hubby installed the screws.  Expandable side panels help cut down on air leaks but I strongly suggest supplementing around your window with foam panels and inserts as needed to help cut down on wasted energy/air loss.  This isn't the most quiet unit, but in the kitchen I don't mind it.  If you're installing it someplace where you want quiet then you might want to consider investing in a pricier model that will be quieter.  We did find that the more secure you install it, the quieter it is - my husband added some wood wedges at the top of the window to help secure and hold everything in place and the air conditioner was definitely quieter once it that was done, just that extra bit of stabilization made a big difference.The controls are manual and very simple - one dial is your on/off, and you can choose from fan hi/low or cooling hi/low.  I'm a little disappointed that there isn't a 'medium' setting, as there are times that hi seems a bit too cold, and low isn't cold enough.  The other dial is to adjust the thermostat.  The air vent at the top is adjustable for height and direction.Overall it's a good, sturdy unit and it works well for the area we have it in - even when I've been running the oven and dishwasher and warming the kitchen up, the air conditioner does a good job of keeping things very cool when I have it cranked up on high.

I was looking forward to trying many of the recipes in Laura Fuentes new book The Best Homemade Kids' Snacks on the Planet, since we've enjoyed trying many of the recipes from her other book The Best Homemade Kids' Lunches on the Planet. While other reviewers have commented about the fact that the book should not claim to have 'healthy' recipes as it does on the cover because many of the recipes call for things such as white sugar, and white flour - I think the emphasis is making your own home-made versions of things where you can, and choosing healthier options that way rather than opting for store-bought versions that are loaded with preservatives and far more sugar than what some of these recipes call for.  Of course moderation is the key with ANY snacks, for kids of all ages (and adults), and those recipes that call for sugar and flour simply need to be enjoyed less than some of the healthier options.I was a little disappointed that some of the recipes in the book (particularly in the fruit and veggies sections) seemed like no-brainer combinations to me, and aren't really even recipes at all.  An example would be 'Watermelon Pops.'  All it is, is a wedge of watermelon on a popsicle stick.  Does this really merit a spot in a cookbook, that people are paying for?  Hummus and veggies is another - again a common combination that many people already enjoy, don't see the need to include this as a recipe here.  There are a handful of these throughout the book that I was a little annoyed to see, but not enough for me to consider my money poorly spent on the book.Disappointment aside - there are some fun new combinations that I would not have thought of, and was eager to try with my 7 year old.  Some of the recipes we've enjoyed (so far) are the Oatmeal Raisin Cookie Dough Bites, the Oh-My-Goodness Party Mix, and Baked Zuchinni Bites.  There have been some that were hit and miss - some I liked and my daughter didn't, and vice versa.  Most of the recipes are incredibly simple and call for everyday common pantry and kitchen ingredients.  There were a few ingredients here and there such as coconut oil, coconut flour and chia seeds - some people might not normally buy these but they were items I already had.Overall we like the book and look forward to trying out one or two new recipes every week - right now we're focusing on frozen treats to keep cool.  If you're in a rut with finding snacks for your little ones I recommend the book - while there may be a few 'dud' recipes, there are a lot in the book and you're sure to find several to your liking, and almost every recipe can be tweaked a bit if it doesn't quite fit your food needs.

We had a similar scarf purchased last year from a different manufacturer, for my daughter to use after sporting events games to help her cool down after.  When I pulled it out to use this summer I realized that a small hole had developed in one of the seams and all of the little beads were spilling out, so I didn't hesitate to replace it.  For those of you not familiar with these types of products - the scarf is full of little tiny beads like water beads - when you soak them in water they absorb the water and expand greatly.  Over time the water in the beads evaporates and they shrink again, helping keep you cool as they do so.  Once the beads are wet it takes a long, LONG time for them to completely dry again but they will eventually completely dry and when you are done using it for the season you can put it in a bag and store it.  During the hot weather I keep my scarf wet in a ziplock baggy in the refrigerator (they say you should not put these in the freezer).  When it starts to get a little dry I simply soak it in a bowl of cold water for several minutes, then gently wring out the excess water and we're good to go.  After a few weeks, or if it looks or feels dirty or starts to smell I simply gently wash with some gentle hand or dish soap, and thoroughly rinse it under running water before using it again.For those who have had issues or find that it doesn't work well for them - make sure you soak the scarf in water for a long time, especially the first time.  It takes a long time for those beads to absorb all that water.  Also once it is thoroughly soaked pop it in the fridge for a while before you want to use it, so it's nice and cold.  I keep ours in a cooler with cold drinks and ice packs so my daughter can put it on after her soccer games - it's nice and cold and super refreshing and helps her cool down quickly.  Even when the scarf warms to room temperature the moisture that it leaves against your skin helps to cool you, even if it doesn't feel 'cold' against your skin.These scarfs work well for us - this particular brand is well made and pretty as well, it looks like a regular type of bandanna.

I have mixed feelings about this yoga towel set.  It does what it is supposed to do - absorb sweat and wetness with no excessive residual odors from the sweat, but there is room for some improvement.  First of all this does not feel like your typical microfiber sweat-absorbing towel - it does not HAVE the bumpy, looped fibers that you traditionally find in a microfiber product.  These towels are very smooth to the touch, yet they are still ultra-absorbant.  I know this is just in my head, but to me I don't feel like the small towel is wiping the sweat off of my face as well as a traditional towel, because it has that smoother texture, even though I know it is.  Just a little quirk of mine I guess.  The large towel has small non-skid dots all over the bottom of it so you can lay it on your yoga may and it won't slide - this feature works very well and my towel did not slide at all while I was using it.  The bonus of having this is not having to wipe your mat down after, which will help preserve the life of your mat and keep it cleaner longer.Other reviewers have commented that the seams on their towels were loose or sloppy or coming undone -the seams on both of my towels were precise and neat, there were no loose threads or signs of unraveling even after 2 rounds through the laundry.Another issue that many have commented on and may be the decision point for some considering purchasing this item - the main ingredient used in the Ultra Fresh (triclosan) that keeps your towels from smelling is known to be used as a pesticide. It works well when it comes to keeping your towels from getting smelly - I use them at least twice before washing them.  For some this may be a big sticking point, for me it is not considering I normally use the towels only twice a week, and I'm not using them to thoroughly dry down my entire body like I would if I had just showered, but simply to absorb some excessive sweat and protect my mat.  Some people may not want any exposure to this product at all and that's understandable - I'm not thrilled with the fact that it contains triclosan, but I'm ok with the minimal exposure.Another thing to consider is that the triclosan that is in the towels will wash out over time.Overall - they work well and I will use them until they fall apart, but they could be better if they could find something other than triclosan to help maintain freshness and reduce smells.

This outfit is adorable and fits the American Girl brand dolls perfectly.  It's a 3-piece set with an elastic-waist skirt, a velcro-backed top and a cape that snaps onto the back of the shirt.  Overall the outfit seems really well made with the exception of the snaps that attach the cape to the back of the top- they are plastic snaps which are very sturdy however the thread holding the snaps onto the outfit is not and the snaps pulled off of the outfit easily after the 4th time of pulling them apart.  I was able to easily sew the snap pieces back on but was disappointed that these pieces weren't attached more securely.

I have no issues with the packaging - there are 2 small portions packaged together that you can 'snap' in half to serve only one portion at a time which I actually like since I sometimes give my cat a bit of wet food in the middle of the day to tide her over until dinner time.  Each portion has a small foil cover that you pull back, and if you hold the container upside down over a plate or dish the food slides out fairly easily.  There is a small bit of gravy in the container as well so be careful, it can be a little drippy.  The food isn't overly smelly like some fish-based wet cat foods can be.  Unfortunately my cat does not care for this at all - she is getting more finicky in her old age and tends to turn her nose up at pates lately.  She did eat a little of it the first few times I put it down, but you could tell she was doing it grudgingly and only because she was really hungry, not because she really liked the food.  If it's a food she likes she scarfs it down and she didn't even finish this stuff.

I've been trying for quite some time to find a natural deodorant that isn't loaded with chemicals or minerals, but also helps protect from sweat and odor.  Others I have tried did not cover body odor well enough, or caused my skin to break out.  The first time I tried this I really put it to the test - I went to the gym that day and really worked up a sweat.  I was impressed how well this worked - all during my class I could smell (faintly) the scent of the deodorant which was a nice smell, but it wasn't strong or over-powering.  I was more impressed that I didn't smell any body odor.  Even by the end of the day I can still get a faint scent from under my arm, which tells me the deodorant is still working.  It doesn't block sweat entirely (which is ok, your body is supposed to sweat, that's how you get rid of toxins), but I also don't sweat a crazy amount either - it is tolerable.Application of this deodorant is a little bit different from your traditional antiperspirants and deodorants.  This stick tends to be very solid and firm and you need to soften it a little bit by holding it against your under-arm so your body heat will soften it up a bit, then you can easily glide it across your skin to apply it.  I find that my skin is a little sensitive to it if I have just shaved under my arms, so I try to work it so that I shave on a day when I know I can stay at home and skip deodorant that day.  Other than that I have had no problem with my skin reacting or breaking out from this.Overall I really like it- it's a well made product that works for me, I definitely plan on buying more when this has run out.

We have the Knot Genie hairbrush for my daughter's hair which is very fine and thin and tangles very easily.  The brush works good but can be a pain to hold onto after you've been holding it for a while.  I was interested in this brush because it looks like the same kind of brush but with a handle on it.  It is the same style of brush as the Knot Genie, but the bristles are much stiffer than the ones on the Knot Genie.  This one does get the hair free of knots faster, but it also pulls a bit more than the other brush.  I do prefer this one because of the handle - if you're the one doing the brushing it's nice to have something to wrap your fingers around and hold.

I purchased this little tote bag for to hold a birthday gift for my husband - I thought he might get a kick out of the Yoda bag and would be able to re-use it for other things.  It was perfectly sized (actually a bit bigger than needed) for the video game we got him, and I'm sure it will get used many times for quite a while.

I thought this was a bit over-priced for a handful of tiny Lego pieces, but seeing my 6-year old enjoy opening the little window every morning and spend time playing with the Legos is worth it.  The first few days were a little boring because she didn't have that many pieces to play with, but after a few days it got to be more fun having one of the people and some fun little accessories such as furniture and food.  It's a nice change from the candy-filled advent calendars, and I know she'll enjoy playing with the Lego pieces long after Christmas is gone.  I think we'll be doing another one of these for next year too.

We have some likes and dislikes about this particular brand/style of food.  I think my cat likes the flavor ok, but she doesn't like pate foods - she prefers chunky wet food.  She ate a little of this when I first put it down but then didn't go back to it for a long time when she realized I wasn't going to give her anything else - in the end she did finish it but I could tell it wasn't her favorite because she didn't gobble it down like she usually does with wet food.I really like the ingredient listing - all of their products are grain free with no corn, wheat or soy, and no added poultry by-products, no artificial colors, flavors or preservatives.  It's a really great ingredient listing compared to many you find out there these days, but you also pay a higher price for that great ingredient listing.  Price-wise these isn't the cheapest out there but if you're looking for quality then you might want to give these a try.

My almost 7-year old first grader who is an excellent independent reader was very excited to get this book, it looked like something that would be right up her alley.  I was a little surprised (but not very) when she finished the book in one day - she didn't read it non-stop but she did pick it up several times during the day and by bedtime had finished it.  The book is divided into easy, short chapters for beginning readers.  Cute and colorful pictures are on every page to help describe the actions in the story.  I thought the story was cute - about a young owl named Eva who tries to take on a bit more than she can handle in planning the spring festival, and she learns that it's ok to ask for help and also that you can't judge a book (or in this case other owls) by their covers.  It was a simple yet effective lesson that I think is applicable and important for young kids to learn, but the story made it seem interesting and cute.  I think the book will definitely appeal more to girls than boys (the main character is a girl, and the colors/pictures lean more towards things that girls favor), but that doesn't mean boys won't enjoy the story too.This was a hit with my daughter, and she wants me to get the next book in the series as soon as it's available. I think the publisher's recommended age of 5-7 is spot-on, any younger might have trouble with it, and an older reader might find the book a bit short and slow for them.

The box that the stroller comes in wasn't very well made - it was starting to come apart at the seams but thankfully that didn't affect what was inside at all.  The other issue I have with the box is that it shows all of the colors that the strollers come in, which can be misleading to a child who is looking at the box and doesn't understand that the color of the stroller coming out of the box isn't necessarily the same as the color of the stroller pictures on the box.Those things aside, this is an awesome little doll stroller - built to look and operate like a real baby stroller.  While detailed assembly instructions are included they weren't really needed. It took just a few minutes to pop the wheels into place and snap the bassinet/seat onto the frame.  Two small buttons located on the inside of the frame allow you to move the handle from one side to the other, and the bassinet part easily (but not TOO easily) tips forwards or backwards so you can have the doll laying down or sitting up.  It also folds fairly easily and compactly for storage which was nice since my daughter insisted on taking it to the store for shopping. My 6 year old needs a little help if she wants to move the handle from one side to the other, she's not quite coordinated enough to do it on her own yet. Overall it's really cute, seems to be very well built and my daughter loves it.  The color of the one we got is the black and teal and is very true to the color pictured here - it's a nice change from all of the pink doll items out there. Overall it's a fantastic doll stroller for the price, definitely recommend it.

I've been on the hunt for a while to find a pencil sharpener that my almost 7-year old can use.  We have several of the old fashioned little plastic ones that you have to insert and turn the pencil, and a nice electric one but she has a hard time with both of these with finding the right amount of pressure to get the pencil sharp but not so sharp that the tip easily breaks.  This pencil sharpener from Bostitch is different because you don't need pressure to sharpen the pencil - it uses a ratcheting mechanism to sharpen the pencil as you twist the pencil/sharpener back and forth.  There is also a little button you can turn on the sharpener that allows you to adjust how sharp you make the pencil, so you can avoid getting a very pointy tip that will easily break.  After a few tries my daughter was able to use this easily by herself so we're both quite happy with it.  It's a great price, comes in multiple fun bright colors, and is small and portable and will fit easily in any kid's backpack.

These work very well as far as sanitizing - I keep a container in multiple rooms of the house and in the car.  They are easy to pull from the container and have almost no smell at all which is nice as some sanitizing wipes I've noticed can have a very strong chemical smell.  I've used them on everything from hands to door-knobs, cleaning around the toilet, counter-tops, on the kitchen floor, cleaning the stove-top, there really isn't much you can't use these on.  While the wipes are very sturdy and strong I find them at the same time a bit abrasive, which is nice if you're scrubbing or cleaning something that needs a little bit of elbow grease.  I find however that when it comes to cleaning and in the process of cleaning also needing to wipe something (say specks of dirt or food or what-not) off of a surface, it's hard to wipe anything substantial up with these.  I have to keep wiping a few times to pick up anything like crumbs or cat little from the surface I'm cleaning, where as when using the Chlorox-brand wipes I normally use that have a softer surface I don't seem to have as hard of a time.Overall for cleaning purposes I prefer the Chlorox brand wipes, but as far as just sanitizing surfaces these work just fine.

While these headphones from Turtle Beach are 'branded' as Call of Duty, they can be used with any game played on the Xbox One console.  The Call of Duty plates can even be removed or swapped for other plates if you want to shell out more money for different plates.  The sound quality is excellent - other players sound like they are in the room with me when I'm playing and they say they can hear me really well on their side.  I really liked that the volume level changes - as you increase the volume of voice chat the game volume decreases so you're not competing to hear one over the other. The microphone is removable and while the headphones are wireless as far as connection to the Xbox, there is a wire attached for connection to other devices (ipad and such).  It would have been nice if this wire was removable, because if it becomes damaged you can't replace just the damaged wire.Overall great sound, they are comfortable although the cups cover the ears so well there was a bit of heat build-up after extended use but they were still very comfortable.  A bit on the pricey side but I think worth it if you are a regular/daily game player.

A beautiful antique-looking metal frame with glass, it goes nicely with many types of decor.  There are fixtures on the back to either stand the frame on a shelf or table, or to hang it on the wall if you prefer.  It is very solid and heavy, very well made and I think worth the price. I found the color to be a bit darker than what is pictures here, but still very nice.

I ordered this as a Christmas present for my Frozen-obsessed 6 year old, only because I got a really good price on it through Amazon.  If not for the really good price, I would say I think this is very over-priced given how small it is, and how flimsy the chain is, and it's not something I would really recommend for a young child. A child aged 10 or older I'm sure would be much more appreciative of the value and delicacy of the necklace, and be more careful with it. The chain is very thin and will easily break, it's not for little kids fingers.  The snowflake is very beautiful but very tiny - as the description states it's only 3/4 of an inch in diameter.The necklace came packaged in a pretty light blue box for gift giving, and while there is a foam square in the box that has slits to hold the chain in place my necklace was not pulled through the slits so it had tumbled around inside the box during shipping and was in a unruly tangle by the time I opened the box.  I had to spend a good 5 minutes with a pair of tweezers and a lot of patience trying to untangle it and was afraid I would end up breaking the thin chain.

Dreaming Spies brings Mary and Sherlock on a long cruise to Japan, during which they become involved in a mystery that immerses them in the world of ninjas and royal secrets, and loyalty amongst both family and friends.  Laurie King has done a fantastic job of presenting the Japanese culture as it would have been found in the 1920's both on and off Japanese soil and through the character of Haruki Sato. As she has in many of her other works she also does an incredible job of painting the story with words - describing everything in such detail as it would be seen through the eyes of two of the world's greatest detectives.  Working as the perfect tag-team of detectives that only Mary and Sherlock can be, they work to unravel the case only to discover in the end that even they did not have all of the pieces of the puzzle.  While I enjoyed the story very much and found it very easy to dive into, after all of the ups and downs of their journey throughout the book, I found the ending to be a bit of a let-down and anti-climactic.  I do have a feeling though that Haruki Sato will join Mary and Sherlock on a future adventure and am looking forward to the next adventure.

My almost 7 year-old has really enjoyed other Gamewright games such as Rat A Tat Cat and Sleeping Queens, but those have become a bit too easy for her so we decided to try one of their games that is for an older age level.  The concept of the game is simple enough - you want to have as few moose in your house as you can and put as many moose in the other players house as you can.  We played the first several hands of the game with the cards in our hands face-up on the table so we could learn easier and help each other play, and after we got the hang of things we were able to progress to holding our cards in our hands as you're supposed to.It's a fun and addicting game for 2 or more people, with fun and colorful pictures on the cards. The instructions are clear and well-written and show samples of the game play. I think this one will stay in our rotation for several years, not likely to be outgrown by a child anytime soon.

I tried to like this - more than once, but I just couldn't get past the taste.  The chocolate part wasn't bad, the raspberry just tasted so artificial, it made me think of the fruit flavoring that you get with any type of children's medicine  - even though the flavor says 'grape' or 'orange' or 'cherry' the medicine doesn't taste anything like any of those fruits.  That's what this reminded me of - I've never tasted a raspberry that tasted like this.The texture was fine - it was smooth and creamy, reminded me of the texture of store-bought chocolate milk.  While the ingredient list is impressive as far as vitamins and protein content, I was disappointed to see the controversial ingredient carrageenan is included on the list. For those not familiar with it I suggest doing a bit of research - it's a known cancer causing agent and is unfortunately added to many food items these days, much like the nasty high fructose corn syrup.I can't say much as to how satisfying it was to stave off cravings between meals, as I wasn't able to manage more than a few sips before tossing what was left.

As my cat moves up in her senior years her joints have become painful to her from arthritis and she developed a severe limp and was crying when she walked.  The first thing our vet recommended was giving her a cosequin supplement to help relieve her symptoms. I first purchased a different brand from our local Petsmart since it was convenient to stop there - needless to say it was not cheap.  Once we figured out that the medicine did help the cat significantly I did some shopping around and price comparison, and this brand is the cheapest I've found for the quantity and if you factor in free shipping (assuming you're buying at least $35 of other Amazon-eligible items which we always do).  The capsules are in a bottle that does not have a child-proof cover (something to keep in mind if you have little ones in the house), so they are easy to access.  Other brands I've purchased were in individual blister packaged cards which was a pain, so this is much easier.  The capsules easily open so you can sprinkle the powder onto your cat's food - my cat scarfs down her food every time, she has never turned her nose up indicating she detects any medicine mixed in with her food. As long as I continue to add the cosequin to her food twice a day her limp stays away and she is pain free.

This little puzzle game has been a lot of fun for myself, my husband and even my 6 year old.  It's small and portable - perfect for travel, it's been a great way to pass the time during car rides and while waiting at the doctor's office.  Using the small plastic bead pieces you try to match the puzzles in the booklet that comes with the game - the puzzles range from 2D to 3D from very easy to incredibly hard.  Everything fits nicely in the small black case that snaps closed for easy portability.  Would make a great stocking stuffer, and I plan on picking one up for the Yankee Swap we'll be having at work for Christmas.

I'm happy with everything in the set with the exception of the dog - it was very poorly put together, and even that I'm willing to overlook rather than deal with the hassle of sending it back to Amazon and ordering another hoping it turns out better.  The ears seem to be sewn on almost sideways so that they sort of cover the eyes, and they are badly misaligned so one ear is much more forward than the other. Aside from that, the dog is very cute - very plush and soft.  The little accessories are cute and everything is just the right size to be used with any 18 inch doll.  The leash does not have a small loop to fit over the doll's hand, even though it is pictured that way.  A dab of super glue or a few minutes with needle and thread can easily fix this.  Overall I'm happy with the set considering how much you are getting with this, compared to how much you would pay for the stuffed animal alone from American Girl.  Everything comes in a cute little box that has the picture show here on it.

An advance reading copy was provided by NetGalley in exchange for an honest review. As was the 30th volume of Writers of the Future, volume 31 is a great anthology of SF/F. The stories by the new authors are excellent and the ones by the established writers, terrific. The essays about the trade were also very good. The illustrations are stunning. Congratulations to editor David Farland for having assembled such an excellent work. These new writers will be the next generation of SF/F authors and I am glad that I had the opportunity to read them now. I strongly recommend this book for anyone who reads the genre.

An advanced reader copy was provided by NetGalley in exchange for an honest review. I enjoyed this book. Author Jeffery Lewis put together a short but amusing look at the life of baby boomers as told by expressions and song and movie titles. Lewis uses these to tell a somewhat disjointed story of the world as baby boomers knew it when we were young and how we know it today. Parts were superficial but some were very insightful and meaningful such as describing November 22, 1963 with a particularly poignant movie title. I recommend this book for baby boomers because of its insights and nostalgia.

I received this book as an advanced reader copy in return for an honest review. This book is look at the history and philosophy of science built around evolving concepts of the Earthâ€™s age and movement. The first two sections of the book were on these two subjects and while it was a comprehensive look, the writing could have been more lively and conversational. The third part of the book was quite good and looked at scientific truths and how different religions dealt with them. The writing here was indeed more lively and I feel that this is closer to what author Hubert Krivine wanted the reader to take away from the book. It is this part of the book that earned it a 4-star rating. I recommend this book for anyone interested in the philosophy or history of science.

Author Alex Marshall crafted an interesting story with crisp action and colorful characters. But the book has more gore than I am comfortable with, in line with the goriness of Steven Eriksonâ€™s Malazan Book of the Fallen series. But unlike Malazan, there is not enough humor to balance the violence. The story also lacks chemistry between the protagonists, the type that can be found in Django Wexlerâ€™s Shadow Campaigns or Michael Sullivanâ€™s Riyria books. Nonetheless, the book is well worth reading and I recommend it for anyone who enjoys the Fantasy genre.Disclosure: I received this book for free as an advanced reader copy in return for an honest review.

Disclosure: I received this book for free as an advanced reader copy in exchange for an honest review.I loved this book even though it is not really a cookbook about how to clone a mammoth. It is about the scientific, ethical and legal aspects of bringing extinct species back to life. Author Beth Shapiro explains the science in a clear and conversational manner. She also freely expresses her opinions about the subject, but is always clear about what is factual, what is opinion and what is speculation. Shapiro integrates some personal anecdotes into the book and creates a relationship with the reader. When I finished reading the book, I felt I was saying goodbye to a friend I had just met. I strongly recommend this book to anyone interested in science, especially people interested in evolution and genetics.

As disclosure, I received this book for free as an advanced reader copy in exchange for an honest review. I enjoyed this book. Author Rachel Swaby did a great job of showing the struggles these women went through in order to do their science. I did find the science simplistic, but thatâ€™s not the point of the book. It's saddening to think of all the advances that hadn't been made because of the obstacles women faced. I recommend this book for anyone interested in the history of science. For more detailed information on a couple of the women, I strongly recommend Rosalind Franklin: The Dark Lady of DNA by Brenda Maddox and Dorothy Hodgkin: A Life by Georgina Ferry.

I loved this book. Authors Paul Singh and John R. Shook put together an excellent, well-written story about how humankind learned about our world. The book compares our knowledge of the world through science versus through myths. The book discusses a variety of creation myths and doesnâ€™t just look at the western world. The authors also discuss the development of new technologies and how religious/conservative forces frequently reject these technologies. The book is philosophically similar to The Bible Is Not Great: The Truth About The Bible, Religion And God by Soren Sagan But the the Singh/Shook effort is much better written and the science is more accurate and detailed. I recommend Discovering Our World for anyone interested in the interaction between science and religion in terms of understanding our world.

Disclosure: I received this book for free in return for an honest review.This book is a collection of essays, with each one specifically looking at a city or province in Brazil, Argentina, Spain or Portugal. The two exceptions were one essay about Montreal Canada and one about the biology of the influenza virus. So this isnâ€™t a medical book; itâ€™s about how the pandemic was seen and handled in various areas. I think, though, that the messages here are broadly applicable. Many, if not most, of the essays are translated into English, or at least appear so, and this somewhat distracts from the enjoyment of the book. This is an interesting book for those who are studying or otherwise very interested in the pandemic.

I read this book (that I received for free in return for an honest review) because the title led me to believe that the book was about author George Takeiâ€™s experiences related to Star Trek. And to some degree Takei addresses it but not enough to satisfy my curiosity. However Takei is a good story teller and the book is nonetheless interesting, which reflects the very interesting life that Takei had led up to that point, including time spent in an internment camp during World War Two. The book covers Takeiâ€™s life until 1991 which coincides with the release of Star Trek VI-The undiscovered country and the death of Gene Roddenberry. The only significant weakness of the book is that Takei tends to be melodramatic. Nonetheless, I liked the book and recommend it for Trekkers and for anyone who wants an inside look at the entertainment industry.

I enjoyed this book. Author Thor Hanson brings a lot of interesting personal detail and a good sense of humor to his discussion of seeds. The science is very clear and accessible. The writing is conversational in tone and I felt that I was getting to know Hanson. It was actually hard to put the book down and I only have a passing interest in botany and I do not garden. Although I also liked Jonathan Silvertownâ€™s An Orchard Invisible, which I rated as four stars, I felt that Hansonâ€™s effort was slightly more enjoyable. Nonetheless if you are interested in seeds, then either book is a good choice.

I am a big fan of Robert Sawyer so it should come as no surprise that I loved this book, the first of the Quintaglio Ascension Trilogy. Although I found the setting a little far-fetched, it was internally consistent and everything made sense after I suspended disbelief. The pacing was great. There was humor and romance. I strongly recommend it for all fans of the genre. I am looking forward to reading the other two books.

This is a light-hearted look at around 40 snippets about the human body. Although a lot of the information contained in the book is common knowledge, authors Mitchell Moffit and Greg Brown tell it in such a blunt and entertaining way, that the information becomes new. I recommend this book to anyone interested in science and even to people who aren't as this book might get them interested.

I liked this book. I have read many books where the subject matter was interesting but the author managed to write a boring book. Happily, this book is the opposite. Author Jonathan Waldman managed to turn mundane rust into an interesting story of science, business and politics. The one downside of the book is that occasionally Waldman spends too much time on unnecessary details such as describing peoplesâ€™ clothing and food. Waldman writes in a conversational tone and explains things well. I recommend this book to anyone interested in science.

I enjoyed this book (that I received for free as an advanced reader copy via Netgalley in exchange for an honest review). Author Pendred E. Noyce did a great job of showing the struggles 16 women went through in order to do their science. Noyce also successfully showed the women's places in chronology through the use of timelines. She also expanded on some of the science, but this is definitely not a book about science; it is about the women, who despite the obstacles, made great contributions to science. A companion volume, Remarkable Minds: 16 More Pioneering Women in Science and Medicine, is due to come out in August 2015. I look forward to seeing whom Noyce will profile in this volume.I recommend this book for anyone interested in the history of science and for anyone who wants to encourage girls or women to enter STEM fields. I also strongly recommend Rosalind Franklin: The Dark Lady of DNA (who is not included in this book) by Brenda Maddox and Dorothy Hodgkin: A Life by Georgina Ferry (who is included in the book).

Disclosure: I received this book through Netgalley as an advanced reader copy in exchange for an honest review. Patrick Lenton has put together a selection of not-normal short stories. I enjoyed them very much although I must confess that the stories, even for science fiction/fantasy, are weird. For example, in one story, a man turns into a tree out of sadness. In another, a woman seeks magnetic love. And in a third, a superhero is made out of bats. Nonetheless I enjoyed the stories and recommend it for anyone who likes SFF.

Authors Penny Le Couteur and Jay Burreson put together a great book on chemistry, written in a very conversational tone. The book covers science, politics and geography, in discussing the 17 chosen chemicals. This book is as good as The Disappearing Spoon by Sam Kean and Seven Elements that Changed the World by John Browne. I found that Napoleonâ€™s Buttons had a little more chemistry than these in that it showed molecular structures and the differences between molecules. But it did this in a very clear way with a lot of illustrations. I also found this book to be a little better than Periodic Tales by Hugh Aldersey-Williams. The four books I mentioned are different enough that I recommend that you read all four but if you only want to read one, then I would recommend Seven Elements, but only because it is the latest to be published.

I should not have enjoyed this book. There is too much technobabble, the plot and scenes jump around too much and there are too many characters. The science is germane to the story but is too complicated. Nonetheless, I did enjoy the book. There is some humor and author Susy Gage writes with a light tone. There is suspense and a slew of likeable characters and some not so likeable. This book is a cross-genre science fiction detective story and I recommend it for readers interested in both genres.  However, Robert Sawyer's Red Planet Blues, similarly cross-genre, is a more enjoyable read.

I enjoyed this book (that I received as an advanced reader copy via Netgalley). It's not just about evolution, itâ€™s about how the theory of evolution was developed and the battle between continual modification and punctuated equilibria. The book also discusses the interplay between evolutionary biologists, paleontologists and molecular biologists. Author Niles Eldredge included his personal journey in the book as well, particularly when he figuratively and literally followed in Darwinâ€™s footsteps. I recommend this book for anyone interested in evolution. It makes an interesting counterpoint to Richard Dawkins's The Selfish Gene. Eternal Ephemera is more technical, but covers more ground, than Darwinâ€™s Ghosts by Rebecca Stott, although I will say that Stottâ€™s book was more fun to read.

Iâ€™ve read the Riyria Chronicles and the Riyria Revelations and loved them all. So I had very high expectations for this short story, which I received from the author in exchange for an honest review. I was not disappointed. It is fabulous. I love author Michael Sullivanâ€™s writing so my only disappointment is that it wasnâ€™t longer. I can only hope that Sullivan turns this into a full length novel. Even if you have not read the Riyria books previously, it doesnâ€™t matter. This story is a great introduction to the characters. I strongly recommend this book to anyone who reads Fantasy.

Authors Michael Gerald and Gloria Gerald created a great summary of biology. The Geralds discuss the 250 major events in biology along with information about the scientists who made the discovery or invention. Each story is short but written clearly and in a conversational tone. It was almost impossible to read just one story; I would have to pry myself away from the book. I strongly recommend this book for anyone interested in biology or in the history of science. Even if you have a background in biology, as I do, the book is still entertaining and worth reading.

Disclosure: I received this book as an advanced reader copy in exchange for an honest review. The first chapter of the book talks about literary genres in Brazil, Cuba and Puerto Rico, prior to the start of international public health programs by the U.S.  Since I am not a fan of literature, I should have found this section boring, but author Jose Amador managed to keep my interest. Chapters 2, 3 and 4 were about US involvement in public health programs in Brazil, Cuba and Puerto Rico as a tool for U.S. imperialism. These chapters are very interesting although Amador could have spend more time on Yellow Fever eradication in Cuba.  And finally chapter 5 ties it all together but this time through a discussion of culture. This too, I should have found boring but didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t. Aside from public health, there was not a lot about medicine in the book, which is fine because my main interest is public health. On the other hand Amador could have put even more emphasis on the public health aspects.  Nonetheless I enjoyed the book and I recommend it for anyone interested in the history of public health.

This book has an interesting Q and A structure with questions from readers of New Scientist magazine with answers from assorted individuals. Editor Mike Oâ€™Hare did a good job of selecting the questions and answers that appeared. The questions ranged from quantum mechanics to traffic flow and cheese. I found that on the stricter science questions, some of the answers were too complex but the ones on real life were excellent. The part I enjoyed the most is reading a question and then asking myself, â€œYes. Why does that happen?â€ I recommend this book for anyone who wants scientific answers to everyday problems.

Author Steven Weinberg provides a comprehensive history of astronomy and physics from ancient times up to the time of Isaac Newton. Weinberg writes in a conversational tone, but nonetheless can be overly technical even though there are technical notes. On the positive side, the book covers the ancient times and middle ages quite well. On the downside, although this book is on the history of science, there was nothing on biology. And readers interested only in astronomy might be better off reading Recentering the Universe: The Radical Theories of Copernicus, Kepler, Galileo, and Newton by Ron Miller and Stargazers by Alan Chapman. Nonetheless, I recommend this book for readers interested in the history of physics and astronomy.

I loved this book. A lot of the storyline didnâ€™t make sense but that was fine because the characters were as perplexed as the reader. John Scalzi created a humorous, confusing, satirical, delightful story that involves space exploration and time travel. It is very loosely based on the red-shirted crew members Star Trek. The coda at the end of the book are amazing for their emotion. This book is a must-read for any fan of the science fiction genre.

The title of this book should more appropriately be â€œHow I was a husband.â€ As author Tim Dowling explains, this book is not advice or self help, which based on what I read, is probably a good thing. I wonâ€™t comment on Dowling as a husband or father because this canâ€™t really be judged on the basis of some selected stories. Some of the stories were funny, some were serious, and some made me wince, but they are all well written. Particularly entertaining are the lists of things that Dowling creates. I recommend this book for married men who will inevitably compare their marriages with that of Dowling.
