To women, I just want to be clear that this book is about a sample of one and does not reflect the general married-men population. Nonetheless this should be an enjoyable read.

This is a great book. I found it hard to put down once I started it. Yuval Noah Harari writes with a good sense of humor and some sarcasm. The book is a fascinating look at how society developed through three revolutions: cultural, agricultural, and scientific. The book covers the history  of Asia, Europe and the western hemisphere. While it is along the lines of Jared Diamond's Guns, Germs, and Steel, I feel that Harariâ€™s conclusions were better grounded than Diamondâ€™s. Although I recommend both books, if you are only going to read one, then I strongly recommend Harariâ€™s.

I received this book as an advanced reader copy via Netgalley. Since I liked the episode so much and had never read a graphic novel before, I was not optimistic that I would enjoy this book. I was very, very wrong. I found the story quite different than the aired version and much better. The visualizations are very strong and I had a real sense of watching an actual episode. I strongly recommend this book for all diehard fans of Star Trek.

Disclosure: I received this book as an advanced reader copy from Netgalley. When I started reading this, I didnâ€™t like it. I thought it too irreverent for an occasion such as a Passover Seder. But as I continued reading, it grew on me. The story wasnâ€™t just irreverent, it also made me think. Although some readers may find this book sorely lacking in gravitas, for the appropriate audience I think it is suitable for use during a Seder. I recommend this Haggadah for those people who want a thoughtful Seder without the dogma and certainly with less ritual.

First, disclosure: I received this book as an advanced reader copy in exchange for an honest review. Second, I enjoyed this book. I liked the storyline and the characters. The illustrations are excellent and helped tell a story.The book had a couple of minor weaknesses. Children who are more familiar with the genre might find some some of the elements a bit juvenile. In addition, some parts of the story were less science fiction and more fantasy. However neither of this is significant and might actually be good for younger readers. I also think that this is a good book for children new to science fiction. This is the first of a series of books and I look forward to reading the others.

John Wright wrote an interesting book about how the various forms of life got their Latin names. Using anecdotes and humor, Wright lifted the subject out of what could have been a boring book. The classification of life is important, but the methods behind the classification are not well known.  As a university student, I must have memorized hundreds of Latin names but never really gave the science of taxonomy much thought. I am glad that Wright has paid tribute to these scientists. The one thing about the book that I didnâ€™t like is that there was very little said about the microbial world, but as a microbiologist, I might be biased. I recommend this book for anyone interested in the history of science.

I have read a lot of books that follow the same â€˜law of attractionâ€™ premise and find that many of them simply tell the reader to rely on wishful-thinking and donâ€™t offer any practical advice that can be applied and practiced. That being said, I was glad to find that the author, Lak, avoids this solely wishful-thinking approach and instead offers genuine advice that is applicable and reasonable and which I am sure many different people can relate to â€“as an admitted realist and pragmatist, I am glad that the author has chosen this direction for the book.I found the sections regarding inner conflict and environment to be very helpful, but I do think that some of the other parts could have benefited from a bit more elaboration. Other than that, Iâ€™d say itâ€™s ultimately a worthy read.

I ended up finishing Thabo Nkomoâ€™s â€œThe Night Is My Dominionâ€ in a single sitting last night and must say that I found myself hooked essentially from beginning to end.Derek is certainly an admirable protagonist and his character is one of the main reasons why I enjoyed the book so much; I think itâ€™s easy for authors to get lost in the detective archetype and try to do what everyone else is doing, which is something I come across often, so I was glad to see that this author wasnâ€™t afraid to try something new and the end result has led to a genuinely unique and interesting character.The thriller genre is my favorite of them all, and I must admit that I can be a bit overly-critical towards some thriller books because I feel that many authors donâ€™t do the genre justice. That being said, and although I still think â€œThe Night Is My Dominionâ€ could benefit from improvement and some extra editing, I am ultimately quite satisfied with the read and I look forward to seeing what else the author will be able to offer readers in the future.

Itâ€™s great! Iâ€™ve used reusable filters in the past but often found that it was very hit-or-miss depending on the brand. With these, I can definitely say theyâ€™re a hit and they seem like they will last a long time. Iâ€™m not sure if itâ€™s just in my head, but I feel like the coffee has a better taste compared to my other filters, so thatâ€™s always a plus.Iâ€™ve always been a big fan of hemp products in general, as I find the material to offer a wide range of benefits and, of course, itâ€™s environmentally-friendly. Hard to beat.

I will be honest, I usually am quite negatively biased against the sci-fi genre and often disregard it completely; I can be far too selective when it comes to books with futuristic themes and so I went into this read with my usual skeptical demeanor. That being said, I must say that â€œForeign Distrustâ€ definitely went way above and beyond my initial expectations and I truly do think that it has been put together very well.The plot is original and has many scenes that had me wondering what was going to happen next, yet most of the time the situation would pan out differently (as a major thriller fan, I love this vibe). The characters were complex and the dialogue between actually seemed quite realistic and dynamic in a way that made it easy for me to become involved with the book.Overall, Iâ€™d give Foreign Distrust a 8/10 â€“ there were a few scenes that the book could have done without and others that would benefit from being expanded upon more, but other than that, Iâ€™d still consider it a worthy read.

If youâ€™ve ever wondered what the Jehovahâ€™s Witnesses are really like â€“ then Eugene Walkerâ€™s â€œJehovahâ€™s Witnesses Exposedâ€ is a book that should not be overlooked under any circumstance.I must admit that I was quite skeptical at first when I came across this book because, often when I come across authors that are writing about a religion in a negative light, the books usually seem to be filled with unfair biases and malicious slander that prevent an objective and well-thought out argument from being expressed. I was glad to find that this book is far from the aforementioned, and it is instead filled with plenty of strong evidence backed by solid research that made it easy for me to make up my own mind about Jehovahâ€™s Witnesses.

I love it. Every part in Spoiled Rich is just as good as the last and the writing expresses the story in a way that makes it hard to put down. The biggest reason of why I enjoyed these books so much is due to the fact that the steamy scenes are actually tasteful, as opposed to the scenes being over-the-top, written purely for shock value, or just plain corny, which is what I often encounter in the romance genre.I originally became a fan of Christina Clark after reading the â€œCage of Desireâ€ series, but I personally say that Spoiled Rich is my favorite series by the author due to there being a more prominent suspenseful vibe that makes most of the books very exciting and, of course, the chemistry between Sophia and Carter!

I have a relatively busy lifestyle but I still always manage to get at least 7-8 hours of sleep a night. For whatever reason, I still always feel tired throughout the day and have tried several so called remedies to try to counteract it but I have yet to see any substantial positive effects.As a sort of last resort, I picked up this book and a few others related to sleeping problems; I read the others before giving Adam Jamesâ€™s book a chance, but Iâ€™d have to say that â€˜Double Energy, Cut Sleep In Halfâ€™ is certainly one of the better reads I have come across so far.I have quickly come to realize that thereâ€™s a lot more to sleeping disorders than I was previously aware of and I learned a lot more than I was expecting to, especially in regard to diet when it comes to making sure you have the right amount of vitamins and minerals.Of course, this isnâ€™t no magic cure. What's discussed in this book is centered around a long-term plan but it looks quite promising and I look forward to sticking with it and seeing some results.

Ariel Gabrielâ€™s â€œMy Life before My Deathâ€ is a powerful and touching read that grabbed my utmost attention within the first few pages. The narration is filled with passion and sentiment, and even though the authorâ€™s experiences were much different than mine while growing up, I can say that I definitely could relate to some parts â€“ especially during his younger years.What particularly interested me about this read are the authorâ€™s reflections on his parenting. My child is much younger than the authorâ€™s, but I could still definitely understand his reasoning behind dealing with such erratic behavior. I commend the author for being able to stay so strong and I am glad that the story has been shared, as it has made me reflect on my life in a few different ways.I would recommend this book to anyone looking for a short, deep and powerful story that can be read in a single sitting.

Of course, with these kind of books, a fast-paced plot filled with plenty of action and twists and turns is absolutely essential; in this regard, I think the author has it spot on. Besides that, I also found the dialogue in Eric Meyer's book to be especially well-structured and it does a great job of helping portray the characters in a way that makes the majority of them seem dynamic and far from two-dimensional. Iâ€™d be more than willing to bet that the author has had quite some extensive military experience, as it seems to be evident through the accuracy and detail throughout the writing, which is probably influential in regard to the aforementioned.Admittedly, I did find a few scenes and interactions between people to be a bit over-the-top and maybe playing on the warfare theme a little too much- but only a few parts stood out to me in this way.Iâ€™d recommend this real to anyone looking for a raw, gritty and immersive story that flows nearly from start to finish due to great writing style; Iâ€™m a big fan of war thrillers in general, and found Black Ops to be quite satisfying.

Anyone that knows of my reading habits is aware that, not dissimilar to Marcus Ryanâ€™s original aversion to magic, I have often been found to stay far away from the fantasy genre except under the rare circumstances when the odd book catches my eye. The Sanctum of Souls has been one of those books for me, and although it wonâ€™t be a game-changer in regard to my literary tastes, I can say that I now have an idea and slight understanding of what all the fuss about fantasy books are for.I think the main reason of why I enjoyed this read is due to the authorâ€™s writing style, the prose is very clean and expresses the strange elements of the plot in vivid detail that made it quite easy for me to become involved with the characters and become immersed into the read. I do think that there were a few parts that the book could have done without, but with a book of this length I often find that this is something that is often impossible to avoid.In summary, I enjoyed it â€“ I canâ€™t say that I will be rushing to buy the authorâ€™s other books as soon as I get the chance, but I certainly wonâ€™t be trying to avoid them either! 7/10
My first time coming across this author, and I thought that the play was very creative and put together well. It's obviously very short but I think that adds to the allure

I had read the first two books in the series before grabbing this bundle and although I had mixed thoughts at first, I decided to keep going at it mainly because I couldnâ€™t resist the price. I went straight for book 3 and found right away that the author seems to have developed quite a lot since the previous two in the series and the momentum didnâ€™t subside all the way to the end, with the exception of a few minor hiccups.The writing reminds me a little bit of author Ellie Danes, whom I have come to admire quite a bit as of recently, but Christina Clarkâ€™s original style is very prominent throughout the series which keeps the story fresh and unique. There are numerous twists thrown in throughout the series (book 4 especially) which helps add some spice to the linearity of the plot and give it a bit of a thriller vibe that I also enjoyed. To rate the series as a whole as it stands, I give it a 7.5. The first two could have been improved but I feel that the latter 3 make up for it, ultimately making the series worth the read.

One of the most prominent things that stood out to me about the author Jeff Thorntonâ€™s writing style is how well he seems to be able to get his own personal voice across through the narration- Iâ€™m not entirely sure what it is, but thereâ€™s a great sense of enthusiasm and passion evident throughout the read that made it very easy for me to become immersed into the story.Admittedly, I usually wouldnâ€™t find myself reading a book like â€˜Mailman Talesâ€™, but I thought Iâ€™d experiment and try something new and, having just finished the read earlier today, I can say that it has been a good choice.On the other hand, I do think that it could have been slightly longer and some of the text could benefit from a bit of editing, but even this is very minor and Iâ€™d ultimately say that the majority of the book is quite well-structured and worthy of spending on hour or so as a relaxing read.

Many people, including myself, primarily associate Elon Musk with the more modern news about his ventures â€“ such as with SpaceX; but I found out recently that he has been involved with many internet start-ups that have gone on to be huge successes, and wanting to find out more about these previous ventures and gain further insight to his success is what led me to this book.I find George Ilianâ€™s books about entrepreneurs to be especially good dude to the layout: in this, the author offers a great deal of insight about Elon Musk in a biographical way, and then he extracts concise and strong lessons from what is discussed, which can then be applied to many different endeavors. I'll definitely be keeping this book in mind in the future.

To be honest, Iâ€™ve been avoiding pretty much any books that involve the vampire archetype- as it has been overplayed over the past few years and it seems that most writers are unfortunately trying to follow the â€œTwilight recipeâ€.. Anyway, with that being said â€“ I ended decided to give R.G. Tamakiâ€™s â€œVampire Americanaâ€ a chance after stumbling upon the extremely well-animated trailer and I soon thereafter found myself hooked within the actual book quite early on in the read.The thing that I admire most about the author is that he simply isnâ€™t afraid to try something new and by doing so, he offers readers something fresh and unique to the genre through the story of Jim Cadillac (who is one of the weirdest characters Iâ€™ve came across as of recently, to be honest).Overall, I did enjoy the book but I do think that some of the less prominent characters could have had a bit more detail added to them to make them seem more realistic and dynamic. Other than that, Iâ€™d say itâ€™s worth the read.

My partner has always been particular to the gluten-free lifestyle, and although I'll never been too much of a fan (I love my grain-based foods too much), I decided to get this to help cater to her needs more when I cook for dinner. Anyway, at first I was expecting the ingredients for most of the recipes to be hard to find because we don't have many organic or healthy food type stores where I live, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that the term 'gluten-free' isn't as extreme as I thought, and many of the recipes in this book can easily be put together and even experimented with - which is especially good for me as I always love to add my own unique twist to any kind of recipes.I'd recommend the book - I read it through my Kindle Fire and the formatting is excellent, I just think that some of the bigger recipes would have benefited from pictures.

I came into possession of my first crockpot as a birthday gift not too long ago, but I had never really used a slow cooker before so I didn't really put it to much use until I came across this ebook. Well, after trying a few recipes (the protein rich bacon frittata is my favorite so far) I am left wondering why I didn't start using a slow cooker a long time ago.. Jamie Stewart has really opened my eyes to the high quality of meals that can be prepared using them.Yes, as expected, some of the meals take a little longer to cook compared to other methods - but the wait is usually more than worth it and the process as a whole is often so easy.

Over the past few years, I have worked various kinds of online related jobs so I have seen firsthand the opportunities out there that exist â€“ and which most people deny or simply donâ€™t believe in. Itâ€™s no secret that the digital medium is rapidly expanding and changing each day, so Iâ€™m always on the lookout for new resources that are insightful and relevant, and Iâ€™d say that Ryan Nelsonâ€™s â€œHow to Make Money Onlineâ€ is definitely one of them.The writing style is clear and concise and the book doesnâ€™t just focus on one specific route, it offers a variety of different ideas that Iâ€™m sure many people will be able to follow with their own set of skills.Overall, Iâ€™d say itâ€™s worth the read for beginners without much prior online knowledge and maybe the more experienced will be able to find some value. I give this book a 8/10 â€“ I simply wish that it were longer and that some parts would have been elaborated upon further.

Iâ€™ve been a big fan of Cate Mara since first discovering her a few months ago. Iâ€™ve had nothing but good reactions from my little brother while sharing her stories with him, even though heâ€™s far from an avid-reader, so it goes without saying that Iâ€™m very impressed by the authorâ€™s storytelling abilities in regard to how well she captures the essence that is so essential when it comes to making children's books effective. Kieranski is a great protagonist and the adventures that he goes on with his friends are very creative and unique, I look forward to seeing more by books by Cate.

"Middle of Nothing" is one of the few reads that I have came across as of recently where I found myself hooked right in the beginning, with a 'page-turner' allure that stays strong throughout most of the book. I found the protagonist to be created especially well, the narration used to express his feelings and experiences are vivid in detail and portray him as a realistic, dynamic figure that made it very easy for me to become immersed into the story.This may have been the first book that I have read by Scott Reed, but I can definitely say that it won't be the last, as I will be keeping an eye out for future releases.

I've always been a fan of the romance genre and always find myself coming back to it after I adventure into different kinds of books. Problem is, I find that many authors are using the same plots and archetypes and often many of the stories seem too predictable to me.  I stumbled upon Maria E. Pinto's "They knew no limits..."  and was more than happy to find that she isn't afraid to think outside of the box and try something new, throwing in plenty of twists and turns that give it a great mystery/thriller vibe, and expressing it all through a vivid writing style.If you're a fan of love stories that are far from typical and intertwined with a great mystery vibe then I highly recommend this book. I give it a strong 9/10

Absolutely love it! Tina J. Cole has a wonderful writing style and the message that she expresses through 'How To Be Really Street Smart' is beyond insightful, uplifting, and admirable. There are plenty of snippets from the Bible included throughout parts of the book that really help deliver and strengthen the message that the author is trying to get across. The analogy between learning the rules behind driving and following the rules needed to be responsible in every day situations help make the book easy to understand as offering a great deal of insight. I highly recommend it!

Each year, my house ends up being the rendezvous point for most of my extended family to get together and enjoy Thanksgiving with each other. This usually means that I have close to two dozen or more people to cater for and so, with Thanksgiving right around the corner, I decided to buy a few recipe books beforehand to get some ideas in hopes of trying something new this year - which is what led me to this.Jamie Stewart's ended up being the fourth book that I read, and although I did find some inspiration from the others, I must say that I feel I've gotten the most value for price from this - 200 recipes for under a dollar is hard to beat no matter what the genre, and the recipes all seem of a very high quality.Definitely looking forward to trying the cheesy cauliflower and pumpkin mash as well as some of the vegan recipes I came across because, as a meat-eater, I often find it hard to compromise. more than satisfied!

I spend about 6 months of the year living in Colorado and, as most smokers now, itâ€™s been legal to possess and grow up to 6 plants here on a personal basis, which obviously opened up a lot of avenues for bigger more-established legal businesses to move into the marijuana industry- especially when it pertains to medical use. I have never used marijuana too avidly through my life but I learned enough about it to keep me from being naïve to the huge potential that the merging market is offering to entrepreneurs, not only just in CO and other more weed-friendly states but also on a national scale.Anyway, with that being said, I can say that as of today Iâ€™ve read at least a dozen marijuana business books so far this year and I must say that Megan Dealâ€™s is certainly up there with the best that Iâ€™ve came across so far. The writing style is concise, straightforward, and offers plenty of business advice that can be applied to a wide variety of ventures, including those not based around marijuana. I found the sections regarding Real Estate services to be especially helpful and theyâ€™ve caused me to think up some ideas of my own that I look forward to putting into practice.Obviously, I did enjoy the book but I do think that some parts could have been elaborated upon further and the list of dispensaries could certainly have been cut down substantially or been in the form of a link directing to another page. Other than that, Iâ€™d say itâ€™s worth the read

I read this book with my little sister and we both loved it - the writing flows smoothly from start to finish and the insightful, uplifting theme that it expresses is very admirable. This is the kind of book that fits my definition of the perfect type of read when it comes to the children's books genre - it's not only easy to become immersed and involved with, it also offers insight and a lesson that readers can take with them after finishing. A great blend.The illustrations are great too, they really compliment the story very well and anyone that has experience trying to read stories to children  knows how essential they are in helping get the point across. I would have liked it to be a bit longer, but other than that I am quite satisfied with the book

Absolutely wonderful! Elegant, moving, thought-provoking, and insightful are just a few of the multitude of words I would use to describe this book. I must admit that I don't find myself reading these kind of books and often I don't feel the inclination to do so, but having just finished the read, I can certainly say that I am more than happy that I gave it a chance.Renee Starr's writing style expresses many profound and inspiring concepts in a way that is easy to understand and enjoyable to read due to the relaxed, almost conversation-like undertone of the text - this compliments the message of the book in an excellent manner.I advise any women out there whom may be looking to get in touch with their femininity on a deeper level to pick up 'You Are Woman, You Are Divine' as soon as possible.

I originally became aware of the author, Mike Sheridan, when I discovered one of his other books 'Eat Meat and Stop Jogging'. Even though I went into that book as a skeptic, I found myself to be very impressed with the author's unique style and approach to fitness, especially his way of avoiding all the myths and BS that are so prevalent in this genre (really, how many more 'lose X amount of pounds within a week' and other ridiculous claims do we need saturating the market??).I am glad to say that nearly all of the aspects of the writing style and approach to health that I admired in the previous book that I read were evident throughout Live it Not Diet. Mike Sheridan does an excellent job of skipping all of the jargon, instead choosing to get right to the point in a way that is easy to understand and certainly practical. The approach is far from a 'get fit overnight' scheme, the premise is instead based on building a long term and stable plan that I'm sure many different people can find value from.

For me personally, 'Sideswiped' is defined by a clean prose style, a hook that catches you from the very beginning, and a suspenseful vibe throughout most of the book that leaves you wanting to find out what happens next at the end of each chapter without pause.Having had a few close friends who have been in the military and whom have had their fair share of war experiences between them, I can say that Russell Moran has really hit the nail on the head in regard to making Matt Blake seem as realistic and genuine as possible to the Marine veteran personality. The hardened attitude, different perspective, and even the vocab in the dialogue is seemingly spot on.Of course, there's a lot more to Sideswiped than this, and the plot itself ventures down many paths, but I find it essential for books like these to have great narration to help me get immersed into the read, and Russell Moran has done an excellent job of doing so with the character of Matt.

It's not often that I find myself venturing into the sci-fi genre, especially the books that have a prominent dystopian theme - but the summary of Nyxe seemed unique compared to all the other sci-fi reads I have encountered as of recently (Is it just me or is everyone playing with the same archetypes and ideas??) and so I decided to give it a gamble.Well, with that being said, I can say that I am more than happy that I gave Nyxe a chance. The plot is creative, the narration is executed in a smooth manner that flows well from essentially start to finish, and, ultimately - it's in general an enjoyable read. I'm not completely convinced that the sci-fi genre is going to be one that I will revisit again often in the future, but Nyxe has left me with a good impression and I'll be keeping an eye out for similar reads.To put it briefly, I recommend this book for those readers out there whom are looking for an original, fresh twist to the dystopian theme. There were a few editorial errors and parts that I think could have moved a bit faster - but nothing too substantial and my overall opinion of the book is obviously still positive.

At first, I assumed that this book primarily would be focused more in regard to learning to respect other people's boundaries after starting the process of recovery and beginning to adjust back into the sober life. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the author offers plenty of advice about this this, but she also touches deeply on setting your own personal boundaries - for instance, not being self-critical, co-dependent or feeling inadequate due to another person's actions, or letting other people's views define you.One particular sentence that stood out to me when I read the sample is: "Whether in early recovery or sober many years, it often becomes clear that just putting down the drink and the drugs simply isn't enough to live a happy and purposeful life." As an alcoholic, I find myself relating to this in more ways than one. When I began my own personal process, I found that I had to do a sort of 'damage-control' with my relationships with family and friends, mainly stemmed from guilt and anxiety that stayed with me even after I stopped drinking. I have found that this part of the process isn't elaborated on often in books like these, so I am very happy that the author has dedicated such insightful writing to it.

I finished this book last night and all I can say is wow; 'Ayden's Trek' is one of the few books that I completed in just a few reading sessions, at one point I must have gone through 100 pages before forcing myself to give it a rest. I am simply left wanting to see more from the author, and I'll definitely be keeping an eye out for future releasesI must admit that I was expecting a bit of genericness with the plot of Ayden's Trek (let's be honest, the fantasy genre is sometimes notorious for overplayed cliches and mainstream archetypes) but I knew once I got deep into the book that the author, Attila Altdorfer, isn't afraid to branch out and try something new, giving original twists to the concepts that keep readers like myself coming back to the fantasy genre for more and more. Yes, like any other book out there, it's not perfect, there were a few parts that were a bit too much for my liking but in the grand scheme of things I think it's more than impressive. I look forward to seeing what's next.

CRAVED is a bit different than the other books in the series because it focuses more on the relationship between Kevin and Kate, which annoyed me a little first as I have taken a liking to Chase, but I can't deny that it adds plenty of hard to predict twists and drama. As with the other books in the Chased by Him series, CRAVED ends while leaving a big cliffhanger that makes you want to grab the next book ASAP. I'm not exactly sure what it is about the author's writing style, but once I get started I find it hard to stop. Will be reading the next book tonight!

This isn't the type of summary & analysis where it just TELLS the reader blankly what has happened, instead it guides the reader through each chapter, helping give a deeper look into a great work without giving away everything and (what I consider to be) cheating the reader of the potential value and experience that can be gained from the The Oregon Trail. Admittedly, I do think that it could be a bit longer, but that ultimately doesn't belittle my opinion of the S&A.
Great price, though as of lately the bags seem lighter (maybe they are using cheaper, more condensed meat?) either way, the kitties seem to not mind.

NEEDED is just as good, and I'd even dare to say, better than the last two books combined. 'Wanted'  ended with the cliffhanger of Kate unexpectedly finding Paige in Chase's bedroom, and I knew as soon as I had finished those last few pages that I HAD to get my hands on Needed ASAP. I wish not to spoil anything for other readers whom are about to start Needed, but I will say that it will not disappoint!

Coming in at just over 1400 pages, Campbell Biology is arguably the most impressive, defining biology textbook that can be found on the market. I luckily found a used copy (not hardcover) for about $20, and I am more than impressed with it. Worth every penny.

Honestly, the title and premise of 'Eat Meat and Stop Jogging' had me skeptical at first, but I also found it to be an intriguing approach compared to all of the other mainstream, generic e-books that are currently saturating the market, so that's what ultimately led me to giving `Eat Meat and Stop Jogging' a chance.With that being said, I can now say that I am more than glad that I decided to give it a chance, as the author has simply gone way above and beyond my initial expectations in several ways, whilst leaving me with an author name to keep an eye on. There's plenty of myths that are dispelled through scientific studies (oh, and plenty of sources for those, like myself, who love to fact-check) and, from what I have gathered while reading the book, the author focuses on giving a neutral, unbiased perspective which is obviously essential when it comes to any kind books in the health niche (I suppose there is some natural bias behind the writing, but I feel that the author isn't afraid to openly criticize certain points of what he is talking about).Some of the formatting, especially when it came to the pictures, seemed quite off. But other than that, I don't really have any issues with the book. I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a no-BS, unique approach to staying fit.

As of a few months ago, I have adopted the ritual of grabbing a summary/analysis just about every time I venture into a new book, and as of late I have enjoyed many of the Instaread summaries that I have tried so far, which is what led me to this after I decided to give "The Devil in the White City" a reread...The book itself is quite lengthy and dense in some parts, so I was surprised to find how concise this summary is and how well it fits so much into a relatively few amount of pages (compared to the novel, which if I can remember correctly, is at least 400+ pages).Anyway, anyone that knows what a good summary/analysis consists of will find pleasure in finding that this analysis has everything that is needed; detailed character descriptions & analysis', a clear/straightforward writing style used to express the info (as well as a nice overview of the author's writing style and tone itself), and a clear examination of the environment, setting, and history of where the novel takes place.I believe I came across a few grammatical errors, but other than that I'd say it's near perfect.

I loved it.CHASED has the archetypes I've come to love about the romance genre, except with a lively twist that keeps the story and characters (and how they interact with each other) fresh and exciting. This is especially true for Chase.. I also particularly enjoy how the perspective of the narration shifts between the characters, it makes the relationships feel more personal and genuine when you can get a glimpse of what's really going on in their thoughts,Certainly a great introduction to the series! I've already downloaded the next two and plan to read them over the weekend.

WANTED follows right where CHASED left off, with a great writing style and that 'page-turner' feel, it does a great job of keeping the momentum up and staying up to the standard that the first in the series has set. Hopefully it can continue..The author has done a great job of making the romantic parts of the story to stay heated, passionate, and believable without venturing into the realm where it feels far too over the top or (as I find in many books in this genre) just plain weird. So far, this has been a series that I have found myself becoming involved with and, if the rest of series feels the same to me when I get a chance to indulge, then I will be left more than impressed. Although I did prefer the first, I can still say that WANTED gets a 8/10 from me.

This is a gorgeous bag! Nicely made, very sturdy, a nice rich color, strong zippers and a great size. The inside lining is gorgeous too and the overall look of this purse/bookbag is stunning. I can fit some of my books in it when I need to read on the run and pretty much anything else that I would need to carry with me as well. As a mom I always have a random selection of things in my purse and this one does well to hold them all. It also allows me to be hands free whenever I need to be, because I can just sling it on my back, that is invaluable so many times! I received this product at a reduced rate in exchange for my honest opinion.

This fun toy hits the spots that others can't, namely two at a time. I am a dual stimulation kinda girl and this toy does that and more. It has just the right amount of power and It is sleek and smooth, except for the flat nubby stimulation part. I love that this toy is angled just right to hold in my own hand or let my husband do the work for me. Purple is one of my favorite colors, so that doesn't hurt either. This product is well made and seems very sturdy. I have not had any trouble out of it at all and actually had a VERY enjoyable evening with it. I look forward to many more ;) I received this product at a reduced rate, in exchange for my honest opinion.

I just really can't get behind a tampon that has no applicator. I tried, I really did and if you can get them up there, they have a terrific absorbency and are very comfortable. I received this product from Smiley 360 to try out and I gave them a good go around, but I just don't like them at all. I do like that they come in all the right absorbencies and most likely would really like them IF they had an applicator. These were my mother's favorite brand, so there has to be some good to them. I would have to say that good is that they are so comfortable. I received this product in exchange for my honest opinion.

Oh wow, this thing is so cool. My husband needed one of these badly and this one not only works amazingly well, but the tank holds so much water that he doesn't have to constantly refill it. I like that it is hand held and rechargeable, so that he can use it over and over again on that single charge. It is easy to take this along traveling too. Oral health is so very important to all your other health and there has never been a simpler way to floss and it is gentle and doesn't leave his gums bleeding like actual floss tends too. This is made of good, sturdy, quality materials and appears to be made to withstand some abuse, which is good because men can tend to be rough on products. I received this product in exchange for my honest opinion.

I, like everyone else, am currently in love with any bath bombs and this set doesn't disappoint. They are so big that they fizz for so long and leave my bath water smelling amazing for the whole length of my sojourn in the tub. They are packaged beautifully and would make a great gift for anyone that loves baths as much as I do. My husband even stole one for his bath, saying that he had never felt more relaxed than with these bombs. The scent lingers on your skin for a good time after your bath and your skin feels amazing too! These directly compare with the well known brands and in some ways even seem better than those. I received this product in exchange for my honest opinion.

These bath bombs are so big. The smell permeates the air in your bathroom as it explodes to release all those great ingredients into your bath water. They are packaged so nicely that they would make a great gift for anyone. My skin feels amazing after such a relaxing bath in the wonderful scents that come off of these bath bombs. The attached photo is the best example I have of the amazing results one can achieve with the B+W HTC Haesemann Circular Polarizer.  The contrast and definition of the clouds is amazingly clear and the colors are very bright and naturally saturated.  This photo was shot in RAW and converted to a jpg with no post processing whatsoever.The only potential "con" is the price.  I have this mounted to a $2,500.00 zoom lens so to me it was a small price to pay to get great results and protect my investment.

With a home surrounded by oak trees, we are constantly sweeping the deck, porch, and stairs.  Occasionally I will whip out the loud smelly gas blower but only if I'm already sweaty and grimy from yard work.  Then I discovered the WORXAIR!  This tool is perfect for "sweeping" the deck, porch, and stairs around the house.  It's lightweight, relatively quiet, and very effective at blowing off the leaves and light dirt.However, this is NOT for large scale landscaping jobs.  The problem is the battery.  In my experience the battery begins to lose power and the blower loses effectiveness after about 20 minutes of use.  This isn't a big deal for the way I use it because that's about as long as it takes to do the job.  But it's important to recharge the battery after every use.An otherwise perfect light duty blower.  One star deducted for a weak battery.

I just had my home painted by professional house painters and decided to get my own sprayer after watching how quickly and easily they were able to paint my house with a sprayer.  To be clear, the sprayers used to paint an entire house are much more expensive, costing upwards of $500 or more, but then they are also much more capable of pumping gallons of paint per hour.For only $120.00 The PaintWIZ is perfect for small to medium sized painting projects.  With no previous experience with a sprayer and no formal instruction other than watching the painters who sprayed my house, I was able to paint several panels of wooden lattice in less than an hour including clean  up.  One word of caution, although the video implies that the spray is precise enough to avoid taping off areas you don't want to paint I would advise carefully taping off those areas.  Even the professionals were careful to tape of and cover anything they didn't want to paint.  The steadiest of hands can't contain paint carried by the wind.
Lighter weight than the Keens they replaced and easier to put on and take off.

I bought this for my grandson's bathroom because the standard faucet was difficult for him to reach and adjust the water temperature.  He loves it, but I'm looking forward to the day when the novelty wears off, because he's so fascinated with it he likes to play with it.  I like it as well, and intend to order two more for the master bath.Unlike automatic faucets found in public restrooms, this faucet can be used with the sensor for a quick hand wash, or used normally with the handle to adjust the water pressure and temperature.The installation looked more complicated than a standard faucet so I chose to hire a professional plumber to complete the installation, but after watched the plumber install the faucet, I probably could have done it myself.

I'm not a plumber, so I was initially somewhat intimidated by the prospect of trying to install this myself. However, after carefully reviewing the instructions I found it incredibly easy to install this faucet in my outdoor kitchen. This is my second Delta single handle faucet. This first was purchased from Amazon about two years ago and installed by a professional plumber for the inside kitchen.  We have enjoyed trouble free daily use for two years and I expect this one to work just as well outside.

This is a very nice, razor sharp, well balanced knife with a very elegant looking faux Mother of Pearl handle.  But for $139.00 I have to deduct one star because for almost half the price, $75.88 to be exact, one can buy the Global G-2 - 8 inch, 20cm Chef's Knife which I believe is superior to the Sabatier in design and engineering.  There is nothing faux about the Global and it's just as sharp as the Sabatier.Regardless, I like the look for the Sabatier and it's an excellent knife.  It's just a bit too expensive for what it is.

After wearing these boots for almost a month now, here is my review.Although these are marketed as steel toed work boots, they are stylish and comfortable enough to wear anywhere and all day.  They are very light, not heavy like other work boots I've worn.  I wear a 10.5 D, and the 10.5 fit me perfectly.  No worries with fit.  The styling is more of a casual boot, not a work boot, so I was comfortable wearing these anywhere.

This could've been the perfect watch stand.Pros:1)  It's made of rubber so it won't scratch the watch.2)  It holds the charging puck very tight so there's no risk of the puck slipping and not charging the watch.3)  It sticks to the nightstand like glue and doesn't move around.4)  At $10.99 it's one of the least expensive Apple Watch stands on the market.Cons:1)  What Spigen calls the NANOTAC backing sticks to the nightstand or desk better than it sticks to the stand itself.  When I tried to peel it off the nightstand, the backing came unglued from the stand and stuck to the night stand.  I finally managed to peel the NANOTAC backing off the tabletop and some of it stuck.  This needs to be reengineered.
These 8" wide bags are perfect for smaller items and cuts down on wasted plastic which saves money and is better for the environment.

The pleated bags are good for more than just large food items like roasts, but they are ideal for food items you don't want smashed like bread, baked goods, and meat loaf.  One of my only complaint about the standard bags is that they do tend to smash food if you're not careful with the vacuum pressure.  The pleated bags seal just as well without smashing fragile foods.

After enjoying these wonderful headphones for about a month now, I can honestly say that these have the best sound and widest dynamic range of any other headphones I own, including the Bang and Olufsen H8 which cost twice as much.  The only advantage the B&O have over the Philips is bluetooth connectivity.One of the main disadvantages of enjoying music through headphones is the lack of bass response.  The bass response of the Philips M1MK is so good you can actually feel it.I"ll be buying another pair of these for my wife as she has commandeered these away from me!

Who would even think that a major improvement could be made to something as simple as a boat fender.  I like the Extreme Max BoatTector better than the standard boat fender because it takes up less room when it's inside the boat and it protects the top of the gunnel from damage from the dock.

This is a must have accessory for your Big Green Egg as it makes cleaning out the ash pan must more thorough and efficient.  The ash pan is solid construction and should last for several years if kept dry.  It's coated steel, so if left in the rain it will eventually rust and deteriorate.  I keep mine in the cabinet under the BGE.

For the past few years I've been using Firelighters Wood Starting Cubes made by a company called "If You Care".  The If You Care - Firelighters Wood Starting Cubes only cost 40 cents each and it usually only takes 1 cube to start a fire.The Aura Outdoor Products AOP-FS24 All Natural Charcoal Fire Starters cost 70 cents each and take at least 2 to start a fire.  In my test it took 4 cubes to get my coals ready to cook.  They just don't stay lit as long as the The If You Care - Firelighters Wood Starting Cubes and they leave a paper ash block in the fire box.I'm giving a three star "it's okay" rating because they do work, but they are expensive and there's a less expensive and superior alternative available from Amazon.com with Firelighters Wood Starting Cubes.

Although this is advertised as a griddle for the Big Green Egg, it also fits the 22" Weber Kettle as well.The cross-braced underside adds strength and weight to the100% Stainless Steel Kettle-Q.  The full-width grease well prevents oils and grease from dripping into the bowl of the kettle and on to the coals, preventing flareups and mess.Given the rugged stainless steel construction, I expect many years of use from the Kettle-Q!

After assembling the lamp and screwing the articulating arm to the base of the lamp, I was surprised to learn that it's not engineered to swivel left to right.  This is a design flaw for which 1 star was deducted.  Also, the cheap plastic switch on the top of the shade has too much play in it.  The switch wiggles clockwise and counterclockwise about two inches in each direction before activating the switch.  Cheap quality parts deducts another star.The pros:  it's a very inexpensive lamp.  The 60 watt 900 lumen bulb is one of the batter CFLs I've used.  The base is heavy enough to extend the lamp shade almost perpendicular.The cons:  Cheap material, poor engineering, assembly required.

The sound is very good for such a small speaker and the battery life is more than adequate.  Pairing was very simple from both an iPhone and iPad Air 2.  I tried using it in the pool just to test it out and it's an interesting novelty, but the sound is significantly degraded once it gets dunked.  Pull it out and shake it off and it sounds just fine, but there really is no need to have a speaker floating around in the pool with you.  The real beauty of the floating feature is the durability and insurance policy it provides should the speaker be accidentally dropped into the water, but honestly the floating feature is a bit of a gimmick.My go to outdoor bluetooth speaker is still the Eton NRKS400GR Rugged Rukus Xtreme.  It costs a little bit more than the SuperStar, but is sounds better, is solar powered so it will play for days without a recharge, is just as rugged and splash proof, and also will charge your phone.

The is the cable Apple SHOULD SUPPLY with every device.  It's longer than the Apple cable, stronger than the Apple cable, and I expect it will last much longer.  My Apple supplied cables always split and tear near the connectors after a couple of years of use.  I'll up[date the review if I have any issues, but so far so good.

I've been using the Lifeproof Nuud Case for iPad Air 2 for almost a month now, and I've especially enjoyed the piece of mind the case provides when using the iPad outside and on the boat.  I've loaded Navionics maritime charts to my iPad and use it as a navigation system on a boat.  With the Lifeproof Nuud case I don't have to worry about it getting splashed or rained on or dropping it on the deck.It does add a little weight to the iPad Air 2, but even with the case it's still noticeably lighter than the iPad I replaced.  Also, the charging and audio ports are easily accessible behind the waterproof hatches that cover them.5 stars!

Pros:  Although the XSories X-Steady Lite Handheld Camera Stabilizer Rig Gimbal is advertised for GoPro and Action Sports Digital Cameras, it works equally as well with the Sony RX100M3 and other compact point and shoot cameras.With a few minor adjustments of the weights. the larger Sony RX100 was perfectly balanced for shooting smooth video panoramas. Note that the small round weights can be removed and attached in whatever order or location required to balance your camera, and the level window is easy to see for adjusting the balance of the gimbal.It's very lightweight and easy to hold.Cons:So far, I've not discovered any issues with the stabilizer.

I deducted one star for two reasons.  First, because the Resurgence Case doesn't work with the standard USB/Lightning cable, my new lightning car charger was rendered obsolete with this case.  I had to replace my new car charger with a Belkin charger that has an open USB port for the micro USB cable supplied with the case.  Second, there is no plug for the headphone jack, so the case is not water resistant.  A rubber grommet should be included to plug the hole.Otherwise, this is a great case for keeping the phone charged on the go.  As a frequent flier I'm always running out of power so I carry a separate power pack for emergencies.  The Resurgence Case gives me the flexibility to leave the power packs at home!

The Perky-Pet 229 Double Decker easily attracts twice as many hummingbirds as a single decker.  The hummers find the white daisies irresistible.  It arrives fully assembled and ready to fill with nectar.  A great gift for a bird lover.

I wear board shorts while kitesurfing several days a week and I've always tried to wear something under the shorts to prevent chafing. The Turq Swimbriefs are a perfect alternative to wearing regular cotton underwear because the Swimbriefs immediately shed water and dry quickly.

I'll admit at the outset of this review that a 4 star rating for the KitchenAid KVJ0111CU may be considered by some to be rather generous.  However, I chose not to ding the product for what I perceived to be shortcomings for me personally.  This machine makes juice and it does it well.  However, from start to finish: assembly, fruit preparation, juice extraction, clean up - it takes about a half an hour to make three cups of juice.  So for me, this is not a daily driver but a machine that I will use to prepare large batches of juice to last a few days or to prepare fresh juice for cocktails prior to a party.  It's not the type of appliance that quickly makes a cup of juice for breakfast on the go.The attached photograph illustrates all of the parts that must be assembled before use and then disassembled and thoroughly cleaned afterwards.  The instructions do advise that all of the parts are top shelf dishwasher safe, but I choose to wash everything carefully by hand to ensure that all of the parts are free of debris before storage.  Dishwashers are notoriously hard on plastic and don't reach every nook and cranny, so hand washing is advised for sanitary reasons and to prolong the life of the machine.Overall I'm very satisfied with the KitchenAid KVJ0111CU and I anticipate many years of service from what is a very rugged, effective appliance.  I've always wanted to experiment with homemade sauces and marinades and the KitchenAid KVJ0111CU is the perfect appliance for the gourmet chef with plenty of time.  For making large batches of juice (three cups at a time) and for gourmet cooks who prepare fresh made from scratch marinades and sauces, this is a nice solution.

I've been using the Eton NRKS400GR Rugged Rukus Xtreme for about a month now both indoors and out.  The dynamic range of the sound from this little box is nothing short of amazing.The solar charging feature worked flawlessly at the beach.  When we arrived at 10AM I realized that I had forgotten to charge the Rukus and feared we wouldn't be able to listen to music for very long since we were down to 25% power.  I placed the unit directly in the sun and to my surprise it played continuously for 8 hours!I chose the Eton over the Bose SoundLink because It sounds better than the Bose speaker, takes up less room, is splash proof, rugged, solar powered, and doubles as a charger for a phone - all for $100 less than the cost of the Bose.  The Eton is an all around superior product for 30% less money than Bose.There is one design peculiarity to look out for:  The Power Port and AUX Port are the same size and therefore it's easy to plug a cable into the wrong port.  The AUX Port is next to the Power Button and the Power Port is next to the USB Port.

My family is very satisfied with this router and the reach of its wireless connection. Setup was simple and documented very well. The dashboard for customizing router settings is easy to navigate, unlike other router brands I have used in the past. I could tell my connection speed and signal strength was superior than my old router immediately upon first use. There are also several "smart features" available with the router, such as scheduling whenever to turn off WiFi or blocking certain websites from access. I have unfortunately not been able to test the 5.0GHz speed due to my computers only being equipped with a 2.4GHz band, but I'm sure it works just as well. I am impressed with this router and would recommend it to those looking for routers.
1:03 Mins The speck MightyShell is one of the least bulky rugged cases on the market today.  To install, simply snap the iPhone into the case.
Just as entertaining as Breaking Bad, but without the stress.

I bought this model because it's so much easier to open than the manual dial combination of the SentrySafe SFW123DSB that I replaced.  However, my SentrySafe SFW123FUL is even easier to open than this one because it has actual push button numbers instead of the flat screen key pad.  Without discreet buttons to push, it's easy to enter the wrong combination.  It's looks better than the SFW123FUL, but it's not as easy to use.So my advise is this.  If you want an electronic safe instead of the manual dial combination, buy the SentrySafe SFW123FUL instead of this unless esthetics are more important than functionality.

In my 37 years of driving experience I've learned that for improved vision while driving in the rain, there is no substitute for new wiper blades.  This product is to be used as an adjunct to wipers, not a replacement.My first observation, or caparison, is that it takes a lot of work to apply this product, especially when comported to Rain-X.  Second, Rain-X works just as well or better.  I've had this on my windshield for a few weeks, and there's been plenty of rain to test the effectiveness - it definitely works.For my time and money, I'll stick with Rain-X.

As a frequent traveler, I often find my iPhone and iPad running low on power with not a power outlet in sight.  After a full charge, the Moshi IonBank 10k was able to charge my iPhone, then my iPad, and then my iPhone again before the Moshi needed a recharge!  I'm amazed how much power is stored in this little silver box.  What's more, it charges the iPhone and iPad just as quickly as a power outlet in the wall.It's small enough to fit in a pocket, but it weighs about as much as two iPhone 5, so it's a little heavy to carry in a pocket.I love that the Moshi power cable tucks away inside it's own case.  One less thing to carry.I'll be buying another one for my wife.

I bought this for my two and a half year old grandson for him to pack his own snacks and toys to the beach.  He loves the color and the animated fish design. It fit's his small frame perfectly and it's easy for him to open and close.It's perfect for a toddler, but I don't believe it would be appropriate for a school aged child because it's very small and designed for a toddler.  I expect he'll outgrow it within two years.

CAUTION: Avoid use on wood with lacquer, acrylic, or urethane finishes as material may mar surface.  This is printed on the small decal applied to the mat.  In other words, it probably shouldn't be used on a wooden desk?  I probably wouldn't have bought this if the caution was more prominently mentioned in the description.However, I'm using it on my wooded desk anyway because I appreciate the functionality.  It should help prevent scratches on the desk from the computer, keyboard, and mouse.  It also keeps my iMac and keyboard from sliding around.I"ll update the review if there is any damage caused by the mat on my urethane finished desk.  For now I'm giving it 4 stars because it's a nice addition to any desk.

Overall, I like the styling of the watch.  It's heavy enough to give it a good quality feel and the leather strap is thick enough that it should last a long time.  The one major flaw in the design is the chrome hands over a shiny white face.  There is not enough contrast between the hands and the face to easily read the time.  One has to rotate the wrist to get a reflection on the hands to read the time.  It looks good on the wrist, but it's not as functional as it could be.  The other flaw is the timer function.  The faces of the timers are so small that they are virtually useless.  They are there only for the design element, not functionality.Also, if you're considering this as a gift be aware that it is packaged in a rather cheap and juvenile looking tin box with cardboard lining.  This is a $105.00 man's dress watch, but the packaging looks like it was designed for a $25.00 child's watch.  This may not matter if it's for personal use, but the presentation is incongruent with what's inside and this may be a show stopper if considering this watch as a gift.

These placemats are attractive, but they don't do what placemats are supposed to do.  Because there is no backing on the bamboo they slip and slide around the table.  Also, food gets stuck between the bamboo and water drips through.  If you're looking for a placemat to protect your table from spills and water stains, keep looking.  If you're just looking for a decorative placemat to replace before dining, these will suit you this fine.

0:07 MinsThe camera was easy to set up and easy to mount.  The only mounting options are up or down.  To give the user more flexibility in mounting, It would be helpful to be able to mount the camera sideways as well, but at this time it's not an option unless you can tolerate watching the video at a 90 degree angle.  A simple software and/or firmware update would fix this so I hope Belkin will consider this option for a future update.Although the camera is designed to use indoors, I've been trying to use the camera to monitor my front porch through a window.  However, as you can see in the attached video, the IR night vision will not work through glass.  Also, regardless of how I adjust the sensitivity, the slightest sense of motion triggers a recording and email alert.  This may be fine for indoors, but if you're trying to monitor an area outside all it takes is for the wind to blow a tree or flag and the motion detector sets off.  I'll continue to use it this way, but I"m hoping for a software and/or firmware update that will address the sensitivity issue.I've also been taking advantage of the 30 day free trial of the Cloud+ Premium Services.  This subscription allows you to record and store your videos in the cloud, so you can review them later. You can also receive notifications on your smartphone or tablet when the camera's motion sensor is triggered. The notifications include a video link, so you can quickly watch the clip.  It would be nice if Belkin also included to option to save the clips to your own PC, but the only way to do that now is to download them from Cloud+.

There are many reasons why parents may swaddle their babies including:Regulate babies temperatureReduce the likelihood that the startle reflex will wake baby upHelp baby to feel more secure and safe especially in the first 3-4 months after baby is bornReduce excessive crying in young babies, especially babies with colic/refluxHelp babies to get the sleep they need for optimum infant developmentThe problem lies with trying to swaddle an infant with a traditional blanket.  The blanket rarely stays secure and it may be difficult to find the perfect size blanket for the task.  The Ergobaby Swaddler solves these issues and makes it safe and easy to put baby to sleep snug as a bug in a rug.One word of caution though - pediatricians recommend that "If you swaddle the babies hips incorrectly, it can contribute to hip dysplasia," . "But for the first two months of life, if you want to swaddle your baby, you can swaddle the chest area up tight and then make sure the area around the hips is looser. After two months, the baby does need to move around more. Otherwise, it could develop a flat head."  So after two months, let the baby roll.

I've been using theBelkin QODE Ultimate Wireless Keyboard and Case for iPad for about a month now, and the final verdict is that I wish I had ordered this a long time ago.  It had essentially converted my iPad into an inexpensive, lightweight, laptop.  I use my iPad primarily for work and I was growing frustrated with trying to type emails using the onscreen keyboard.  So much so, that I found myself postponing my work until I could get back to my desk and use a real keyboard.  This have improved my productivity immensely.The only drawback is when I want to use the iPad as a tablet to read or surf the web.  When using as a tablet with the keyboard attached, the keyboard flops around and wants to drop open.  Taking the iPad out of the case to use as a tablet is impractical, so I just have to live with it and this is where the case looses one star.If I didn't have to type on my iPad a lot, I wouldn't buy this keyboard case.  But since i do have to type on my iPad every day, this has proven to be a nice improvement over the visual keyboard.

I bought the Swingline GBC Fusion 5000L 12" Laminator because I'm often in need of laminating personal documents and brochures and spec sheets for work.I don't need to use it every day or even every week, so I appreciate that the machine is fool proof enough to recognize pouch thickness and automatically adjusts settings accordingly to deliver the best possible results each time I use it.  Otherwise I'd probably be wasting a lot of pouches for not setting the machine properly.I also like that the machine warms up in 1 minute and laminates at 39 inches per minute - super fast laminating.  This saves a lot of time when I want to quickly laminate a brochure and head out for a meeting.  And speaking of rushing out of the office, the intelligent power off after 30 minutes of inactivity conserves energy and ensures that I don't burn the house down!And speaking of heat, the first couple of times you use the laminator it emits an industrial factory like odor, so be prepared to air out the room after the first use.  Or better yet, use it in the garage the first couple of times so you can avoid stinking up the house or office.One final note, if I had it to do over again I might opt for one of the other less expensive models since I'm not laminating large numbers of documents or brochures.  The 5000L is perhaps a bit overkill for my applications, but I still love it.

One can never have too much storage, and with the price of a 4TB drive below $200 the extra storage and capabilities are well worth the price.  Here are a few reasons why more storage on your desktop is essential.If you use a Mac and back up your files using Time Machine, your backup drive can fill up pretty fast.  When the backup drive reaches capacity, Time Machine starts to delete older backups to make room for new files.  By using this 4TB drive for your backups, you'll be able to store more files for a longer period of time before Time Machine ever needs to delete them.  If you've ever tried to find a file you deleted years ago, you can appreciate the advantage here.Do you take a lot of photographs?  With extra storage on your desktop, you can store all of your photos in RAW format.So, What are the advantages of raw format?All your conversions are done on a fast powerful computer at your convenience.Images can be 'fixed' in ways which would be very difficult without the raw sensor data.You get the full range of data from the sensor.Without sharpening or compression you have not 'lost' any data.You can change your mind about some of the picture settings after you have taken it.The downside of RAW is that they take up a lot of room.  A complex RAW photograph can be 24MB vs. the same photo in jpg may only be 1MB.  With 4TB of storage you can store approximately 125,000 RAW photos.Video files?  4TB will hold 480 hours of HD content.  That's a lot of video!As an added bonus, the Seagate Backup Plus 4TB Desktop external Hard Drive look really nice on the desk next to an iMac!!

After living near the seashore for 2 years, I noticed my tools were rusting in the toolbox.  I cleaned out the toolbox thoroughly and lined the drawers with the Zerust Drawer Liner and not only have the rust stopped, the liner appears to have removed the rust that was already forming.

The Amazon Fire TV is almost better than the Apple TV, and only "almost" because my family uses iMacs and iPads that integrate with the Apple TV more seemlessly for photos, videos, and music I have stored on my Macs.One can easily set up the Amazon Fire TV without opening the instructions, and I love that it's already registered to my Amazon Prime account.  VERY IMPORTANT - If you're going to buy one as a gift, but sure to check the "this will be a gift" box.  When you check the "this will be a gift" box, Amazon will deliver the Amazon Fire TV unregistered. The recipient can register the Amazon Fire TV to their own Amazon account when they set it up.The voice control has worked flawlessly for me.  HD videos begin to play immediately with absolutely no buffering.  And I love the HD audio.

I tried this for a week and if taken as directed two hours before bedtime, it did seem to help me sleep.  However, in the morning I would wake up with a throbbing headache similar to what I feel when I don't drink my daily dose of coffee.  It does claim to neutralize caffeine, so perhaps this is what's causing the headaches.  I'm switching back to downing a shot of Jack Daniels before bedtime.  It tastes great and it's less filling.
I like this safe overall, but at 8 pounds it's rather heavy and at 10.1 x 11.3 x 3.4 inches it's large.  I prefer the GunVault NV100 NanoVault with Key Lock at one third the price.

Perhaps my expectations were too high.  My intention was to use this bulb as a luminary alarm clock.  After all, the iPhone application allows the user to schedule the bulb to come on at a specific time and day.  The problem is that the application doesn't remember the color you choose, it just slowly powers on the light with the default retina burning sterile white light I've come to loath.  Also, the light had a very annoying flicker during the 10 minute warm up period that almost put me into convulsions.  I assumed that since I had set the color to a very warm reddish orange that when the light came on it would still be that color.  Nope.With no use for the flashing color strobe function (I"m too old for ecstasy fueled RAVE parties) I'm not sure what to do with this until there are some major improvements to the application that drives it.  I'd use it as a standard white bulb, but as I mentioned earlier it's not a "warm white" light, it's very white and sterile and not enough lumens to light a room or even read under.Even though it's more expensive, I'm probably going to go with the HUE from Philips.

I wanted something more portable than a regular propane grill, and Q2200 is perfect!  I especially appreciate the fact that it uses the small propane tanks because it's so much easier to tailgate with this grill.  It uses standard disposable 14 or 16 oz LP gas bottles that you can purchase at your local Walmart, Target, or any store that carries camping or grilling supplies.

This is a complete assortment of bandages for virtually any minor wound one might have to deal with for an amazing price.  There is no need to buy name brand bandages, these are just as good as Band-Aid Brand from Johnson and Johnson for half the price.

I've been procrastinating for years about completing a will.  Luckily for my family, I've survived long enough to finally get it done.  Now I can safely die without worrying about my family cursing my name as they navigate the labyrinth of laws and regulations designed to allow the state and federal governments to confiscate what rightfully belongs to them.This kit made it very easy to complete an unambiguous will that will not only help secure the future of your loved ones, but also send a message.  To wit...To my son who thumbed his nose at the $45,000 a year full time job with benefits that I staked my personal reputation on to help him get, only so he could quit that job so he could bum his way across the country to pursue his dream as a "trimmer" on a marijuana farm - I leave a copy of my personal handbook - When Our Grown Kids Disappoint Us: Letting Go of Their Problems, Loving Them Anyway, and Getting on with Our Lives.To my ex-wife who refused to have to "deal with" full time work while I worked my ass off and dealt with stuff I didn't want to deal with day in and day out so you could live in a 4,200 square foot house in a town I despised, I leave...  wait a minute, you already got half of everything I worked for so we're good.The my friend Zach.  Remember that time I almost sank my boat searching for you in the ocean after your line broke while we were kitesurfing?  You can have all of my kitesurfing gear since you're too damn cheap to buy new gear even when yours is falling apart.To my wife Sharon, the rest is all yours.

Never used on of these before. Tried it today and it was HANDY. I also bought a rotary cutter (also a first for  me) to use on it. I'm a man and I don't sew.I bought this to help cut up old blue jeans to cut into 2 inch squares and make char cloth - the blackened cloth used to catch a spark from a flint and start a fire.In less than 20 minutes, I was able to cut enough cloth to take care of teaching 20 kids how to make a fire without matches this weekend. Locally, these things are getting harder to find. Nitrile gloves seem to be replacing the latex gloves.I love nitrile for their chemical resistance.
