I have NO idea what the balls this is advertised to be for, or how well it will work inflating them!I bought this as a fire starting bellows - only.It's light weight, fairly small and all one-piece, making it easy to pack and not even notice it's there. I prefer to use either a bow drill or flint to make camp fires. That requires blowing on an ember you create with one of those items. Camping at altitude (side of a bigger mountain), there are times you just don't have much spare breath for blowing on embers. Additionally, the air is shorter on oxygen. Exhale breath does contain oxygen, but also contains carbon dioxide (CO2) and carbon monoxide (CO). This pump, in addition to saving breath, produces an air stream with a MUCH higher oxygen content and only the CO2 and CO from the atmosphere. That makes the ember grow hotter faster and gets a fire started much quicker.In addition to starting a fire, it will be great for re-starting banked fires from remaining coals. Just put fresh kindling on the coals and pump away.This would also be good for those with bad joints that keep them form kneeling down for blowing on embers/coals. Might want put a thin tube, secured with a small radiator style clamp) to extend the range if you have bad joints.

What can you say about a dust pan?Handle seems the least considered part of the design, but, dust doesn't weigh much and you won't be holding it long. It's not uncomfortable to hold, just seems a tad flimsy.The material appears to be just rigid enough without seeming to be brittle and not at all floppy. Non-porous so washing won't hurt it (removal of wet or damp residue). And, with all that, surprisingly light in weight.I've tried Rubbermaid in the past - too soft and seemed to draw puppy teeth like magnets, and some other brand (name not recalled) that was VERY stiff - cracked and broke. The old style metal ones I grew up with had a rubber blade where it met the floor - those always came off.This should last a good long time. I think for the workshop I'll stick with the all metal dustpan.

Not something I need often in South Texas - we just don't have the giant trees found elsewhere. Occasionally we do have to bring down a larger Oak tree due to Oak Decline (a ground bug that kills the trees) and some of those can be large enough to need this - especially if the wind is not quite right for the direction you need to fell the tree.If you have little experience cutting down trees, plastic is the ONLY option for a felling wedge. Metal wedges are for splitting; they are narrower. I have used an axe or an old axe head (wider) but plastic will not kill your chainsaw blade if you hit it.I first tried getting the Husky set of three wedges, but the shipper never sent them. At least this shipper wants to sell their product.If you never cut anything larger than about 15 inches in diameter, It's likely you will never need this. Over 20-25 inches? Get them. You won't need them all the time but when you do...

I have bad knees so bending down on all fours to blow on an ember is NOT an option. But, if you don't have physical conditions like that, I could not recommend this to you.The air coming from the small end is just about perfect for blowing on an ember; enough to put good air pressure on it but not so much it will blow the ember away.So, if you like the idea and want it, go ahead and buy it. Keep in mind it is small and would be easy to misplace or even fall out of a shirt pocket.If you want one and wish to save the money, it may be possible to get an extendable pocket magnet, cut the ends off and use that. They are thinner than this item and would not produce the same air flow. You would also need to use a tube cutter to cut the ends off to avoid rough edges.Update:25 Aug 15I tried making my own from an extendable magnet from the harbor store. It was on sale for less than $5.The top (pocket clip) came off by removing a screw. I put the screw back in, part way, grabbed it with pliers and pulled out the threaded portion.I used a hacksaw to remove the lower end (solid), and discovered it was still solid. I removed about two, or more, inches from the bottom and that part was hollow.It worked - but I wouldn't recommend it.First, the lower section will go fully inside the collapsed unit. That is not a problem with the Epiphany Pocket Bellow. I have not tried to push it all the way inside (harbor store homemade model) to see how easy it is to get it back out.Second, there is a light odor of lubricant inside the homemade unit. I suspect it's to make it easier to extend because the unit is stainless steel and won't rust. No idea of the toxicity of the lubricant, but made in China so I would be leery of inhaling much of it or getting it into my mouth.Third, it is much thinner than the Epiphany model, thus easier to lose.Forth, my biggest concern remains with the short thinnest end. I suspect getting it stuck inside the rest (on the homemade model) presents the largest problem. For all I know, you could just give it a good shake and it would slide out - again, not gonna risk it.If you just want to go cheap, roll up a sheet of paper and blow through that. Yes, making your own from an antenna or extendable magnet IS possible, but not recommended. Neither is intended to be put into your mouth so toxicity should be a concern.I don't carry large sheets of paper or magazines when I'm camping, so for me, rolling up paper is not an option. I'll stay with the Epiphany.

I think $16 is a bit pricy for this item... a stick works well but would be more bulky with 100 feet of line.For me, the selling point was the replaceable razor blade. I generally carry at least one knife with me all the time. Camping, I take several - pocket knife, Swiss Army knife, Buck hunting knife, machete, axe and I have a knife in the glove box of the car. That being said, you just can't beat having a knife right where you store the line that needs cutting! Just unwind, slice and you are done.Lazy? Nope. I've been in situations when a sudden storm came up and putting up a shelter quickly was a must. A sleet storm is the worst but just plain rain is bad enough. With several lines needing cutting, the seconds saved easily adds up to minutes and I would rather have those minutes OUT of the storm than in it.

This did not work on opening the box, fooled with it and pried the positive contact up a bit and it works perfectly - a slight manufacture flaw, easily corrected.This is the second of this type item I've ordered. The first also didn't work but soldered a wire just behind the light circuit and got it to work... but it only lasted a short while. Never got that one working again.This one has a different design and the problems found in the first item (different shipper) are just not possible with this light.The light on this item is surprisingly bright. With LED bulbs, battery life should be good.

Simple design, good and strong (1/2 inch steel plate), small and easy to store. Works with my tractor or a jack. Fits right in the tool box on my tractor so it's always handy (the bucket on the front end loader is one handy tool hauler when working fence and the tractor itself is a really great fence stretcher!).No front end loader? Use your 3 point hitch - I'm sure you have something you can hang a chain from that fits on that... box blade, trailer hitch attachment, quick attachment, boom, etc.No tractor? Any bumper type jack will work just fine.I have a fine T-post puller, the type with a stand, push down on a long lever. It's large, requires a stand (piece of lumber) for soft ground, requires much more storage space and often gets buried behind stuff in the shed. Yes, it works, but requires more effort and a lot more time and it won't pull mangled T-posts. I had a storm knock down a big limb from an oak tree that mangled two T-posts. The Speeco puller pulled them out, no trouble... and, since it was in the tractor's tool box, I didn't have to go back to find something else to use.Strong, easy to use and less than half the price of my old T-post puller - if I ever get rid of it, it's because I lost it.

The cutting ability of this item is similar to a Knipex 7101200 8-Inch Mini-Bolt Cutter. I've had one of those for several years for installing and repairing fencing (field and barbed wire), I've had them for about 8 years and they still work great. I paid $55 for them locally - on Amazon they have them for $43.89.I paid $8.18 for the Tekton. If you are buying for an occasional usage, one time fence install or have people you supply with tools that don't take care of or lose them, BUY THESE instead!I will have no trouble at all buying or recommending these again.I only used them for one afternoon of fence repair so I can't speak to durability of these cutters, but the edges still look factory fresh. I was cutting wire on field fence and the double strands of barbed wire (to go along the top of the field fence). Field fence has much thicker (and tougher) wire for the top and bottom run of wire. Regular wire cutters will cut the little wires on field fence but not the top and bottom wires.If you are used to tugging, wiggling while cutting or pulling with wire cutters, DO NOT do that with these. These are NOT wire cutters. They are mini-bolt cutters. They are treated to be extra hard so they can cut through tougher stuff than coat hangers. But extra hard means extra brittle so they can break from mistreatment. The WILL NOT break from regular cutting.I've also cut nails, screws and small bolts with this item to make sure it would do it. For me, if it will fit to the back of the jaws, it will cut. I did not try to cut any special metals like trailer deck screws, self taping screws or any odd alloys or non-steel items. I would have tried but nothing I had on hand would fit into the jaws. For $8.18 I was ready to risk it, but not drive into town to find and buy it just to test.
super cool shirt.  head and neck hole is small for my head, lol but that's not surprising. it'll prob be a bit more form fitting after I shrink it some. love it though, thanks.
love this conditioner.  used to buy at Sally's but found it on here

it was cute, but I returned it for a few reasons.  first, I'm 105lbs, 5'4, 32/26/32, Ccup, and ordered a size 2.  it was slightly too big.  I needed a 0.  secondly, it has the clips all the way up the dress, and they tend to come undone quite easily, like when you bend over, etc, so that was slightly annoying.  I was surprised how well it fit my tiny curves though.  tight in all the right places.  cute neckline, too.  however, it flared out quite a bit.. like almost too much.  it's also a denim like material.  I didn't expect that but it was comfortable and probably wouldn't wrinkle easily.  had it not flared out so much, I probably would have exchanged it for the 0, but I wasn't happy with how much flare it had.  still cute though and other people may be very happy with it.  I have no idea how the MSRP price is $275 lol but whatever.

very cool. I don't know if I could use this in public, as I would probably come off as fairly pretentious, but it's great in private. My hands don't smell like cigarettes as much and it keeps smoke out of my eyes. However, I have noticed it does burn cigarettes down much faster. Oh well. I like it very much.

I didn't realize this was going to be comical looking. This is something for a hollowing costume only. You probably can smoke out of it, but the carcinogens from the plastic would probably kill you faster than the cigarettes. thankfully, I ordered a real smoking pipe, The "Jackie Kennedy" (almost $20) and that's much smaller, about 6 inches, and looks normal and is actually safety smoke out of.  Unlike this ridiculous baton looking thing

cute, but I'm not sure if I was sent the correct size. I ordered 4-6 but tag said 8-10. I was able to shrink it some and now it looks pretty cute. I'm 105 lbs, 5'4, 32/26/32, Ccup, and whatever size I was sent I am pretty happy with. definitely  worth the price!! pretty fast shipping too. only ~2 weeks

okay, these shoes are very cute.. BUT.. first, I was sent a 6 instead of 9, but that's forgivable and not to big deal as I bought it on prime, so I exchanged for a 9.the 9 came and they were really tight. I mean, realllly tight.  I had to walk around with thick socks on for about one hour to get them to open up a little bit, but I was still literally losing circulation in my toes... and I've never bought shoes over a size 9. In any brand. I am an 8.5 to 9.  these were tight, but not that bad, except the toe area..  my toes were so confined and my poor toes were totally squished. And I am not a big girl, I weigh 105 pounds and have pretty narrow feet.if that wasn't bad enough, the glue where the shoes were put together turned yellow, being visible through all the little holes on the sides. Had they been more comfortable, I wouldn't have let the little spots bother me because they were so tiny and barely noticeable, but like I said, they were entirely too small, especially in the toe area, and a size 10 prob would be too big.

I was so close to keeping this dress. it's really really pretty.  however, something about it I wasn't crazy about, and as much as I shop, lol I only keep things I realllllly like.  the sparkle was much more subtle than the pic implies, which is good.  but strangely enough, the small was kind of tight.  I buy a lot from sourpuss. smalls are typically a tiny bit big. I'm only 105lbs, 5'4, 32/26/32, Ccup. you have to either step into the dress or pull it over you, and there wasn't much room to get my arms through. That was a bit of an ordeal. The main reason I returned it was because of how it looked under the arms. It almost look like it was pulling, perhaps because of my bust, not sure. but it wasn't normal looking, and honestly, the stitching under the armholes wasn't even.  cute dress, great price, I just have so many black dresses that I wasn't going to keep one I wasn't crazy about.

got this for my boyfriends bday next month.  he already saw a pic of the hat and is super stoked.  it appears to be perfect. If there are any issues I'll update but so far so good. Super fast shipping too. Thank you very much

just as pictured, except obviously black, and not brown as it appears.  it's 22" long, so it's fine if you're on the shorter side.. personally, I like longer shirts.  but anyway, super fast shipping (2 weeks to USA), and I'm quite pleased.  thank you.  I ordered the XS and I'm 105, 5'4, 32/26/32, Ccup and it's not tight at all.The only reason I deducted a star, is because the designs are very annoying. I guess I assumed they would be superimposed or some form of press on design, I don't knowâ€¦ But I did not expect them to be big uncomfortable patches.  they are heavy, too. Because of that, I would return the shirt, but it's not worth the cost of sending back to the UK. I just wanted to mention that, in case someone else was wondering.  they really make the shirt difficult to wear comfortably.

ahh I love it!! it's a thicker tee shirt material, and looks exactly as advertised.  even the length.  that was my only fear.  I very much dislike shorter shirts. the small I ordered is exactly 23".  Falls right below my hips. I only deducted a star because I am 5'4, 105, 32/26/32 Ccup and wear smalls, if not extra smalls, in literally everything.  this small fits well, but is a little tight under my arms.  I probably could've gone with the medium.  still, I am very pleased and very happy. It made it to the United States in about two weeks, if that. Great purchase, and I'm very satisfied :) thanks !!
simply beautiful. I love the little bowties on the side. Thank you so much
beautiful very beautiful thanks
so easy to apply you can use a hair straightener!! love these and others from this seller :)

I love these iron one from this seller. I'm fond of these, the diamond, and the heart outlines. I put them on solid color matching clothing on the bottom or top area.. usually on the front by the breast where a logo would go, or on the back near the bottoms on either side.  makes a boring black shirt look a) adorable b) name brand something, and c) moreexpensive.  lol my little secret.  and you don't need an iron.  i actually use a straightening iron on 375° for ten seconds in each spot.  I check often because I do not want to ruin the fabric.. but I iron as thoroughly as possible.  be careful how much you wash and dry something with these on, eventually the heat will warp them due to the glue becoming viscous and mailable again..  anyway, love these !! keep them stocked !!

I really reallllly like these shoes. I'm getting older (31) lol, so I'm trying to find more age appropriate shoes for special occasions. problem is, I LOATHE heels.  I can wear them, but that doesn't mean I want to or am willing to. I do not want to end up with bunions and frankly, I would rather not torture myself for the sake of shoes. so yeah, I wear flats. I have two pairs of kitten heels from Rocket Dog that are not even 1", and I adore those. these heels are exactly 2.5", and I have worn them all day and they have not caused any pain whatsoever â€“ like higher pumps would.anyway, they fit exactly as expected, so I'm very happy with the shoes. It took me a while to get them. first pair got lost in transit and still has yet to show up, second pair I will set a size 6 instead of a 9 (okay that one is an easy mistake lol), but finally, the correct size has arrived and I am beyond pleased. I walked around with heavy socks on with these for about an hour to break them in, and now they feel great.
it was very nicely made and fit perfectly, it was just much larger than I had imagined so I had to return it. It's still a great belt though. oh I'm 32/26/32 and the small/petite was perfect.
perfect for my size. I'm 5'4, 105, 32/26/32, Ccup and this fits like a charm. also have it in black and red.
i'm really surprised and happy these fit the way they did. I have a teeny tiny booty, and this makes it look so cute lol. I'm 5'4, 105, 32/26/32 Ccup and the smalls were perfect

I'm 5'4, 105 lbs, and these are definitely thigh highs. They are rather tight, too, so I would only recommend these to people with thin or skinny little chicken legs. Seriously. Otherwise the cats face will end up distorted and warped and probably give your thighs a muffin top. I love them though.

my blonde color has completely grown and faded out, so basically it's a mousy brown color. no red hues, just a very "dirty blonde". well, I had no idea which color to chose bc I'm perfectly aware that they aren't going to be the exact color as on a computer screen. I ordered two colors that both just so happened to be on prime, and only one came close. the "medium brown"- that had red hues.. almost an alburn color. but much too dark. no light strands at all.  it's for deep, dark, brownish-red hair.  then I tried "chesnut brown".. never would I call my color chesnut brown, but that matches pretty damn well. it's actually a shade too light, but it blends with my old highlights at the bottom.I'm not using these to lengthen my whole head.. just growing out an angle home hack job lol. these really help. I have thin hair anyway so their thinness isn't an issue. I just put them under my hair on the sides to equal it out with the rest of my hair. oh, for my whole head id probably need two. they aren't really sewn on the clips with too much care. they are kinda bumpy. also, I find sometimes the clips are tricky to close. compared to others I've tried. not bad for $25 at all though. they also tolerate quite a bit of heat. I've accidentally used my regular setting on my straightening iron and they did not fry.  I've sprayed them with heat protector and dry shampoo, because I don't really want to physically wash them unless I have to. all in all, I'm very happy I found them. I just wish the color would go on prime again so I could buy another set. I don't want to wait a month to get it from China only to find out it's a knockoff brand or the wrong color.  lol It definitely happens. hopefully by the time this set goes, because I'm only using half of the set at a time- I have the other half for another time, my hair should have grown out by then so I should not need more. Knock on wood ðŸ˜Šoh here's a picture of my natural hair color in case you were considering what color to buy.

this is exactly what I needed. I have a habit of smoking in bed, and cherries tend to go wherever they feel like, burning my sheets. So after buying a third set of sheets and the second duvet cover, I finally realized I needed one of these to put my "stuff" on so it doesn't fall over and burn my sheets.  lol I know, I'm a mess. but this helps.  it's the perfect size for a pack of cigarettes, a small ashtray, and "whatever else" you may need lol thanks !!

other than the color being off, I was pretty happy with this.  The weft was very heavy, but nothing I couldn't tolerate.  and yeah it does tangle rather easily, but it isrelatively natural looking for synthetic hair.  I would have kept it had it been the correct color.  I ordered "dark blonde", and was sent dark blonde, but the color, to me, is a very light blonde.  I have no idea how they can call that dark blonde.  I have like a mousy brown hair, almost ashy, with faded blonde highlights.. almost a light brown.. and this did not match at all.  Not even close.  my hair looked soooo dark next to this.  it was weird.  anyway, I want to try a light or medium brown; maybe one of them will be a better color for me.  matching hair color can be quite tedious, and I don't  want to be out all the money trying to find a match, so I tend to only buy the ones on prime.  that way I don't have to deal with the hassle of getting an approval and then having to pay to return fee.  also, since the only other color even close is dark brown, I don't think I'll be buying another one of these.  if they had a matching color I would probably try it.also, one weft doesn't go all the way around your head ear to ear.  it's basically just for length in the back.  I had bought two, which I would have attached closer to the hairline onthe sides, and have them meet in the middle in the back.  these are also super straight and can't be curled.  so unless you have super straight hair, this won't blend for you.like I said, had they had my correct color, I would try this weft again.  But I had to return the dark blonde because it was entirely too light for my haircolor.

it's pretty much exactly what i expected.. except slightly smaller.  it's almost exactly 15" wide (slightly wider), but BARELY 9" in height.  it clearly says ten inches.  and yeah, it's only one inch.  but it makes a big difference in a foot stool.  ideally, I'd like it to be around 13".  the bottoms of the screw-in legs have holes in them, so maybe I can find something to put on the ends to make it taller.  as far as the depth of the storage space, it's only 2.5". someone had commented that it was 3-4", but sadly, is not.  I'm still very happy with it, I just wish I had that extra inch in storage and in height.  what I wanted to put in it is ~3", so now that's not going to work.  there aren't many others on here on prime, and I refuse to buy something over $10 off prime bc somehow I always get screwed, so I'll probably keep this.  I guess I have a month to decide.it's not flimsy at all.  I actually think it is very nice construction.  Maybe some others were damaged in transit?  I can also stand on it without any issues, but I only weigh 100 lbs. other than the height issue, it's exactly what I wanted and matches the decor of my room very nicely.  I have all cherry oak finish, and my vanity stool has a very similar pattern. So it looks very nice in my room.  if I find another that is slightly taller, I may return this.  Otherwise, I will keep it because it is exactly what I wanted.also, some people have stated that they were missing a piece at the bottom of the stool legs.. piece (A).  The instructions are pretty clear, and when you open the box, the four legs are in a bag inside of the storage space.  The instructions called the legs part (A), and tell you to screw them into part (B), that is the seat of the stool. As far as I know, there are no parts missing that should be on the bottom of the legs.  what they sent me matches the picture exactly.  if I am missing something, I would really like it because this is a very short stool.

these are really cute, but I'm beyond annoyed trying to get the sizing for this company (seven til midnight) correct.  I'm only 100lbs, and have 32" hips and a small booty.  I'm pretty "skinny".  so first,  with a different style, I purchased a small (my normal size.. if not XS) and they were childlike small.  so I needed a medium. fine.  so then, I ordered these in a medium and they were huge.  they're a true medium.  I should have ordered the small size instead.  so basically, all the styles fit differently- which is why buying them on prime is best.  these were not on prime, but fortunately I can sew, so I cut them and sewed them back together to fit.these are cute, and true to size. I just wish the company would say consistent with the sizing.  oh, and you can't see the back.. they have a typical thong back.  no fancy ruffles or anything. they just meet at the top, resembling a "T".  very comfortable fabric, too.

I actually really like this bra.  I'm a 34C, most of the time, and this is a good fit.  I can't express in words quite how soft it is.  the whole cup itself is super soft and molds to your breasts.  also, I don't think it's thatttt padded.  many reviews have said how much padding there was, but in my opinion.. it's not that much.  but then again, my chest was significantly smaller before (34A), so I'm pretty used to super padded bras.  this is different.  it's not stiff at all, and the molding is very soft and gel like.. and only at the bottom.  it's very nice.  many bras stick out in the side, but not this one.  it's also very very smooth under tight t-shirts.  I'm almost positive I'm going to keep this; I'm very happy with it.  I bought it on sale for $13, so it was a great price.

I got it for my boyfriend for his old iPhone. He loves it.  It's a snap-on hard case, and just a sticker for the pizza graphic. However, it is a very well applied and well adhered sticker.  I tried to lift it up with my nails to see if it would just peel off, but I had a hard time raising the edges at all. It's pretty much on there.  then there appears to be a glossy finish so it shouldn't wear off.  it does not protect the screen at all, so it's pretty much for decoration. This should not be considered protection for your phone.  still very cool.  I'm happy he's happy.

awesome lighter.  I was really surprised how mailable and flexible to the wand was.  you can bend it literally to any angle you need.  it's really a good find.  I dare you to not be able to light something with this.  no matter how hidden or difficult the wick or whatever is.  lol this is pretty amazing

awesome.  especially for the price.  takes about half hour to assemble, and isn't difficult at all.  the directions aren't very clear, but it's pretty obvious how it goes together.  a 10 year old could probably do it.  anyway, the legs are solid wood, but the desk is another form of wood.  I have no idea what it's called.  is wood, just not solid.  it's very lovely though.  I wish the mirror was two sided or lighted, but that's okay.  I can fix that myself.one thing worth mentioning is to be very careful with the wood.  it's very soft and scratches very easily.  I accidentally hit one of the legs into the desktop during assembly and it left a nic.  fortunately I have wood markers.  other than that it's perfect.. exactly what I wanted and expected.

I'm having trouble with the sizing for this company.  I'm only 5'5 and 100lbs (and basically no booty) and for many styles I've actually needed a M, when I'm always an XS with any other brand.  The styles I have bought before, the small is comically small.  so I ordered these in a medium, and they were too big.  a small would have been much better.  so this style i would say is true to size.  get what you normally wear.  they're cute, but what the picture doesn't show you is that it has a border of lace that goes around the legs and thighs.  it's also a thong.  It's pretty, but they were much too big so it looked awkward.  I returned them bc they were too big.  had they fit, I probably would've kept them because they are very girly and pretty.  not my favorite style, but definitely very cute.

These curtains are great at blocking out light and providing privacy which was my only real concern other than appearance. I like how they look. The color is maybe a tiny shade lighter and more chocolate-y brown than what I see in the ad on my computer--the beige is very close to what I see.  These do not look or feel cheap or flimsy.  I feel the product is as advertised--and really nice looking.
I like the 5% discount and can pay online easily.  My only gripe is that I wish I could use it for Kindle ebook purchases.  I make a lot of those!

I love this TV. Great picture, nice big size.  I have to say that I am not knowledgeable about Smart TVs.  I called my cable provider (Time Warner) to come and hook this up.  It went smoothly and I am happy with the results.  In addition to cable I have wifi at home through the same provider and that works fine with this TV.  I am completely satisfied but as I said I do have cable and I did get the company to connect this TV.Two things to be aware of--you need to have Internet at home to use this on the Internet.  In other words, build in wifi is kind of a misnomer--it only means this will connect up with the wifi you have.  Also--be aware the 50 inch measurement is diagonal--it's 44 inches across (as advertised).Looking for a complaint--I had trouble finding the remote the way it was stuck in the packing.  Don't throw anything away until you find everything that is supposed to come with the TV.  There is a stand in there by the way.To sum up--great smart TV!

I love historical fiction and I know this is by a highly esteemed novelist. It is obviously well-written and contains beautifully described historical detail.  It just did not draw me in as much as I hoped it would,  I did not care that much about the characters.  There are many paragraphs in which events are summarized, a coolness and sense of distance in the style.  I learned things I did not know about the Spanish invasion of the Inca empire, so the reading was a worthwhile experience, but I can't say I much enjoyed the book.

The ancient world comes to life in this story of Cleopatraâ€™s two sisters, Arsinoe, still a small girl, and Berenice, a young woman who has overthrown their father and seized the throne of Egypt.  Arsinoe has reason to fear Bereniceâ€”as a half sibling she poses a possible threat and Bereniceâ€™s best move might be to murder her.  And Berenice also has reason to fearâ€”can she keep her throne, and fend off the Romans and her father?  The story goes from one sisterâ€™s third person point of view to the other's.  Arsinoe is the more immediately sympathetic character, but we come to sympathize with Berenice too, as she struggles to overcome her softer side and survive as queen.Cleopatra herself, eleven at the start of the story, is off stage through almost all of it, but sister Arsinoe adores her.  We do get a sense of her family background and of the dangerous world she lived in.I know how this story ultimately ends but found I was caught up in it just the same.  The palpable sense of danger carried me along.  The authorâ€™s prose vividly evokes the ancient world.  I am looking forward to a promised sequel that will carry forward the story of this family.

I found this book profoundly upsetting and have put off reviewing it, wondering if I even ought to.  It is a cry of pain about the history of black oppression in the U.S.  There is wonderful, painful evocative writing here.Iâ€™m coming to this book as the daughter and niece of NYC firefighters, who happens to live in NYC a half hourâ€™s brisk walk away from the site of what was the world trade center.  Twelve men from my local fire house died on 9/11, trying to save others.  The deriding here of what the author refers to as the firefighters â€œmachismoâ€ on 9/11â€¦what can I say about it?  That there is a great difference between machismo and heroismâ€”isnâ€™t that obvious? What can I say of his statement that both the police and the firefighters who perished on 9/11 to him were the fire?  I am struck by the fact that this author does not bother to distinguish between police and firefighters who after all have very different jobs (who is threatened by firefighters?).  He writes about these human beings but does not look very closely at them, it seems.  I hope he is never in a burning building, never has to understand viscerally the difference between firefighters and fire.Coates says he feels that firefighters are the same as fire.  Because he feels all whites endanger him?  (Many firefighters, by the way, are not white.)  He has the right to feel anyway he wishes.  But I was expecting something more from this author, something more akin to considered social analysis.  My major point:  there are distinctions this author does not make, is apparently blind to.He negates the fact that we have an African American president.  In his view, itâ€™s still pretty much the same here in America as it was in 1776.  When blacks were slaves.Read this book as a brilliantly written cry of despair.  Not as reasoned social analysis.

This works as advertised.  I have found it to be effective cleaning my hard wood floors.  I like the fact that unlike a vacuum that I've used to sweep up it requires no electricity, no cord or charging, makes no noise as a vacuum does, and that the starter kit is so inexpensive. It is easy to assemble and easy to use.  It certainly saves labor as compared to a regular broom and mop.  I might substitute reusable clothes for buying the cloths provided which seem relatively expensive but it would be easy to attach any small piece of cloth and use that.

This dissolves very quickly in liquid or soft food like yogurt.  It does make you feel more full than you would otherwise.  It is tasteless.  Be aware it does have some calories--30 a tablespoon.  If your problem staying on a diet is feeling physically hungry rather than wanting the wrong high calorie foods then this is worth a try.  It is convenient and handy to use.  An alternative of course would be to eat low calorie veggies to fill you up.  I'm giving this five stars because it does exactly what is says--not sure it would be the best cost-effective aide to most people on diets.

I never cared much about any of the characters. They were self-absorbed, privileged people and the author never gave me a reason to root for any one of them. The love affair between Georgia and the professor who is eventually suspected of murder was coolly described.  Really, there is never a point in this where the reader is in a character's skin and feels emotionally invested.  Despite the central role of a murder there was no sense of fear or real suspense.  On the plus side were some interesting enough character studies and good description of the Harvard milieu--not enough to make this novel truly rewarding.

It is rare when I like an author's first novel as much as I liked S.J. Watson's BEFORE I GO TO SLEEP and really don't like the second one. But I was never able to get into this book. I read it with full attention up to page 75 and was bored, did not care about the characters.  There was a lot of talking and ruminating about the protagonist's sister having been murdered, but I never felt involved with the story.  I skimmed a lot of the rest of the book.  The immediacy and the suspense and feeling of a life at stake that made BEFORE I GO TO SLEEP riveting was absent throughout as far as I can see.  The writing is highly literate--thus the two stars rather than 1.  I will be looking for this novelist's next book--hope it is like the first one.

Bottom line--this arrived from Amazon in good shape and it works.Good--Small size, easy to carryComes with functional Office 365I'm a professional writer, it gave me all I really needed to do my work in Word which for me is the main thingGreat priceNot so good--I found the mouse occasionally a awkward to use--keep having to click things twice instead of once and have difficulty at times scrolling onlineI miss having the home key with WordIt cam be a little slow surfing the netOverall, I am glad I bought this.

I enjoyed this book very much and read it very quickly.  A woman in her late thirties who hasnâ€™t had the courage to stand up for herself suddenly breaks outâ€”curses an antagonist at a PTO meeting and then decides to go off and confront the woman who was her best friend in his school, her teenage daughter in tow.  The friend rejected her in a particularly nasty way and Caroline the main character traces her shaky self-image back to that moment of betrayal.I was at the edge of my seat wondering how this confrontation would go, though I have to admit I sort of knew.  (Question:  Do you imagine the betraying friend is now a content human being?)  The thing is Caroline has a good lifeâ€”a really nice husband, an okay career as a photographer.  Admittedly she hasnâ€™t been as forceful as she might have been in many areas, including going after career advancement.  But sheâ€™s not bad off.  She was shy and awkward before her friend hurt herâ€”why does she think that event changed her trajectory as a person?  Well, there are other early life events she gets more in touch with.  But there is a fundamental lightness to this story which Iâ€™m sort of ambivalent about.  This could have been a deeper book.I feel the author wanted me to like Carolineâ€™s teenage daughter more than I did.  She was just too take-charge for my taste.  I wanted Caroline to show more strength interacting with her. The continual strength transfusion from the daughter and her frequent mouthing off annoyed me a bit at times.All in all, this was not quite a five star read for me.  Still, it was engaging and kept me turning the pages.

Okay, you have to spend a little time putting this together.  Not too bad, pretty clear instructions.  Then you need to supply 4 AA batteries and you have to replace the disposable pads pretty frequently.  You also have to replace the cleaning fluid which does not come in such a large container.  If you really like gadgets and really like spending money you may like this product a lot.  It does work and clean the floor.  So does a mop with a lot less hassle and expense.  I'll take a mop.

On the plus side this fits my small HP Stream laptop really well and I can open the laptop and work without taking it out of the case.  On the minus side there is a lack of bells and whistles.  There's a little transparent compartment where you can slip in identifying info and have it show.  There are these little handles you see shown in the picture here on Amazon.  That is all there is.  Air protect?  Maybe it works.  The case is sort of rippled but it is hard.  I would feel more confident if there was thick padding as I've seen elsewhere.  There is no shoulder strap, which I would really like.  There are no compartments for anything else but the laptop.  What you see here in the picture is what you get.

Great, tasty.  I reordered this from Amazon because I could not find it near my home.  Wonderful jalapeno taste and a little goes a long way.  Wonderful on vegetables and I love it on peanuts and avocados, as well as on meat.

Several years ago, I needed to teach myself Excel and Access.  I turned to this Teach Yourself Visually series of books.  It didnâ€™t teach me everything about these two programs, but it sure got me started.  The bright pictures of the screens were the perfect learning tool for me.  Iâ€™ve been using an Android tablet and recently broke down and started using a smart phone, also an Android but from another company.  A lot of what I needed to know to use them was intuitive but some wasnâ€™t.  My friends seemed to be making better use of their smartphone in particular than I was.  So I grabbed this book. I like it very much.This book would be good for a complete newbie or someone like me who knows the basic but has gaps in their knowledge.  It will show you you're way around the icons and screens, how to find settings, how to make a call--very elementary things.  It answers more advanced questions like: Whatâ€™s the easiest way to share a video?  How do you backup the info on your phone? Depending on what your device is your screens may look a little different from what is presented here, but with two devices from different companies I had no trouble following alongâ€”theyâ€™re both Androids.  To sum up, this is a very easy way to learn what you donâ€™t know about using Android phones or tablets.  I recommend it.

This is really a great pair of scissors.  I happen to have a problem with my right hand which makes it hard to exert much pressure using scissors and I have had trouble using them.  Really, truly, not with these.  They are very sharp and I was able to cut both cardboard and paper with remarkable ease.  Even cut cloth. They worked fine in both my right and left hand (I'm right-handed).  There is nothing to indicate "recycled handles" about the scissors themselves.  They seem very new and very sturdy. I am really thrilled.  The price seems low compared to other scissors I have found did not work well for me.  To put it mildly I recommend this product.

I loved this book.  It grabbed me from the first page and I had trouble putting it down.  It was terrifying.  A couple of thirty-somethings, believable and decent people next door, go on a rail journey through Europe before settling down to have a family.  If you have ever been frightened of losing your tickets or passport in a country where you don't speak the language you will empathize with their initial conundrum when they are robbed while asleep on a train in Romania of all places.  They wind up lost in a forest in Dracula country and from that point on their situation only gets more scary.  The deft plot twists keep coming, and the story does not let you go, all the way to the super surprise ending.  This is a compelling novel by an extremely talented author, hugely entertaining and brilliantly written.  Highly recommended!

This book is about how Dr. William Petit managed to survive and start a new life after his family was the victim of a horrendous crime--his wife and two daughters tortured and murdered.  It is a hymn to his resilience and worth reading for that. The author does not tell us much about the two murderers and actually avoids describing the murders themselves in detail.  Dr. Petit obviously has every right to feel whatever he chooses to.  But the author's disinterest in what shaped and motivated the killers put me off, along with what I took to be his lauding of the death penalty verdict in this case.  Dr. Petit asks at what point what the murderers' early abuse has to do with his family.  He campaigned for the death penalty.  As I said, he has the right.  But the author seems to echo his views without examining them or bringing any insights of his own.  Still I would recommend this book--it is an amazing story of psychological survival.

This is a novel for political junkies.  It is really a lightly fictionalized take on history--that is of the Reagan years.  We go into the minds of a large cast of characters--Reagan, Nancy, Nixon, Kissinger, etc., etc.--and get to know them warts and all.  If you were around during these years or know your history, of course there's minimal suspense about how things turn out, yet this novel holds the reader's interest, or at least it did mine.  I am not a great Reagan fan, but  I have to say I found the last scene very moving. It's good to recall the wall did come down.

These work. I particularly recommend them for people like me who are not so good with hammer and nail.  I've used these to hold small, framed pictures up and had no problem once I understood the directions (which are clear). Be aware that the weight limit per hanger is 3 lbs.

What I liked--This is attractive looking, has calendars with ample space to write in for each date, as well as a separate space to list daily appointments.  Hard-backed and well-made, not flimsy, this should last the year very easily.  The paper seems to be a good grade.What I liked less--It weighs a pound.  There are lighter weight smaller planners I might find more convenient to carry.The appointment spaces go from 7AM to 6 AM. I am a freelancer and not a morning person so this is not ideal.Maybe not the best thing for me, but a good product overall.

Okay, I'm a woman but I was tempted by the description of the scent and I wanted to try it.  It is really very nice--not an overpowering scent at all.  A particularly masculine scent?  I would say it is more unisex.  Smells sort of like talcum powder, subtly, once you dry off from your shower.  It is a pleasant effective body wash to use.  For the amount you get it seems pricey to me, however.  But it comes in a nice masculine looking bottle and I could see this making a nice little gift to a man.

This works great. It's like taking a little pack of energy with you when you will be outdoors or traveling in places where you won't find the usual places to charge your cell phone.  It is lightweight as advertised--as advertised in all respects.  With my lifestyle I won't need this a lot but once in a while it will be really handy to have.

I find that this works great for legs and underarms and stays charged for well over a half hour.  It came partly charged so I could use it right away. I used gel with it.  My only criticism--not enough to take off a point--is that the diagram of how it goes in the charger stand is very small and sort of hard to find in the directions, so I was a little puzzled at first.  It worked fine for me, no nicks.  The pink color is attractive and it has a solid feel--light enough in the hand but you have the sense it won't break easily.

I have only used this so far for practice in a pool but see it as a wonderful thing to have when I travel and actually snorkel. It works--I breathe easily under water wearing it.  The main thing however is that it is extremely comfortable--slips on my head and seals without my feeling uncomfortable pressure.  I did not even have to adjust it though the strap is adjustable.  I am really sensitive to uncomfortable masks, have tossed several.  This one feels great.  It is a good size, provides good coverage and looks just as advertised.

I was an avid fan of Shirley Jackson many years ago, thought I had read everything she wrote, but evidently not.  I was thrilled by this new collection. There are short stories, essays about being a mother, and reflections on writing. Some oft he stories like Paranoia are excellent. I would not say any of this is up to Jackson's very best work--nothing to equal her classic story The Lottery or her novel The Haunting of Hill House.  Yet it was a joy to read.  Some of it is dated and gives a sense of how far we have traveled since Jackson's too early death in the early 1960's.  I enjoyed even that aspect of these stories--as I do watching old Twilight Zone episodes.  These works were definitely worth publishing.

What made this book for me were the characters.  Despite the story being narrated in the voice of an autistic man, I felt I had a good sense of who the main characters were, and I grew to care about them.  This was particularly true of the protagonist himself, Todd, who is likable and sensitive.  He grasps essential things about people and about the nature of love, even though he can't full express himself.  The author gives him an original viewpoint,  Some of the descriptions are marvelously fresh.  I believed throughout that I was looking at the world as Todd saw it.  While regrettable things happen, the book is inspiring and affirmative rather than depressing, which to me is a plus.  Todd struggles with difficulties that would realistically confront a fiftyish autistic person in a supervised living situation--a hostile roommate, a new staff member who gives him bad vibes.  We wonder is he will finally get to visit his brother's family and if he will find a girlfriend, and root for him all the way.I was captivated throughout and highly recommend this book.

This is a beautifully written book--the use of language is exquisite. However the pacing dragged for me at times.  It is told in two voices, that of an 18-year-old murder victim and that of the mother of one of her classmates. The mother had befriended the girl.  I found the dead girl's part of the book, ala THE LOVELY BONES far more involving than the rest.  Perhaps that was because Kate, the mother, lacks a compelling reason for solving the murder.  I really wanted and expected a suspenseful whodunit and found myself skipping pages to get to something exciting. This story was quite moving however.  I'm torn between 4 and 3 stars.

This book held my interest but in the end I just didn't think the final twist was all that convincing.  The plot depends too much on a supposedly smart protagonist doing unlikely and irresponsible things. The plot depended on unlikely events.  I found the characters interesting, especially the two twins with contrasting temperaments.  The shifts in timeframe and point of view were a bit excessive--going into the head of a minor character named Angel seemed pointless.  It is well written and the pacing is good. But I was definitely looking for a climax with more impact and more of a believability factor.

This is a morally serious work that gives a good sense of the time and place, and of the tragedy of war.  At times however it was slow going for me and there were spots where the author had a tendency to show not tell.  For example, introducing an important character there is a third person narrative description of her as â€œsharp-tonguedâ€ and in another case a character is described as â€œhumorless.â€  A more experienced novelist might have shown us these traits, perhaps through dialogue.  I was not as involved with the characters or with the story as I would have liked to have been.  Still, the historical material did interest me a great deal.  I liked the fact that we were able to see World War I through the eyes of a German as well as through American eyes.  I do recommend this book.

I appreciate the fact that Sonia Choquette shares so much of herself in this book.  It takes courage to be vulnerable and, especially for someone who teaches spiritual principles to others, to be that open.  I felt this book was very honest and personal, and to read it was to encounter a flesh and blood human being.  The reflections on love and forgiveness are thought-provoking.  I liked that fact that nothing was sugar-coated.  Sometimes you get the impression from people involved in New Thought that life should be easy,  Not in this book.

This is a gentle electric tooth brush.  It definitely gets the teeth clean and does not irritate gums while doing it.  You need to charge it for 24 hours before using it the first time.  It works, charges with no hassle at all.  I really wish it came with an extra brush head--you get just one and you are supposed to replace it regularly.

I read this book in one day, because I was absolutely engrossed.  Hanna and her husband are attacked by intruders.  The husband dies, but Hanna, who survives head injuries, can't remember if her grown daughter and her boyfriend were the murderers.  All evidence seems to point to the boyfriend but there is a real question about whether the daughter was involved.  Is Hanna refusing to see the obvious?  Will she figure out what really happened in time to protect herself from another murder attempt?The novel asks us to examine the ways people deceive themselves, and how that leads to evil consequences.  It's a more psychologically sophisticated and reflective book than the usual thriller.  The characterization is deft.  The writing does not call attention to itself; it is clear, easy to read and direct but never insults your intelligence.Overall, I thought this book was excellent and really had trouble tearing myself away from it before I read the last page.  I wouldn't call it flawless--what book is?  Personally I flinch at any reference to cruelty to animals. That part wasn't graphic here, but it wasn't necessary in my opinion, and in a book I read to be entertained, I could do without it. The bit with the dog just left me feeling sad.  Also the ultimate answer to the central question comes not so much through the actions of the protagonist as through the breathtakingly stupid behavior of another person.  I don't want to give spoilers but I found that one plot point very hard to believe.  Hint:  It involves a newspaper article.My five star rating does not mean perfect.  It means despite my quibbles I consider this one of the best books of this genre I have read.

I had another more expensive model that I really liked and had no problem with.  This one was a pain to set up with the tiny buttons.  I did not find the instructions clear. To begin with they said that the battery was installed.  It wasn't.  I was able to install it pretty easily but from that point on found I had to struggle with the device.  On the positive side, once you finally get it working it does seem reasonably accurate.  The clip keeps it attached to my clothes.  Overall, I would not buy this at the price considering the initial pain in the neck.

There were some signs of mouse activity in my kitchen.  I used two of these repellers in the  kitchen 10 days ago and also put one in each of two adjoining rooms.  There have been no signs of mice since then.  Is this due to the repellers?  I suspect so.  I really hope these work because the only thing that has gotten rid of mice in the past is using traps.  I hate the cruelty involved.The repellers each have a small night light which stays  on all the time.  I don't mind this at all but I suppose some people would.  Each takes up a whole light plug.  Worth it to me if the mice stay gone!  The repellers are small and inconpicuous.  I have to say a good word for the packaging--very easy to open.

This product is exactly what it is advertised to be.  It sprays on quickly and dries quickly--much less messy than sunscreens you need to apply with your hand.  It has a faint pleasant scent--does not smell medicinal.  It stays on for a reasonable length of time.  I like the fact that there is not a cap you have to remove--you just turn it before you spray. Since there is a minimal time investment I am more likely to use this, which is a major plus for me, because I don't always use sunscreen when I really ought to.

This is very tasty on burgers and vegetables.  Also great on scrambled eggs.  Right now I am in love with the jalapeno taste and using this on a lot of dishes.  Luckily this seasoning has no calories.  It is intense and the taste does linger in the mouth but it isn't hot enough to burn you.Rather than overwhelming the taste of meat as ketchup would it seems to augment it and bring it out. More delicious than ketchup on burgers for sure!  I would definitely recommend this product--can see myself using it regularly.
This works well for what I am using it for--Word, Excel (neither program comes with it) and surfing the Internet.  For the low price, it is more than okay.  I wish it had come with a manual.

If you are a fan of the writings or PBS specials of Dr. Wayne Dyer you will probably like this book but not find much new in it. It tells a little about what it was like to be raised in a spiritual household, and Serena comes across as admiring her father without overly idealizing him.  She emphasizes that she and her parents and siblings are just people.  Generally, she reaffirms her father's ideas and after each chapter written by her there is a response written by him.  This is an uplifting but not terribly original book.

This clipper set replaced our older set which just also happened to be by Conair.  It lasted us for many years and I have high expectations for this new 2 in 1 clipper set.  It comes in its own case, and has everything you need for any home hair cut.  My boyfriend also uses it to shape his chops on the sides of his face.  The clipper itself is sturdy and seems well made.  We are very happy with these clippers.
Works great on a USB port or an adapter so you can plug it into the wall.  Nice long cord, quality product.  I have noticed the Belkin products are of very good quality.

I am loving this high chair.  I bought this for my grandson who is 8 months old.  This chair was very easy to put together, and I absolutely love that it can come apart and grow with the baby.  The bottom half, which is a table is a very good size for use when he gets older.  This chair seems well made and sturdy.  I am very happy with this purchase.

This is the cutest little set for any baby's first thanksgiving.  Carter's is a good name, with good quality clothes.  The outfit is very cute and the bib is great.  My family actually thought we should get these for all of us so we could all be this comfy after eating all that food!

These fit my son very well, they are a very nice looking work boot.  I would almost call them a casual boot, except for the steel toe.  The sole is very nice and sturdy and they seem to be well made.  We did buy inserts for these boots which helped to make them more wearable for the entire day rather than a couple hours.  Once they are fully broken in I would imagine they will be more comfortable.  They aren't bad, look nice and look well made.
These did not really work for me, but they are well made and very sticky.  A good quality item.

I paint in acrylics and watercolors, and am always on the lookout for good brushes. When I received this paint brush set, I immediately noticed what a nice, high quality case the brushes come in and every brush has the plastic head over the bristles to protect them. I really like the long handles for painting when I am standing up, which is most of the time.I started out by using the 3/0 and the 2/0 on a new painting, I wanted to post a picture here but didn't see that option, just so you could see the brush strokes.When I used these brushes I did not have even one stray hair come out of the brush, which has been common with some of the brushes I have used. These handles are wood and seem very sturdy and well made, the brushes are even and well made with no stray bristles coming out while you paint or at any other time. They clean easily and work well. These are some of the best paint brushes I have used. This set is nice enough to give as a gift, though I would have a hard time giving them away! I highly recommend this set and am enjoying them myself.

This toothpaste does what it says if you use it often.  I like that you can get a 2 pack here on amazon, but wish the tubes were larger.  Good for me because I drink a lot of coffee and tea, so brushing with this whitening paste really helps.

I am 49 years old and have some wrinkles around my eyes, so I thought I would try these pads.  I found that they work really well for me.  They really stay put on your face, I hung out my laundry and did other things while they were on.  After about 15 minutes the edges were dry, the package says to leave them on for 15-20 minutes, I took them off at around 17 minutes.  I could see where they did plump up the skin around my eyes, with the moisturizing properties.  I did what another reviewer did and did not wash my face after using these, just left that area alone.  It is a little sticky when you first remove the pads but that absorbs in and leaves soft skin.  I love them.

I love this tent.  It is very easy to set up and very portable.  I love the bright colors of the tent.  Other reviewers posted that it was to small but I use this tent for my 8 month old grandson and it is perfect.  He will be able to use this until he is to big for it, maybe around 5 or 6 years old.  It is a thin material, but is fine for an inside play tent.  Very cute and easy to use.

I bought these sheets for my new grandson - they look very nice right out of the package, they are soft and comfortable.  They are easy to use, wash and dry without shrinkage and are very soft.  Good quality sheets.
Very nice baby bumpers - soft, nice color, sewn well, good quality.  These also wash well and are a quick dry in the dryer.  Perfect baby bumpers.

These work great, just as well as any other safety glasses.  They look very cool with the shaded lenses rather than the regular clear lenses.  I catch my boyfriend also wearing these when he rides his motorcycle.  I would buy these again.

I am an acrylic painted and am painting on some very large canvas for a show.  I use gesso on my canvas before I begin painting and bought this brush for that purpose.  It works very well, it holds the paint well and can evenly distribute it without leaving lines, streaks or thick portions of paint on my canvas.  I only had a couple of stray hairs with the first use, which is normal with any new paintbrush.  Other than that, no stray hairs left on my canvas.  The long handle is great when you are painting something large.  I like this brush, and it worked well for my purpose.

This watch is very nice, beautifully made, with a nice band and face.  It is very large, and it is heavy.  It does look nice on a man, because of how large it is but can be a bit uncomfortable because of the size and the weight.  The watch is very good quality, does not look cheap and keeps time well.  The presentation is very nice, you could give this as a gift.

I love the pattern on these towels and the size of them.  They seem a bit cheap out of the package, or a bit stiff so I washed them before using.  They are not an absorbent towel, maybe could be used more for laying dishes to dry on or lettuce that you have washed could be laye don it to dry a bit.  I did not like them as a towel to dry my hands on after washing them,

This shirt is very well made, soft, and attractive.  The color is a very nice brown color.  When I first took this out of the bag, I thought it was a bit large for a size small.  I am thinking maybe (hopefully) after I wash and dry it once it will be more true to size.  I hope so because this is a very nice shirt.  This shirt can be dressed up or down, I can see it becoming a favorite.

This is a beautiful watch and really large.  It comes beautifully packaged, for a great gift giving presentation.  It has a very nice strap and the face of the watch is very nice.  It seems to be good quality, and works well.  I have to say this is one of the largest men's watches I have ever seen - but it really looks great on a mans wrist.

These are my new favorite yoga pants.  They are very well made, the material is a bit thicker than other yoga pants I have.  It is quite stretchy and feels comfortable.  The waistband is a fold over waistband that is comfortable and stays folded.  These are a nice boot cut style and look great with boots or sneakers around town.  They are very comfortable for bending over and stretching.

As I tried to post this review amazon kept asking me how it fit - this wallet was the size I was expecting.  It is very nice, though has a bit of a cheap plastic look to it that I hope over time will wear into a soft worn leather look.  This wallet is perfect to keep in a tote bag and just grab to run into a store or to do errands without having to take your whole tote bag.  It looks classy and is functional.  I really like it a lot.

I am using this texture paste on flat canvas to add depth and bumps to my artwork.  I am painting with acrylics on canvas and this texture paste accepts the paint very well and looks so great on my canvas.  I am very happy with this paste and will be buying more.

Great deal on a good name brand canvas.  Arrived in good condition, was well packaged so there was no damage.  Smooth canvas with no indents or irregularities.  I am painting with acrylics on this canvas and it works well.

These earrings are gorgeous!  They really look real and classy.  They are comfortable, fit well and are easy to put on.  No irritation on my ears and I receive many compliments when I wear them.  Would be a beautiful gift for someone.  They arrive in a beautiful velvet box.

I have come to find the American Baby Company has very good products.  I recently bought some sheets and did not realize they were American Baby Company, and then ordered crib bumpers that I now see are the same brand.  Everything I have ordered from this company is very good quality.  These crib bumpers are nice, they are well made with secure stitching.  They go into the crib easily and wash well.

We LOVE this gate.  We actually use it for my grandson rather than a dog but we love it.  It is all wood, and very well made.  It has hinges, and is expandable which is a huge plus in our house.  It folds up easily for storage and does not take up a lot of space.  It is easy to pass through and is sturdy.  We are very happy with this gate.

These a very good quality heavy duty wipes.  They are pretty thick and large and because of that you don't need as many to get a job cleaned up.  They smell nice, and stay moist.  These are great for a baby wipe and also for wiping off kids faces and hands, they work great.

I love this blanket, it is my new favorite winter blanket.  It is so soft, and thick and cozy.  I received the queen size and it is a very generous queen size.  The colors are beautiful, the stitching is well done and I think this blanket will last a very long time.  I have not put it in the dryer so don't know if it might shrink.

This seems to work really well.  My daughter in law did not want to use anything on her son's gums but tried this because it was natural.  She had only been using those teething rings you put in the freezer.  This quieted him down and everyone was able to get some sleep.

I had never heard of this game and thought it would be a great game to play with my adult children and friends.  My kids already knew about this game but they do love it.  A great way to spend an evening laughing with friends and family.  I would recommend this silly game to anyone.

My son really likes this, he said it is very good quality and was very happy to get this.  He is a part time photographer and always buying new lenses, this one was one he was very excited about.  He did say this is a smaller size lens that he may not use very often since he has a larger one he uses more often.  This does improve the quality of his photo's and is great for anyone with a  photography hobby.
It was a great book - I recommend it to anyone who enjoys an exciting story.

I have been using the Polar Loop and HRM for about 7 weeks now.  I've given it 4 stars because it works well.  First of all, don't be duped into buying the pads & gel.  You don't need it - it works fine without that stuff.  Also, initially I had difficulty getting my loop synced with the Bluetooth HRM.  I would put everything on and then try and retry to get the loop to pick up the signal from the HRM.  What I learned after trial and error is, put the HRM on first and after a moment, put on the loop. The first time you press the loop button it will greet you and automatically pick up the loop connection. Easy.  I believe the written instruction are weak and incomplete but as I said, the product is good despite the weak support.

David Slater was the most deadly assassin ever to come out of Israel.  He retired from Mossad and was living a quiet life in America under an assumed identity.  His wife of just six months is used as a pawn to force David into one last mission which he takes to protect her. The story takes several unexpected turns and is often a page turner.  Very exciting book - highly recommend it.
Battery does not last nearly as long as they indicated it would.  Maybe good for a week with daily use.

Wow! Can't believe it's over.  It is a thrilling read and very entertaining. I believe Sanderson is the best author I have read (My favorites include Vince Flynn, Daniel Silva, Ted Bell, Lee Child, Alex Berenson, David Baldacci, Brad Thor, John Sanford and more.)  My biggest, and only, disappointment was hat Sanderson hasn't written Book 3 as yet.  If you like excitement, if like a thrilling suspense, read the Stormlight Archive (two books so far).

Extremely well written.  What a talented author!  The story is a compilation of several characters that slowly develop and intersect.  I became more and more captivated as the story went on.  A great read and I am looking for book 2.
This was Brad Thor's worst novel.  Very little action.  The story paints a great big picture and then it just goes away.

$55,559.99  hmmmOn a side note, I bought a Kitchen Aide side by side refrigerator and it was defective.  Kitchen Aide REFUSED to replace it with another new refrigerator and insisted on refurbishing mine.  To make a long story sort, the retailer, from whom I purchased it, intervened and replaced it.  I will never by KA again - their customer service sucks.

The book starts out with tremendous action where the main character, officer Scott James, is severely wounded and his partner is killed by unknown gunmen. After recovering but still suffering from PTSD, the hero is assigned to the K-9 Division where he is matched up with a German Shepard, Maggie, who is also recovering from the traumatic loss of her military handler in Afghanistan. A very touching story unfolds as the two heroes become friends and eventually, pact members. The plot is further developed into a mystery as Scott begins to explore his case file with the cooperation of several new detectives who were assigned after the original team retired or moved on. The book can be a page turner and well worth the read.  Enjoy!

It was an easy read and, overall, it was enjoyable.  I would not describe it as a "thriller" and there was not much suspense.  If you are looking for "action", this is not the right book.  There is some action and there is plenty of "intrigue" but the story just seems to unfold as you work your way through.  I think the characters are very interesting but the roles they play in the story are a bit dull.
