It doesn't add a lot of bulk to the Kindle.Overall, my daughter really likes the way it feels and looks plus it's a little extra protection for her new Kindle.

My husband and I both really like these. My daughter says she would prefer the plain graham crackers over these. We all agree that these are the best gluten free graham crackers that we've had thus far.These gluten free graham crackers are thicker and more dense than a traditional graham cracker. They have a good flavor. We all thought it had a hint of that gingersnap flavor to them.I purchase them with the intent of making s'mores as my daughter was really missing that sweet treat. These worked really well for s'mores, but I think that I'll get the plain ones next time as the cinnamon sugar makes these a little too sweet when paired with chocolate and marshmallow. We'll just use these for snacking.

I received this faucet for free to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.We're currently living in a rental property, and the kitchen faucet that came with the property was horrible for someone who is constantly working in the kitchen. Recently, the faucet had started to leak due to mineral build-up. Our landlord said we were on our own if we wanted a new faucet. When we rent, I generally change out the faucet for one that works for our needs. I want something that looks nice, is affordable, and has great function.The most difficult part of the installation of this faucet was removing the old one. The old lines and fittings were all corroded which was a pain when the under-the-sink cabinet is small. Once I removed the old faucet, the installation of the new faucet was straight forward and fairly easy. The included instructions were easy for me to follow. Because the instructions were generic for their faucet lines, there were a few inconsistencies on how to do some things, but I didn't find it to be a big deal. I actually like the style of the weight on this hose as it doesn't require any tools to remove, adjust, and install it.The faucet comes with pretty much everything you need for installation including supply lines and plumbers tape. You will just need some basic tools like an open wrench, screwdriver, and socket. You may also need silicone caulk to seal around the faucet (if desired).The faucet does not come with a base plate, so if you have multiple openings in your sink, you'll either want to add soap dispensers (like I did) or purchase a base plate to cover the additional holes. For ease of use, I installed the faucet handle at the front of the unit as having it at the side when using soap dispensers made it a little tight. My family also likes it up front as it makes it easy to use when your hands are messy.The faucet is roughly 20.5" from the base to the highest point. It extends roughly 10" from the nut in the back to the largest point on the sprayer when attached to the arm. The faucet with the arm rotates freely which gives a lot of flexibility in use of the unit. I like that if I need more space around the sink for large pots, I can swing the arm to the side and the sprayer can just retract to the upper "spring". The button on the sprayer head is a nice size which makes it simple to switch quickly to the sprayer mode. We have much better water pressure with this faucet than we did with our previous unit.Overall, we're all enjoying this new faucet. It looks great in the kitchen and works well.

The install on this is straight forward and doesn't take very long with simple tools. It looks good when installed, and more importantly, it works well for providing protection from dust and hay. (We have a windshield, and driving on dirt roads with just the windshield creates quite the dust storm inside the RZR.)The only negative for me is the fact that all of these come with cutouts now. Since I don't need the cutouts with my RZR, I basically have unnecessary open spaces which is a bummer. It's definitely not a deal breaker, but it's something worth mentioning for others in my situation.You can see the cutouts in my image. Yes, it's dusty as we use the RZR 800 daily.

I received a free screen protector to provide feedback based upon my experience with it.Recently, I purchased a 7" Kindle Fire for my daughter after her old tablet died. We've always used the wet application screen protectors on our phones and tablets, so I immediately went looking for one that would fit my daughter's new Fire. Shortly after my search began, I was given the opportunity to receive this one, so I figured that I would give it a try even though it wasn't our normal brand.I was pleased with the ease of installation. While I may just be getting better at installing these, I felt this one went on easier than ones in the past. After cleaning the screen really well, I was able to get it on without bubbles by using the enclose squeegee. I have one small mark in the corner where a dog hair got between the screen protector and the tablet. When I went to remove it, I forgot to wet my fingers first which caused a slight mark in the sticky surface of the tablet. Since it doesn't cause any issues due to location, I chose to leave well enough alone and not try to repair it.After allowing it to sit the required number of hours prior to use, we found that there was only a slight decrease in the sensitivity of the screen. My daughter is quite pleased that the screen is now protected. If the screen protector does get damaged, the company has a guarantee, so we can get a replacement which I like.The screen protector covers almost the entire screen. It's just slightly shy of going all the way to the edges which is fine. The opening for the camera lines up just right.

I received mixed reactions from my dogs on this toys dispenser. They love their Kong toys, so I thought this would be a hit. Unfortunately, my one dog wanted nothing to do with it, and the other dog thought it was okay. He pushed it around and dispensed the treats as he wanted them, but then he completely ignored it. Basically, he did the minimum he could to get the reward. It appears that both dogs prefer the softer material that the Kong is made of rather than the hard plastic of this toy.That being said, this dispenser is well made. It's colorful and rolls around well over different surfaces. It's roughly 15 1/4" in circumference with 2 roughly 13/16" diameter openings. You don't want to put in anything wet/sticky as it would be difficult to clean out the interior, but the exterior is easy to clean as it's not porous. It has 3 pieces - a main ball with two moving caps, but it doesn't come apart for cleaning.

I purchased this at half off to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.My original intent with this balaclava was to wear under a motorcycle helmet to provide some protection from the dust that gets kicked up while riding in dirt. I could easily pull it up over my mouth/nose while driving or pull it down when it got a little too warm. It provided good protection. While the ponytail feature is nice, I found it didn't work for me with the helmet due to the high placement on the head.What I did find is that this was nice for a base layer when the temps started to drop. When not wearing a helmet, the ponytail hole worked nicely for keeping my hair off my neck. (It even works for my daughter who has really thick hair. She too wishes that the ponytail hole was lower on the balaclava as she doesn't wear her ponytail that high up on her head.) The ability to convert it, so it doesn't have to be worn over the head is a nice feature. It stays in place better than a scarf when you're actively working outdoors.The balaclava is well made and provides good protection from the wind/dirt. It works well in the heat as it breathes nicely. It cleans up well and doesn't shrink in the wash.

I purchased this at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.My husband has a heavier weight balaclava, but he wanted one that he could wear under his motorcycle helmet. He needed something that would protect from the wind/dust, but not be too warm in hot weather. This one fits nicely and works well as it has a longer neck which allows it to be tucked inside of a shirt/jacket. It stays in place and doesn't move. While the material is stretchy, it does not stretch out after repeated use. It's breathable, but provides protection from the elements while riding. It's well made and washes well.

I purchased these to use with my Hamilton Beach Countertop Oven. I wanted to be able to continue baking and cooking when it was hot or when I didn't want to use the large oven. At 13" x 9 1/2" x 1 1/8", they are a perfect size to bake and cook in the toaster oven. For baking, I use with parchment paper, so clean-up is quick and easy. I've found that I get even baking with these baking sheets. For cooking, I don't line them. Unless I'm cooking with something really sticky, the pans are easy to clean up. If I cook something sticky (think honey chicken or bbq), a little soak and a good scrub cleans them up nicely. I wash them both by hand and in the dish washer with no issues. I used these almost daily for a little over a month, and other than having a more dull finish, they look great.

I purchased this cookie cutter set at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with them.This piece set of roughly 3" cookie cutters is basically an upgraded version of your traditional metal cookie cutters. They have a silicone top which makes use more comfortable. The silicone top can be removed for easier cleaning of the metal cookie cutters. There are no small areas in these cookie cutters which means no pieces to break off. I was even able to use them with brownies. The set contains some of the most traditional cookie cutter shapes - heart, "flower", gingerbread man, and star. They clean up nicely after use, but you won't want to leave them sitting in water as they will rust over time.

I purchased this scarf at a half-price discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.My daughter thought this looked like a modern twist on the classic doctor who knit scarf, so she totally wanted it for this winter. It can be used as either a scarf or a shawl. It's roughly 68" long without the fringe and 24" wide. It is really soft with some stretch to it.She's thrilled with the look, color, and style of the scarf. It feels great against the skin which is important to my girl as she has very sensitive skin.

I received this hat half off to provide feedback based on my experiences with it.My teenage daughter loves to wear hats. In the summer, she's all about caps while the cool weather draws her towards cute, warm hats. When she saw this hat, she thought it was adorable and would be a perfect addition to her hat collection.This hat looks better in person than it does online. She loves that she can wear her hair in a braid, french twist, or ponytail and still be able to have the hat cover her ears. It stretches without getting stretched out. The black buttons look great against the natural, cream. The pom-pom at the top is fun. The hat is well made which is important as she tends to be hard on her hats since she wears them so much.

I received a discount on this set of jars to provide feedback based upon my experiences with them.We use a lot of honey around our house, and I was looking for an alternative to just storing the honey in a mason jar for daily use. (I buy raw honey in bulk and transfer it to mason jars.) Regular honey pots do not keep the ants out, so we've been using mason jars and honey bears. I personally don't care for the honey bears as they are plastic and can't be safely heated for decrystallizing the honey.This honey jar is the best of both worlds. The jar is made of glass while the screw-on top and honey dipper is made of plastic. The handle with the built-in honey dipper has a seal around it which keeps the ants out of the honey jar. I love the fact that I don't need to screw off the lid every time that I need to use the honey. Using a honey dipper rather than a squeeze bottle can be a little more messy - especially with kids, but I actually like it better.The syrup jar has a handle with a built-in silicone brush. I'm using it with coconut oil. Right now, the room temperature is warm enough that the coconut oil is in liquid form. As the temps drop, the coconut oil with start to solidify at room temp, so it's nice to have the glass jar as I can quickly warm it up to melt the coconut oil. Thanks to the built-in brush, I can quickly grease my baking pans without needing to use a spray.While the colors aren't the first choice for my kitchen as I prefer red accents colors, they are nice. The set it easy to clean. The jars including the lids/handles are just over 6" tall with a diameter of a little over 2 1/2". They are a really nice size as they don't take up too much space on the counter or in the cabinet. While they can hold 250 ml, you won't want to completely fill them up due to the displacement caused by adding the dipper/brush to the contents.

I received these straws at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with them.This set of 4 steel straws are just under 8 1/2" long with a diameter of roughly 7/16". They are perfect for thick milkshakes, smoothies, and bubble tea. They are durable and easy to clean (if cleaned right away) with the included straw brush. If they don't get cleaned right away, you can give them a good soak in soapy water and then scrub them with the brush. While you can put them in the dishwasher, I find they don't get cleaned that well, so I stick with handwashing them.My daughter is sensitive to cold, so she found these didn't work well for her with milkshakes as the straw got too cold. On the other hand, she loved them for smoothies though as they aren't as cold. She liked that it was easy to drink even thick smoothies with these straws.If you're looking for an alternative to disposable straws, these straws are a solid option.

We had to give up Cheerios when we went gluten free many years ago, but I'm thrilled that we can now have Cheerios again. While these aren't made with gluten free oats, the company created a process that made the oats safe for those who need to be gluten free. They chose to go this route because there just aren't enough gluten free oats available for their production needs. Basically, they took the approach of see a need, fill a need. My daughter is thrilled to be able to eat Honey Nut Cheerios as they make a great snack when she's working on her studies.Ingredients: Whole Grain Oats, Sugar, Oat Bran, Corn Starch, Honey, Brown Sugar Syrup, Salt, Tripotassium Phosphate, Rice Bran Oil and/or Canola Oil, Natural Almond Flavor. Vitamin E (mixed tocopherols) added to preserve flavor.My family, who has one Celiac and one person who is highly sensitive to gluten, has had no issues eating these Cheerios. Same great Honey Nut Cheerios without having to worry about gluten contamination from other grains.

I received this solar light at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experience with it.We're currently testing out different solar lights to use around our horse stalls, so we'll be able to see to take care of them when the longer nights of winter set in. We needed lights that were solar, had a motion sensor, and provided plenty of light for feeding and other routine chores. We also needed to make sure that it would provide light in both the evening and the morning which means it needs to hold a charge throughout the night and into the early morning hours.This particular solar light looks nice. It has a slim, classic look. The casing has proved to be durable. This light, unlike some other solar lights, hangs on a single screw (like you would see with a picture), so you can easily take it down and change the setting if desired. You don't need to uninstall it to make changes. It only has two settings - on and off. When on, it has a dim light until the motion sensor picks up movement. It then provides a bright light. This light isn't super bright compared to other lights on the market, but it does provide plenty of light to work by. I like that it provides a dim light at all times when it's dark. It works best in pass-through areas where you want a little light at all times and a brighter light when you're working.We do not get a lot of rain here, but we do have harsh sun and extreme heat. This has held up well to the sun and heat. We get plenty of sun, so it is fully charged by the time the sun sets. Because of this, it provides the light that we need when we need it.

I received this set at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experience with them.I wear my hair up in a top bun most days of the week as it's a quick way to keep my long hair out of my face. Once you get the hang of using these bun makers, they are a quick and easy way to make a secure, classy bun. I like these over the traditional sock method. I like the small bun maker (3") for my hair, and the large bun maker (4") works best for my daughter who has thicker hair. The medium bun maker (3.5") works for both of us.Use is simple. You just put your hair in a ponytail, pull the bun maker to towards the ends of the hair, evenly spread the hair around the bun maker, and slowly roll the bun maker towards your head while tucking and spreading the hair around the bun maker. It takes a few times to really get it down, but once you get the hang of it, it's easy and quick. It holds the bun securely in place. You can create a messy bun or a smooth, classic bun depending on how much time you take to smooth the hair as you roll the bun maker.

While I prefer the from-scratch, simple ingredients of traditional caramel - milk, sugar, butter, I know that most store bought caramel is going to have some preservatives and other ingredients in it, so unless I want to make my own caramel (which I do sometimes), I'll have to deal with at least some added ingredients. This 2.25 lb. tin includes 3 types of caramel soft cremes: caramel, butterscotch and caramel, and caramel and vanilla. The ingredients are:BUTTERSCOTCH AND CARAMEL SOFT CREME INGREDIENTS:CORN SYRUP; SWEETENED CONDENSED MILK (MILK; SUGAR); HIGH FRUCTOSE CORN SYRUP; PALM KERNEL OIL; SUGAR; GLYCERIN; DAIRY BUTTER (MILK); CONTAINS 2% OR LESS OF: GLYCERYL MONOSTEARATE; SALT; NATURAL FLAVORS; LECITHIN (SOY); DISODIUM PHOSPHATE; TOCOPHEROLS (TO MAINTAIN FRESHNESS); SODIUM CARBONATE; CARAMEL COLOR; ARTIFICIAL COLOR (YELLOW 5; RED 40; BLUE 1)CARAMEL SOFT CREME INGREDIENTS: SWEETENED CONDENSED MILK (MILK; SUGAR); CORN SYRUP; HIGH FRUCTOSE CORN SYRUP; PALM KERNEL OIL; SUGAR; CONTAINS 2% OR LESS OF: DAIRY BUTTER (MILK); GLYCERYL MONOSTEARATE; SALT; LECITHIN (SOY); DISODIUM PHOSPHATE; SODIUM CARBONATE; TOCOPHEROLS (TO MAINTAIN FRESHNESS)VANILLA AND CARAMEL SOFT CREME INGREDIENTS:CORN SYRUP; SWEETENED CONDENSED MILK (MILK; SUGAR); HIGH FRUCTOSE CORN SYRUP; PALM KERNEL OIL; SUGAR; GLYCERIN; DAIRY BUTTER (MILK); CONTAINS 2% OR LESS OF: GLYCERYL MONOSTEARATE; SALT; NATURAL FLAVORS; LECITHIN (SOY); DISODIUM PHOSPHATE; TOCOPHEROLS (TO MAINTAIN FRESHNESS); SODIUM CARBONATE; CARAMEL COLOR; ARTIFICIAL COLOR (YELLOW 5; RED 40; BLUE 1)The classic tin looks nice for gift giving or for storage. It's 5 1/4" tall, 7 1/8" in diameter, and 22 1/2" in circumference. Each of the caramels have a slightly different wrapper. The caramel has a solid wide stripe while the other two have small stripes. The butterscotch caramel and vanilla caramel are a little difficult to tell apart as the stripes vary only a little. The wrappers do state the type of caramel in addition to the stripes.The caramels themselves are very soft, and they melt in your mouth. My favorite is the traditional caramel. While I'm not thrilled with all of the ingredients, the caramels still taste good. I prefer a soft, chewy caramel, and these fit the bill.

I received these clippers at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experience with them.My husband loves these nail clippers. He has larger hands which makes a lot of nail clippers seem rather small. At roughly 3 1/8" x 5/8", these clippers provide plenty of surface area for him to hold. The sides have a nice rubber grip. The clippers even have a built-in nail file. The nail file is quite aggressive, so it's not something that you'll use all the time. The clippers are sharp and have no problems clipping even tough nails.

I received these glass bottles at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experience with them.These 18 oz glass bottles are roughly 9" tall with a 2 1/2" diameter base and a circumference of 8 1/2" without the sleeve. The opening is approximately 1 1/8" in diameter. The set of 2 glass water bottles comes with 2 neoprene sleeves - one pink and one green. The neoprene sleeves have a carrying loop which is great when you're on crutches or when your hands are full. They protect the glass bottles from bumps and bangs. The cap is watertight thanks to the rubber gasket. The bottles are easy to clean if you clean them right away. Since the opening is really big, you'll need a bottle brush to give them a good scrubbing. You can fit small ice cubes in the opening, but not regular size ice cubes.These bottles are a nice way to make sure that you are getting the liquid you need for the day. Just fill them up at the beginning of the day and grab them for at home or on-the-go drinking instead of disposable water bottles. They easily fit in a standard cupholder or in the water bottle pocket of most backpacks.

I received a free product in exchange for feedback.I thought this would be a good inexpensive mp3 player for my daughter to take on her trip and toss in her backpack. The idea was that if something happened to it, it wouldn't be a costly loss. She's great about taking care of her things, but stuff can happen when you're constantly on the go.This mp3 player is light weight at only 1.2 oz and small at 3 1/2" x 1 5/8" x 3/8". It has good volume. (No built-in speaker. Must use with headphones or external speaker.) My daughter got nearly 8 hours of use out of a full charge which was actually better than expected. It comes with a 16 gb micro-usb card. This is definitely a plus as a lot of times, you need to purchase the card separately.The buttons are stiff and can be a bit finicky. There are definitely limited options for music as it doesn't have shuffle or random play options. You need to use your computer to organize the songs and put music on the player. We put the albums in different folders, and we also made playlists in different folders. With the technology that we have now, the interface is rather clunky. The screen looks pixelated, so watching video is really not an option even though the ability is there with this player.The mp3 player comes with the necessary mini usb cable. Since virtually everything else we have uses a micro usb cable, it's a bit of a pain to need to carry around a separate cable for this. There are also a set of basic headphones included, but my daughter used her own as she doesn't like the earbud style headphones.What's the verdict? My daughter actually uses this mp3 player on a regular basis. She's found ways to work around the clunky interface that works for her. It's a very basic, lower end mp3 player. In this price range, you can't expect to get all the features that come with a top of the line mp3 player. It's similar to the basic mp3 player that I purchased for myself earlier in the year when I wanted something that I could use in situations where I didn't want to ruin my higher end player.

This particular Burt's Bees baby set comes with tear free shampoo and wash (8 fl oz), nourishing lotion (6 oz), diaper rash ointment (3 oz), and buttermilk soap (0.8 oz) all packaged in a keepsake box. The keepsake box is 7 1/4" x 7 1/4" x 2" and features a window on the top of the box where you can place a picture. It has a magnetic closure. It's definitely meant for storage of keepsakes and not the items being used. It also comes with 2 $1.50 coupons - one for mom and one for baby.Ingredient List:Tear Free Shampoo & Wash: aqua (water, eau), decyl glucoside, coco-betaine, lauryl glucoside, sucrose laurate, glycerin, parfum (fragrance), betaine, sodium cocoyl hydrolyzed soy protein, coco-glucoside, glyceryl oleate, sodium chloridexanthan gum, glucose, citric acid, glucose oxidase, lactoperoxidase, limoneneDiaper Rash Ointment: Zinc Oxide 40%, prunus amygdalus dulcis (sweet almond) oil, beeswax, lanolin, ricinus communis (castor) seed oil, simmondsia chinensis (jojoba) seed oil, butyrospermum parkii (shea) butter, glyceryl rosinate, olea europaea (olive) fruit oil, hydrogenated castor oil, olea europaea (olive) oil unsaponifiables, anthemis nobilis flower oil, lavandula angustifolia (lavender) flower, lavandula hybrida oil, calendula officinalis flower extract, rosmarinus officinalis (rosemary) leaf extract, tocopherol, glycine soja (soybean) oil, canola oilNourishing Lotion: aqua (water, eau), glycerin, decyl cocoate, helianthus annuus (sunflower) seed oil, cera alba (beeswax, cire d'abielle), butyrospermum parkii (shea) butter, polyglyceryl-3 stearate, glyceryl stearate citrate, cetyl alcohol, butyris lac (buttermilk powder, babeurre en poudre), cocos nucifera (coconut) oil, olea europaea (olive) fruit oil, vitis vinifera (grape) seed oil, aloe barbadensis leaf juice, chamomila recutita (matricaria) flower extract, calendula officinalis flower extract, centaurea cyanus flower extract, tilia cordata flower extract, rosmarinus officinalis (rosemary) leaf extract, anthemis nobilis flower extract, hypericum perforatum extract, parfum (fragrance), tocopherol, sucrose stearate, xanthan gum, glycine soja (soybean) oil, canola oil (huile de colza), lactic acid, citric acid, glucose, sodium chloride, sodium stearoyl lactylate, sodium benzoate, magnesium aluminum silicate, phenoxyethanol, glucose oxidase, lactoperoxidase, limoneneButtermilk Soap: vegetable soap base, parfum (fragrance), butyris lac (buttermilk powder, babeurre en poudre), avena sativa (oat) kernel flour, CI 77891 (titanium dioxide), limoneneThe biggest problem with this set, for me, is that it is not fragrance-free which can cause issues with many babies (and parents) with sensitive skin or who are sensitive to smell. In my experience, it's not a good set for those who suffer from eczema.I like the products that come with it as it's a nice starter set, and the keepsake box is a nice plus. For those who don't have issues with fragrance, then this would be a good starter set.

Even though this is a small breed version of the wet dog food, we used it with a senior, large breed dog that was having some health issues. She didn't want to eat her regular food, so we went with this to try to encourage her to eat. At first, she only ate a little, but slowly, she started to get a little more strength from eating again. Eventually, she was happily eating the entire container. In fact, she likes it so much that she no longer wants to eat her dry dog food. She loves turkey and vegetables, so this was the perfect variety for her.

We mixed this wet dog food with our dogs' dry food as a treat for them. Unlike the sweet potato/fish variety, they both enjoyed this flavor of the wet dog food. It's not grain-free, but the grains are mild enough that it doesn't bother their sensitive stomachs.

We combined this wet dog food with our dog's dry food as a treat for the dogs. They both normally love sweet potato, but I wasn't sure if they would like the fish. The reception was a hit or miss with our dogs. The one dog really liked it while the other ignored the food. Eventually, he tasted it, but he just picked out the dry dog food instead of eating the entire bowl. The food agreed with my dog's sensitive stomach.

I received a small discount on this compost bin to provide feedback based upon my experience with it.Prior to receiving this countertop compost bin, I was using an open bucket for my organic kitchen waste. The problem with this method is the odor and the fact that it attracts bugs. This compost bin has 3 parts plus a filter. It has the main can, the removable plastic can, and the lid. The filter fits inside the lid. The lid just sits on top of the can; it's not a sealed lid. It would have been nice to have a lid that sealed tight, but even without that feature, it does keep the smell inside of the can, and I haven't had any issues with bugs getting into the compost bin.The compost bin is a nice size for the countertop. It's roughly 9.5" tall with a base diameter of 6.5". The removable plastic liner makes it easy to empty. Not to mention, the plastic is much easier to clean than metal, and there is no concern of corrosion.The only real issue that I have with this bin is that it has a pink hue rather than being a true red. I really like the compost bin, so I'll probably just repaint it to match the red that I already have in my kitchen.

I was pleased when I saw that this mix included millet and teff rather than just using the traditional rice or brown rice flours. If you're used to using rice flours, you'll probably find that the teff and millet smell and taste a little different. My family likes these flours, but not everyone enjoys them. I do think that because teff has a stronger flavor that it works better in savory baked goods rather than sweet baked goods. What this meant for my family is that this muffin mix met with mixed reviews.This is a plain mix, so you'll need to add your own mix-ins. I made both blueberry and chocolate chip muffins. For the first batch, I made them exactly as the directions dictated. The muffins were a little dry but not crumbly. They had a pretty good flavor and texture. The batter was fairly thick, so the next time I added another egg and a little more liquid and used butter instead of coconut oil. This resulted in a more moist, light muffin.I think that this particular muffin mix (with the above mentioned adjustments) would work better for savory muffins rather than the sweet ones that I made. It's not a bad muffin mix, but it wouldn't necessarily be my first choice for muffins either. With the adjustments, it makes an okay sweet muffin that holds together well and isn't dense.

This was a big hit with our older dog who was experiencing some health issues. It was recommended that he transition from his regular cheaper brand to a brand with better ingredients due to his health issues. By the time that he was fully transitioned to this food, he was feeling better, experiencing a more regular stool, and had more energy. It was a pleasant change. Since he did well with this brand and likes it, the plan is to continue with it. It isn't a grain-free formula, but it appears to still be gentle for a sensitive stomach.

I purchased these produce bags at a discount in exchange for providing feedback based upon my experiences with them.When purchasing these bags, I didn't realize how big they would be - in a good way. The size varies some from bag to bag. The sizes were as follows:15 1/4" x 11 3/4"14 3/4" x 12"14 3/4" x 11 3/4"15" x 11 3/4"14 1/2" x 12"They are made of a fine nylon mesh. They have a toggle to secure the cinch sack. Each sack has a different color tag with coordinating cord. The edges were left raw (not surged), so they may unravel in the long term, but so far, they are holding up to use and washing. I would have preferred a finished/surged seam. They can stain if you use them for berries, but this is typical of pretty much all mesh bags. Each bag weighs roughly .57 ounces. (Some variation can be expected due to the slight variation in size of the bags.)

I purchased these for my daughter's rustic, country-style room. She loves horses, and I wanted something that looked classy without costing too much. We found some great rustic, barnwood frames on sale that made these prints look even better. The collage of the 4 prints in the barnwood frames looks great against the barn red walls.

I purchased this water bottle at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.I've been wanting to try out an infuser bottle for some time, but I didn't really want a plastic bottle. I had never seen a glass infuser bottle locally, so I was pleased to find this one here. It's 20 oz. which is a great size especially for the summer months. While flavored water is great, I'm currently using it to make flavored homemade lemonade. I love being able to add various fruits to the basket without needing to make a syrup to add to the lemonade. Delicious! It also works really nicely for making flavored iced tea which is something my husband enjoys.The silicone sleeve not only protects the bottle, but it also provides extra grip and comfort to the glass bottle. The flip cap is watertight, and I had no issues with leaking even when I was shaking the bottle. The cap, while well made, feels cheaper than the bottle itself. Maybe it's because I've gotten used to using a bottle where the opening is silicone, so it's a little nicer for drinking. The finger loop is a nice feature which I use all the time because of being on crutches.The basket insert is nice, although a bit tricky to clean at times. It's large which means that you can put a good amount of fruit in it, and it goes down quite far into the bottle. It has a small metal handle for easy removal from the bottle. It also has its own cap to keep the fruit contained while you drink. A small gasket keeps it from rubbing around the rim keeps it from rubbing the glass bottle.Overall, I like this glass water bottle with infuser basket. The design is well thought out, and it looks nice. Other than the basket, it's very easy to clean.

I received these socks for free in exchange for feedback based upon my experiences with them.Wool socks aren't what they used to be. You can now have comfy wool socks that aren't scratchy. These socks are a blend of 40% wool, 55% polyester, and 5% spandex. They are warm and soft - perfect for the fall and winter weather. They hold their shaped well and thanks to the spandex, they do not fall down. They are good stocks for lounging or hiking. They look cute with low profile boots, but they are a little too short for taller boots like riding or cowboy boots.I wear a size 6.5 shoe, and these socks fit perfectly. They do shrink a little in the wash which is something to keep in mind.My daughter, who is super sensitive to scratchy clothing, thought these socks would be uncomfortable as the outside feels a little scratchy, but after putting them on, she realized that the inside of the socks is actually soft and comfortable.Think ahead to Christmas... these socks would make great stocking stuffers as you can split up the set of 5 pairs and give 1 pair to 5 different people as they are individually packaged.

I was originally searching for a shark tea infuser for my daughter when I came across this adorable set of manatee tea infusers. I was going back and forth between these and the shark ones when I was given the opportunity to purchase these at a discount in exchange for my feedback, so I went ahead and purchased the manatees rather than the sharks.I have to give props to the company for their clever play on words with the name of their tea infusers. Calling them Manateas is a fun and playful idea. These expressive, cute silicone manatee tea infusers add a little whimsy to the tea making process. More importantly, they work.The Manateas are easy to fill with your favorite loose tea. My daughter drinks raspberry leaf tea every night. She likes that these are easy to fill, empty, and clean. Emptying them literally just takes a flick of the manatee tail. Because they are silicone, they wash off/out quickly and easily. The holes are a little larger than what you would have with a mesh tea ball but in line with other non-mesh designs. Even so, only a few very small tea leaves made their way into the cup, and honestly, the results were pretty typical of the vast majority of tea balls. My daughter was very pleased that she could have a functional and adorable tea infuser.The Manateas attach to the top of the cup which means they are easy to take out of the cup/mug when you're done steeping the tea.My daughter is thrilled with this set and uses it on a nightly basis.

I was in the process of researching solar lights to install the horse stalls as it is starting to get dark earlier, and we need light for taking care of the horses in the evening when I was given the opportunity to purchase this light at a discount to test out and provide feedback based upon my experiences.I like that this light has 3 different settings - off, dim, and high light. I set it on the dim setting, so it would become bright only when the motion sensor was set off. It provides a great deal of light. It floods the hay area, so it was easy to see to feed the horses after dark. Once you stop moving, it goes back to the dim setting. Small animals as well as coyotes due set off the light, so you probably don't want to have this where the light shines directly at your neighbor's window. For us, that's not as issue. The light is very bright, so you don't want to look directly at it at night or you'll experience night blindness.We have mostly sunny days, so the light gets a good charge during the day and lasts throughout the night. We live in the desert, so while tons of rain is not an issue for us, harsh sun and high temps are an issue. So far, the unit is holding up well to the desert environment.The negative with this light is that the switches are on the back of the unit, so once you install the unit with the included screw, you can't change the setting unless you uninstall the light. Screws (included drywall anchors) are included in the box.

I received these towels at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experience with them.Between my husband and my daughter, we have a lot of traveling going on around our house. My husband recently took the large bath towel with him on his trip and fell in love with it. He really appreciated that, even though the towel is very thin, it absorbs a lot of liquid which means it dried him off very quickly. The towel itself dried quickly which is also important when you're on the go. It's soft against the skin and actually gets softer after washing. It takes up very little room and weight in the luggage or backpack - making it the perfect towel for situations where space and weight are at a premium. It comes with a cinch bag that has ventilation at the bottom.The smaller sport towel gets tossed in his pack for when he goes to the gym or takes a run. It's compact, so he doesn't have to worry about it taking up too much valuable space.The bath towel is approximately 51 1/2" x 31". The storage bag is 10 1/2" x 5 3/4". The bath towel weights roughly 8.2 ounces in the storage bag.The sport towel is approximately 23 1/4" x 15 1/4". The storage bag is 7 1/2" x 4". The bath towel weights roughly 2.3 ounces in the storage bag.The towels have surged edges, so you don't need to worry about any rough/unraveling edges. It's a very simple, but effective design. They hold up well in the washing machine. The storage bags are also well made with a toggle so the bag will stay closed.

I had previously purchased the Original Nick's Sticks 100% Grass-Fed Beef Snack Sticks which my family really liked. My husband decided that he wanted to try the spicy version. Like the original version, these sticks are made from grass fed beef and real ingredients. They are also gluten free which is a must for us. The main difference between the spicy sticks and the original is the addition of jalapeno. It adds a little heat, but they aren't super spicy.These beef sticks are tender unlike a lot of beef sticks. They have a nice spicy flavor that isn't overpowering. If you're looking for a lot of heat, then these probably aren't the right beef sticks for you. My husband was thrilled to have some spicy beef sticks to take on his trip as they made a great snack.These beef stick are perfect for hiking, camping, snacks, and travel. I'd feel good about adding them to care packages because they're a healthy version of traditional beef sticks.They aren't cheap, but my entire family is impressed with the flavor and quality of ingredients. For us, it's worth paying a little more than you would pay with traditional beef sticks.

This 2-piece luggage set is an affordable option for someone who doesn't want to spend a lot of money on luggage. I purchased this for my daughter's cross country trip. She ended up not being able to use the smaller piece as her laptop didn't fit in it, so she used something else instead. She was a little bummed as she really like the owl pattern and wanted to be able to use both pieces.The larger piece is roughly 21" tall, 12 3/4" wide, and 9" deep (without using the expansion option), so it meets the current carry-on luggage requirements. Fitting a week's worth of clothes (without access to laundry facilities) was extremely tight, but we managed to do it. It has two nice size front pockets on the outside and a mesh zippered pocket on the inside. It has the typical option to expand the depth by unzipping one section of the suitcase. It comes with a diary style lock, but it's not a TSA approved lock. It has a pocket on the back to insert your information.The smaller piece is roughly 11" tall, 14" wide, and 5 deep (not including the front pocket). It has a loop on the back so you can put it over the telescoping handle of the large piece of luggage. It has both a front pocket and back pocket. As I said before, my daughter's 15" laptop didn't fit in the bag, so she didn't use this piece.The larger piece held up really well for her trip and shows very little wear. The zippers held up to the suitcase being stuffed a little fuller than it should have been. They still zip smoothly and freely. Overall, my daughter is quite pleased with her new luggage and looks forward to using it for many more trips.

This is my husband's favorite toothpaste. While it's not completely free of bad ingredients, it is better than many of the traditional toothpastes available. He likes the taste as well as the fact that it doesn't have any fluoride. I was pleased to find these small travel-size version for his trips as it cut down on the space needed in his carry-on bag.It doesn't do much in the way of a whitening toothpaste, but I don't purchase it for that quality.

I received this water bottle at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.This 20 oz glass bottle has a silicone sleeve that, oddly enough, is actually glued to the bottle. Unlike many silicone sleeves, you won't be removing this sleeve for cleaning. The silicone sleeve protects the bottle and provides good grip. I carry it around by the loop, and it bangs against my crutches without any issues.The stainless steel cap has a gasket which makes a water-tight seal. I haven't had any issues with leaking. The cap has a ribbon carrying loop. While I really like the carrying loop, I would have preferred that it would have been silicone rather than ribbon as the ribbon is difficult to clean.The bottle with cap is roughly 9 1/2" tall with an 8 1/4" diameter. The bottle opening is roughly 1 1/8" in diameter. It's easy to clean with just water or soap/water if you clean it immediately. If you allow it to sit overnight and need to scrub it, you'll probably want to make sure you have a bottle brush. Because it's glass, it doesn't hold odors or flavors which means I can use it for a variety of beverages.

I received a discount on this yoga cushion to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.When you're new to yoga, it can be difficult to get your muscles to relax. It can also take some time to learn how to align the spine. If you're uncomfortable, it makes it even more difficult. This cushion allows me to be more comfortable in the seated poses as well as helping me to align my spine. Since it's a little higher than the Mini Crescent Moon Style Cushion it helps open up my hips more which increases flexibility over time.The cushion is roughly 12" in diameter and 5 1/2" high. It is firm yet comfortable and provides a good deal of support. The cover is removable. The zipper goes around almost the entire top of the cushion which allows for easier removal of the cover. The cover (including the zipper) is well made as is the internal cushion. If I had to purchase again, I would probably go with the natural cover as the black attracts way too much dog hair which drives me a little nuts.The cushion has a built-in handle which is nice as I can carry it while on my crutches. The cushion weighs roughly 2.6 pounds.

I received a discount on this yoga cushion to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.I'm fairly new to yoga, so I'm still learning different positions and learning how to become more flexible and relax. This cushion is perfect for helping me properly align my spine while sitting or laying or stretching. It's firm and supportive while still being comfortable. I find it to be a perfect shape and size for me.It's 16 inches wide in the back with a depth of roughly 10" at the deepest point and a height of 3" to 3 1/2". The cushion has a removable cover for easy washing which, around my house, is a really good thing. Since the zipper is around the entire arch, it easy to get to cover on and off. The zipper flows freely. Both the cushion and cover are well made. The cushion even features a handle. It weighs roughly 1.9 pounds.

I purchased this set as I needed small funnels for filling up oil and vinegar bottles. I also wanted something that would work with my essential oils.This 3 piece stainless steel funnel set is perfect for filling oil or vinegar containers. The sizes are roughly:* Large - 2 3/4" diameter opening with 1/2" bottom opening and 3" long* Medium - 2" diameter opening with 9/16" bottom opening and 2 1/4" long* Small - 1 9/16" diameter opening with 3/16" bottom opening and 2" longFor storage, they can nest inside of each other or hang on the included ring.They are strong, well-made, and fairly easy to clean especially if you use a small brush.The smallest funnel works nicely for filling small bottles of essential oils and/or oil blends.

I received this insulated lunch bag kit at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.I personally like to use bento style lunch boxes, but my husband needs something a little bigger. The problem we were running into was that while he needed to be able to carry a bigger lunch, he needed a compact style lunch bag. This lunch bag fits the bill. It is roughly 9" x 6" x 7" not including the handle. It has a handle as well as an adjustable shoulder strap. It comes with two BPA-free, snap-lock containers: 30 oz. and 22 oz. The containers are microwave, freezer, and dishwasher safe. I'm not a big fan on snap-lock containers as the snaps tend to break over time, and I also prefer glass containers. That being said, these containers do work well. They seal nicely and don't leak.My husband ended up using our own glass containers as that is what we store left-overs in. Whether you use the containers provided or your own containers, this lunch bag has plenty of room for your lunch items. My husband takes a main dish, something to drink, yogurt, and snacks with no issues. The bag has a pocket in the bottom/side of the bag for an icepack. The front of the bag features two pockets for your napkin/utensils and snacks.The lunch bag is made of durable water resistant material. It has good insulation. The zipper functions well, and all of the stitching is solid. It feels like it is made to last. It's also quite easy to clean.Overall, it's a well-made, roomy yet compact, insulated lunch bag. My husband loves it and gives it 5 stars. Due to the style and material of the containers, I give them 4 stars and the lunch bag 5 stars.

As soon as this arrived, my dogs got super excited as the squeak was so enticing (and loud). It is definitely an outside toy, so my daughter and husband took the dogs outside. Unfortunately, the ball was too big for my one dog's mouth, but the other dog had a blast. The size of your dog's mouth is definitely something to consider when deciding whether this is the right ball for you. The ball is 7" long with a circumference of about 14.25" at it's widest point.After 3 or so weeks of use, the ball is holding up well against both play and the desert sun and heat. There is very minimal fading of the color. It's gotten softer with the heat.My younger dog, who can't fit the ball in his mouth, still likes to play with the ball as he really likes the squeak it makes. He does get frustrated that he can't get his mouth around it. Of course, the larger dog takes advantage of it and swipes the ball now and again. I think a smaller version would have been perfect for us.

I have a old classic style GelPro that I really like. It's held up well over the years other than the edges curling up a bit. I would not be without a GelPro mat in my kitchen because it makes a huge difference when you're on your feet for extended periods of time. I was really excited to test out this new elite floor mat.The vintage leather look is quite classy, but the thing that immediately grabbed my attention is the new style of the edge. It's a thick beveled edge which means there is nothing for my crutches to catch on unlike the classic style GelPro mat. This mat is thicker and softer than the classic mat. It offers support and comfort when standing at the stove cooking. (I moved my old GelPro mat over in front of the sink.) It really does help with the fatigue that comes with being on your feet for extended periods of time.You don't need to worry about the mat moving around as it has some weight and grip to it. It's easy to clean up if anything spills on it. It's made with a durable material that holds up to the wear and tear of daily life.

I received this bowl set at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experience with the set.This travel bowl set comes with a collapsible double bowl and a single bowl. The double bowls hold roughly 1 1/2 cups of food/water each while the single bowl holds just under 2 cups of food/water. Also included is a carabener clip and a piece for attaching the single bowl to a water bottle. If you, like us, use reusable water bottles, then the water bottle piece won't really be of use to you as it is meant strictly for the disposable plastic water bottles. The double bowl is roughly 13 1/2" X 5 1/2". It is around 1/2" thick when collapsed and 2 1/4" thick when expanded. The single bowl is a little over 5" in diameter and 1/2" thick collapsed and 2 1/4" thick expanded.The double bowl is nice when you have two dogs as both dogs can drink at the same time. For us, this is more of a travel bowl for the vehicle or camping rather than backpacking. We can't use a double bowl for food as the dogs need to be separated by a few feet to avoid them trying to eat each other's food. It also didn't work so well for food/water combo as the food ended up in the water. It did work great when we needed to give both dogs water at the same time. The single bowl works well for tossing in a pack. Both the double and single bowl are light weight.My dogs really like the bowls and have no issue drinking out of them.

These are my husband's favorite pistachios. They are tender and fresh with the perfect amount of salt. Buying in a larger size and making my own smaller snack packs is more economical than purchasing the already made snack packs. I'm unable to find the larger bags locally, so I'm glad I was able to find them here.

This toilet paper is thick, strong, and soft. The quilting aids in absorption and cleaning.I like to buy paper products in bulk, so this is a good way to purchase toilet paper - especially if you're stuck at home with an injury.Note: I have been warned by a plumber friend that you should not flush too much of this paper at once as it can clog the plumbing. It takes a little while to break down, so use with caution in an RV.

I received this at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.I got this for my daughter as she wanted something that was light weight and comfortable that would provide some modesty under some of her shirts/dresses. The lace detailing is stretchy and comfortable. She's sensitive to things that are scratchy, and this doesn't bother her at all. This isn't a highly supportive bra, so she wears a bra under it. She wears this more like a camisole.My daughter is about 5'5" and 120 pounds. It fits her just right. I'm also able to wear it at 5'2" and 135 pounds. It's a little tight on the shoulders, but it's not restrictive or uncomfortably tight.It washes well and doesn't shrink in the wash. It's well made with secure, even stitching and hems. The pads are removable, if desired.

I'm glad I was able to buy these in bulk here because we go through a lot of peanuts. They make great daytime snacks as well as late night cram session snacks for my college students. I've portioned them out into individual portions so they last a little longer. (It's amazing how quickly a large open container can disappear if not regulated at least a little.) I like that Planters uses sea salt with these dry roasted peanuts.These are also wonderful for use in my trail mix. Buying in bulk allows me to make a large batch and then portion it off.The peanuts were fresh, crunchy, salty, and delicious.

Since we don't have a crushed ice feature on our ice maker, I wanted to find an ice cube tray that would create small ice cubes. While not quite as good as using crushed ice, these ice cubes do a good job.I've been using these trays for roughly a 1 1/2 years and haven't had any issues with breaking or cracking. Once the ice cubes are completely frozen, they (for the most part) pop out very easily. Because we like to use a lot of these ice cubes, I empty all of the ice cubes into a tub and make more. If some of the ice cubes don't come out, I run a little water over the bottom of the tray and the rest of the ice cubes release.Because these ice cubes are so small, they don't take very long to freeze.

I received this silicone mold set at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.This fun silicone mold set includes 5 molds: 2 Lego brick molds that feature 10 bricks each, 2 Lego figure molds that feature 8 figures each, and a heart mold that features 15 hearts. I'm attaching pictures for size comparison between real Lego bricks and figures and the chocolate version.The Lego brick molds are perfect for making your own mini candy bars in the shape of Lego bricks. We had a blast making a variety of candy bars - plain chocolate, peanut butter chocolate, coconut chocolate, and nut chocolate. They're a perfect snack size. We just melted the chocolate and spooned them into the molds. For the add-ins, we mixed them into the chocolate prior to spooning it into the mold. Once the chocolate set up, it was easy to pop the chocolate out of the molds.The Lego figure molds are just plain fun. While I did solid color chocolate for our figures, you could easily make them multiple colors. If you're really motivated, you could paint details onto the figures. Once the chocolate was in the molds, I tapped the mold on the counter a few times to get any bubbles out of the chocolate. After the chocolate sets up, it's easy to pop the chocolates out of the mold.I could have made heart chocolates, but I decided to make fun molded butter instead. The hearts are the perfect size for a pat of butter to serve with a stack of pancakes. I allowed butter to come to room temperature and then pressed it into the molds until the heart cavities were filled. It probably would have been easily to melt the butter first, but I didn't think about that until after the fact. I placed the mold into the fridge to allow the butter to harden. Once hardened, the heart-shaped butter easily released from the molds. I just store them in an air-tight container in the fridge to keep them fresh.This really is a fun set of silicone molds. They are easy to clean as you can just invert them for cleaning. You don't need to use a releasing agent. You can also use them as ice cube trays, if desired. Since I want to use these for food, I did not test them out for making crayons.

I purchased these mini hot water bottles for times when I didn't need a full size hot water bottle.These mini hot water bottles are adorable. They are perfect for soothing bumps, bruises, aches, and pains. I've used them with both hot water and with ice water. The screw off lid is leak proof and allows for easy filling of the water bottle. The filling hole is on the small side, so if you want to use ice, you'll need to break the ice up or use small ice cubes. (I like to use the ice cubes made with the Arrow Plastic 00055 Ice Cube Trays.) The fun designs are great for kids or for someone who just wants a water bottle that has some flair.You receive 4 mini hot water bottles, but which ones you receive is random. Each hot water bottle measures 7" x 4.5". The portion you fill is roughly 4.5" x 4".The hot water bottles do smell when you first remove them from the packaging, so you'll want to air them out prior to use. I just set them aside for a few days in an area where the smell wouldn't bother me. I then gave them a quick wash prior to use which took care of all of the residual smell.

These dog toys are adorable, but we're not giving them to our dogs. Our dogs would destroy these soft, stuffed toys in less than a day. (We had previously purchased one of these locally, and it didn't last an hour before the stuffing was out and the voice box was being tossed about.)For Angry Bird fans, these are fun stuffed toys. They can be tossed around without concern of hurting someone as they are really soft. They have voice boxes that make the classic angry bird sounds. Our red bird was missing his voice box, but we're keeping the set anyway as we needed these for an activity right away. The voice boxes move around inside of the stuffing, so you sometimes need to find it if you want to hear the noise.While I wouldn't recommend these for pets if your pup likes to pull the stuffing out of toys, I would recommend them for an Angry Bird fan.

I received a discount on this yoga towel to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.The Joyne Tola Non-Slip Yoga towel is a generous 67.5" x 23.5" which means it's just a little smaller than the Joyne Serenity Non-Slip Yoga Mat. The waffle-weave fabric is comfortable to the touch while allowing you to maintain control of the poses. The other side of the waffle-weave fabric has lots of little grippies to keep the towel from sliding on the floor or yoga mat.I'm currently not doing very rigorous moves due to an injury, but it stays firmly in place when doing the basic poses that I'm working on during my recovery. Having non-slip stability is critical for me right now as I do not need to make my injury worse.The towel is fairly absorbent. It is well-made with even, tight stitches which means that it holds up well to repeated washing.

I received this yoga mat at a discount to provide feedback based upon my experiences with it.The Joyne Serenity Non-Slip Mat is a generous 68" x 24" x 1/4" which gives plenty of room to do pretty much all poses. It stays firmly in place on both hard and soft surfaces. The 1/4" thickness provides a good amount of cushion.I was thankful that this yoga mat did not have a strong chemical smell which has been an issue with some of my other yoga mats in the past. For safety reasons, it's important to wash the mat prior to use - especially if you're using it without a yoga towel. While this is a non-slip mat, it does have some residue that needs to be washed off prior to using it for the first time. I like to use a yoga towel with my yoga mats as it keeps my mat a little cleaner. It's easy to toss yoga towels in the wash. Even without the yoga towel, this mat kept me from slipping during poses which was critical for me as I'm recovering from a severe ankle injury.I'm very pleased with the quality and design of this yoga mat.

I received a free set of trekking poles to provide my feedback based upon my experience with the product.Both my husband and I have retractable trekking poles, but my teenage daughter didn't have a set. Since she isn't a hard core user, we didn't want to spend a lot of money, but we also wanted something that was going to be durable. These poles seem to fit the bill for us.When collapsed, the trekking poles are roughly 22" long. When fully extended, they are roughly 53.5" long. While they are quite sturdy at shorter heights, they have a lot of give in them when they are fully extended. This is fairly normal with trekking poles which is why, when we shopped for poles for my tall husband, we went with poles that were meant specifically for taller individuals.The poles can be used with or without the bells. They can be used with or without the rubber tips. What tips you use depends completely on the terrain where you are hiking.We all liked the anti-shock feature with these poles. The grip is comfortable and the strap has a soft interior. The edges of the wrist strap can be a little scratchy if you don't get them positioned just so. My daughter is really sensitive, so she just used the poles without the wrist strap. (This was the case with our other poles as well.)These are a good set of trekking poles for this price point.

We love our Schleich dinosaurs, horses, and animals around here. This is the updated version of the Schleich Gigantosaurus that my daughter had purchased several years ago. Since the size and style was different, she wanted to add it to her collection. This dinosaur measures approximately 9" x 4" x 6 3/4".The proportions on this newest version are actually better than the previous version. This one is definitely more colorful. My daughter feels that, while the new color scheme is nice, this dinosaur is missing the depth created with paint in the more colorful areas that some of the other dinosaurs exhibit. The less colorful areas have more depth and realism. The molded detail is wonderful.The jaw on the Giganotosaurus opens and shuts. The tongue is 3 dimensional, and there is a lot of detail shown in the mouth. The eyes have a shine to them which makes them more realistic. The dinosaur is heavy and not hollow which makes it more durable.If it gets dirty with play, it's easy to clean. It's great for all ages whether they use it as a toy, a display piece, or a model for drawing.

The toner cartridge was immediately recognized by my printer after it was installed. I've been using this toner cartridge in my Samsung ProXpress M3370FD Laser printer pretty much daily for over 5 months with no issues. The pages have printed cleanly and clearly. Thus far, it's been a good replacement for the factory toner cartridge.

I received a discount on this portable power bank to provide feedback based upon my personal experience with it.This portable power bank is small enough to toss in my purse/pack at only 4" x 2.5" x 1" (rough measurement). It provides enough power to easily charge both my smartphone and my Kindle when I'm on the go without access to my regular charger. The capacity is 7800mAh. It's output is 5V/1A, and its input is 5V/2A. It comes with a short approximately 10" usb charging cord which works for charging the portable power bank from the computer or for charging your device from the power bank. If you don't have extra usb cables, you'll want to make sure you purchase one or more. You can charge two devices at once. I found that charging takes a little longer than with my wall charger, but not significantly longer.By pressing the power button on the portable power bank, you can see how much charge is left in the unit. The 4 lights are very bright blue. I would have preferred that they weren't quite as bright as it can be a bit blinding/distracting at night. I like to charge the power bank at night as it can take some time to fully charge if I drain it.The power bank comes with a drawstring pouch for transport and storage.

I was disappointing by these insoles. I have these in XS but they just don't seem to fit the majority of my shoes. And when I found a show that would fit, it did not provide enough support.Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at nocost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

My mother is disabled and when we are out and about, she often has to hold things in her lap. It is truly annoying and cumbersome. This is a lightweight bag that hangs off the back of the wheelchair. It is perfect to store small items and maybe a wallet (if you are hyper vigilant). It is lightweight and fits well in the wheelchair we have.I do not like the fact that it does not have a zipper. I would love to be able to have a more secure enclosure. The other thing is that if it is not weighed down by something, it my fall off because it is so light.Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

I have never paid much attention to the combs I use. Whatever is cheapest is usually what I get. Eventually, they break off one way or another. I am happy with the quality of this comb. I use it in the shower to de-tangle my hair and I leave it in a wire caddy in the shower. It has fallen many a time. It has not broken. I am surprised with the quality and the strength of the material.Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.I have very fine hair, so I have to use something that will not cause additional damage to the hair. This has worked well for my fine fair.

I use my phone all day long. I sometimes have to charge it twice or three times a day.This is a good case. It is functional and works well. As a case. It is not that good. This case does not offer much protection. It comes apart rather quickly when it falls. As a protective case, it fails. But, as a battery, it is great. Easy to use and fully charges my phone. All that matters.*Disclaimer - Item received for free for my honest opinion.

There are tons of iPhone cases around. I have gone through about 10 as I discard all those that I know (or have been proven) to not be enough protection for my phone. This is a pretty simple case for those with basic needs. That is not me. I need heavy duty protection for my phone.It is an easy on and easy off case. Pretty basic and okay. Not for the heavy duty user but okay for everything else.*DISCLAIMER - I was provided this item for free for the purpose of an honest review.

I had high hopes for these headphones. I was was envisioning using these on my bike rides (on low volume for safety) to read out my stats during my work out (mileage, timing, etc).These headphones are okaish. The back string is long enough for a small head, but might not be comfortable for a large one. The comfort of the headphones is ok and it feels secure.The headphones would be ok but for one issue.  They cut out, a lot. I was listening to an audio book whilst cleaning my home but the audio book kept cutting out. If I can't get these to have a good connection over Bluetooth, they are not good to me at all.*DISCLAIMER - I was provided this item for free for the purpose of an honest review.

My phone falls a lot. I need a a strong protector and this one fits the bill. It is thick and has protected my phone in its many many falls.This is a strong screen protector but it has a few flaws. It has visible scratches and smudges and oil stay on the screen. I have to clean the protector often to keep it clean. It is a small price to pay for the protection.A strong asset in protecting your phone.

I have been using the same yoga mat for about 10 years. It is broken in, doesn't make me slip and I love it. I had not found something of comparable quality until now.I am very picky when it comes to yoga mats and this one meets and exceeds my expectations. The mat has a great color combination. It has great cushioning and it is not slippery.I really like this mat.

I have quite a few items from this brand and I like most of them. These earrings are a definite like. They look well made and are the perfect compliment for your dress if you are going to a wedding or for just about anything. I routinely wear these to work and it compliments most of my wardrobe. Quite a few people have told me they like these earrings. They are small and delicate, just how I prefer my earrings.*DISCLAIMER - I was provided this item for free for the purpose of an honest review.

I have quite a few items from this brand and I like most of them. These earrings are a definite like. They look well made and are the perfect compliment for your dress if you are going to a wedding. These are on the dressy side and excellent to wear for any event.*DISCLAIMER - I was provided this item for free for the purpose of an honest review.

I was very excited when I received this product. It was a great cable that was versatile because it contained the lighting charger and a micro usb one. It was perfect. About 2 weeks after I started using it, the USB part came apart and broke. It was a paid to remove the metal part from the USB port in my computer.So, great idea, great cable in theory but a poor quality product.*Received this product for free for the purpose of a review

I have been using the body wash for about a month now and I love it. It leaves my skin soft and smelling great. The smell lasts the day. Even in the afternoon, I can catch a bit of the scent on my skin.I really like this product. I will continue to use this one. It has made a difference.The key points:Moisturizers - I have noticed a noticeable difference since I started using this. I notice this especially on my legs. They are softer  and not as dry.Scent - The scent lasts throughout the day and I love it.

This pasta is easy to cook. I tried once following the instructions, which require a bit more effort than the pour and leave alone for 10 minutes. I appreciate that I do not have to empty out the water and spend time washing a colander. So the timing comes out to about the same when compared to the traditional method. You just have to wash less dishes with this one.

These are good pacifier clips (even though I absolutely hate pacifies. PSA: it led to super complicated orthodontics for me).Pacifier clips should be easy. Parents are sleep deprived enough, so do not make it that hard, please. It took me a bit to figure out the clip (lift up!!). This is how it should be but they are not. These clips are a bit complicated to open up.They are also too long. Half the size would be great to keep the pacifier OFF the floor, which it my main pet peeve.

I have always liked this brand. I usually get the extra soft or the naturals. Having the Tube-Free option is a plus. If you can get a good price for this, it is a great option. I prefer this brand over Charmin and Cottonelle because it does not clog my toilet (an issue I have a lot with Charmin especially).

This is a nifty flash drive recorder. First of all, it is pretty inconspicuous. It looks just like a regular flash drive. To start recording, you can just switch to the ON button to start the recording.The audio quality is pretty clear, especially if the speaker is nearby. As the distance between the recorded sound and the recording flash drive grows, the worse the recording is, but that is expected. The software is pretty easy to install and to use. This is a great deal.The only issue I have is that the red LED light does not work for me. So, I never know if this is recording or not. Must be a defect.The battery is long lasting, about 12-13 hours.I was provided a free sample for my honest review.

During my last big hike (2 day hike to Mt Greylock) I was carrying a bulky pad. When I first got it I thought it was pretty light. But, the bulk was an issue. This pad was easy to pack and still light. It compacts a lot. I found it very comfortable. It is a big expensive but worth it when you take into account the weight and the comfort.

I don't still know how to feel about this book. I liked it. The characters were honest, raw, real. The book was more about the charcacter and their development than the story itself. This is really about how characters react to their circumstances.

I was not expecting much from the title but I really enjoyed this. It was funny, a quick read and highly enjoyable. Lola and her schemes to get into rehab made me chuckle. Of course, be prepared to suspend reality a bit.

This seemed to be a good idea but it did not execute properly. First, it is way too bulky and has barely any weight. This all translate to toppling over, which defeats the purpose of it all. I put a bottle of wine in the middle and cups (you need adapters for the glasses) and it did not work as well. It is a very flimsy product.

I am a n00b at camping. I have camped once in my life and I did not even take out the tent because we stayed at a lean to. Regardless, I was able to set this up by closely following the instructions. I have only tried this tent during summer conditions and it has worked very well. It is easy to set up. Also, it is not that heavy, it has lowered the weight I carry during my rare overnight hikes.

This is a nice chiffon scarf. The one I have is the coral color. It is a beautiful color and it matches the color in the picture.The scarf comes neatly packaged in a zipped plastic bag. It is a nice quality plastic zipped bag! (I am so reusing it.) It comes folded and no folding lines were visible. This is a good scarf to wear with a nice dress or at work (office attire). It is a chiffon scarf and a big delicate. It is very light so it does not provide any real warmth. Perfect for early fall or late spring. It is a nice complementary accessory for your outfit. I wear scarves a lot. It is often part of my outfit. I have a couple of dozen scarves, yeah a lot! This is a great addition.*Sample received free for the purpose of a review.

This is a fun toy. And I can see this being great for Halloween.The toy is a megaphone that has a siren and a megaphone. It requires 4 double A batteries that are not included. I installed the batteries and proceeded to use the megaphone. It has an on/off button and a light that indicates that it is on.I used the siren and it is pretty loud. The megaphone is pretty decent for the price. It is not loud enough to drive the parent crazy but sufficient to make playing with it fun.This is a good toy. Great for kids and easy to use.Please not that batteries are not included.*Sample provided for free for the purpose of a review.

This dress is perfect for the beach, for a BBQ, or any outdoor activity. It is very light and fits very well. I have a medium sized body, big hips but small bust (33.5/30/40 if that helps) and it fit me very well. This dress is appropriate for many body types well because it is not tight fitting on the bottom.The quality of the fabric is pretty decent and it's super comfortable. Clingy and drapes over your body well.The print is attractive. I did not love the dress when I saw it online. I thought it looked ok but it looks much better in person.I have worn this dress twice. Once for a BBQ and once for an outdoor concert. You can wear it to the beach, but it is honestly nice enough that you can wear it for other activities.Sample received free for the purpose of a review.

I have tried quite a few Yoga towels. Most are slippery for me. This one worked very well. It was smooth on my skin and neither my hands or feet slipped. It provides a great hold for your Yoga poses. It fits nicely over my mat. I used the towel with and without the mat. It worked great either way. I especially like the extra hand towel that comes in this set. It is very useful for workouts.The only issue I have is quality. The towel came with bits of the paper pattern (or whatever it is) still attached to the stitching.

This is more of a style and flirty apron than a functional one. The apron fits me well. It ties on top and the back. It is a cute and sexy apron perfect for a date or a gift for someone getting married. This is not the best built apron, so it is not likely to last. But, it makes for a great gift or for a sexy date

I was just not feeling this book. Maybe it was just a tad too long (about 100 pages too long) or that the characters did not hold my interest. But, every time I picked up this book, I groaned at how many pages I had left. It was good for a while. But, it just kept going and going.

This book by Robyn Carr, and part of the Thunder Point series, revolves around Lanie Carrington, an FBI agent from previous books that I have not read (but will!). Laine is recovering from a gunshot wound in Thunder Point. There she meets Eric Gentry and sparks fly.I absolutely loved the character of Laine. She is all kinds of kick ass and does not mind letting people know she can take care of herself. I love reading about confident and strong women. She is no damsel in distress. She will kick down doors, take names and let you know how outmatched you are. For me, she just made this book a must read.Eric is a good character. His worry over Laine's ability to protect herself is not born out of a chauvinistic mentality, but a real worry that she has a dangerous job, might get hurt (HAS gotten hurt) and he might lose her.I love how the relationship started and progressed. It was a very mature and level headed relationship (with all the hotness that these two created). It was a well written book and an enjoyable read. I read it in a couple of days and have already gotten more from the series.

This is the first book I read by this author. Elise is a Dominant and is unapologetic about it. For her it is an integral part of who she is, not just what she likes. But, Niall does not enjoy that kink. How do they come together and live happily ever after?This is a well written book. The problem with the book is the pacing. It wasn't until page 102 (out of 348) that we finally meet Niall. It just took too long. The author put a lot of effort (and pages) into giving us a full picture of Elise. Her likes, dislikes, wok, relationships, etc. During the first third of the book she is with another guy (sort of).We get to know Elise in detail, a lot. Her views are fully mapped and explored. It is great character development but it did not have to occupy the entirety of the first third of the book. It made the story drag quite a bit.Once we get past two thirds of the book, the story gets a bit better. It is not a page turner, more like a slow burn of a book. It is enjoyable but I don't think it ever really gets to the point where I can't wait to turn the page.

This is a fun game. The setup was very easy, you just need a screwdriver (Phillips). I attached it to a tree in my backyard during a BBQ party. You can keep changing the place where you attach it.I have a rather addictive and competitive personality (not a good mix), so this game is very frustrating for me. Maybe I am not very good at it, but it is harder than it looks. I have only managed to hook the ring once. It was an ok game.
